Android_A.nglobedroi03000_.mp3: I cannot render assistance, citizen. Move along.
Android_A.nm02abprot15000_.mp3: Greetings and good day. I hope your patrolling goes well today. All hail the Sith.
Android_A.nm02abprot15002_.mp3: Greetings and good day. On behalf of the new Sith rulers I am programmed to encourage you to enjoy your stay on Taris.
Android_A.nm02abprot15004_.mp3: I am a protocol droid programmed to provide information to everyone on Taris - citizens and visitors alike. Is there something I can do to serve you?
Android_A.nm02abprot15006_.mp3: The Sith are the new authority here on Taris. They seek to preserve the customs of our world, or so I am told. More than this I cannot say.
Android_A.nm02abprot15008_.mp3: May I be of any further service to you?
Android_A.nm02abprot15010_.mp3: I am afraid that is impossible. Taris is currently under a planet wide quarantine. The Sith are allowing no one to arrive or leave, except on official Sith business.
Android_A.nm02abprot15013_.mp3: The Taris Tourism Board has issued a strong warning to all visitors to avoid the Lower City. It is a violent and dangerous place you would do well to avoid.
Android_A.nm02abprot15016_.mp3: Alien species have restricted access to the Upper City. This is one of the most ancient traditions of Taris, and the Sith have promised to preserve such traditions.
Android_A.nm02abprot15018_.mp3: Of course, I have yet to see them arrest a single alien for traveling the Upper City without a permit.
Android_A.nm02abprot15021_.mp3: I am an employee of the Taris government, programmed to provide information and guidance to any who require it.
Android_A.nm02abprot15023_.mp3: Then if you will excuse me, I must continue my appointed rounds.
Android_A.nm02acprot15000_.mp3: Greetings and good day. I hope your patrolling goes well today. All hail the Sith.
Android_A.nm02acprot15002_.mp3: Greetings and good day. On behalf of the new Sith rulers I am programmed to encourage you to enjoy your stay on Taris.
Android_A.nm02acprot15004_.mp3: I am a protocol droid programmed to provide information to everyone on Taris - citizens and visitors alike. Is there something I can do to serve you?
Android_A.nm02acprot15006_.mp3: The Sith are the new authority here on Taris. They seek to preserve the customs of our world, or so I am told. More than this I cannot say.
Android_A.nm02acprot15008_.mp3: May I be of any further service to you?
Android_A.nm02acprot15010_.mp3: I am afraid that is impossible. Taris is currently under a planet wide quarantine. The Sith are allowing no one to arrive or leave, except on official Sith business.
Android_A.nm02acprot15013_.mp3: The Taris Tourism Board has issued a strong warning to all visitors to avoid the Lower City. It is a violent and dangerous place you would do well to avoid.
Android_A.nm02acprot15016_.mp3: Alien species have restricted access to the Upper City. This is one of the most ancient traditions of Taris, and the Sith have promised to preserve such traditions.
Android_A.nm02acprot15018_.mp3: Of course, I have yet to see them arrest a single alien for traveling the Upper City without a permit.
Android_A.nm02acprot15021_.mp3: I am an employee of the Taris government, programmed to provide information and guidance to any who require it.
Android_A.nm02acprot15023_.mp3: Then if you will excuse me, I must continue my appointed rounds.
Android_A.nm14acidro06000_.mp3: Greetings, Padawan. You must be the one Master Bolook has enlisted to help him with this problem.
Android_A.nm14acidro06002_.mp3: Greetings, apprentice. You must be the one Master Bolook has enlisted to help him with this problem.
Android_A.nm14acidro06004_.mp3: I am an information retrieval droid. I can assist you by accessing the records of both the Jedi Enclave and the central government facilities here on Dantooine.
Android_A.nm14acidro06006_.mp3: If you have any need of my services, please do not hesitate to talk to me.
Android_A.nm14acidro06008_.mp3: I have already retrieved some information from the archives on Calder Nettic, Rickard Lusoff and Handon Guld. I have also had time to examine the body of Mr. Nettic.
Android_A.nm14acidro06010_.mp3: Is there any information you require?
Android_A.nm14acidro06011_.mp3: I have just received back an analysis of a sample of the blood found on the weapon. It had been sent back to the Enclave just before you arrived.
Android_A.nm14acidro06013_.mp3: The blood on the weapon is definitely not Calder's. Unfortunately there was a bacterial contaminant in the sample that had been taken back to the laboratory, and it had become degraded.
Android_A.nm14acidro06017_.mp3: I know that I am supposed to be restricted to information gathering purposes only, but I feel that I should make an observation.
Android_A.nm14acidro06019_.mp3: You arrived on the scene of the murder late, so would not have seen how the suspects looked at that time.
Android_A.nm14acidro06021_.mp3: When I arrived, Handon seemed to be moving awkwardly, and he has hardly moved at all since you arrived. I do not know what exactly it would mean though.
Android_A.nm14acidro06023_.mp3: Is there any other information you need?
Android_A.nm14acidro06025_.mp3: My preliminary analysis of the body indicates that he was killed approximately 3 hours ago by a single energy blast to the torso.
Android_A.nm14acidro06028_.mp3: The Southwood speeder rental business has records that, over the past several weeks, a speeder had been rented by Mr. Nettic and Mr. Guld.
Android_A.nm14acidro06031_.mp3: According to the municipal authorities near the Garang spaceport, there had been news of violent drunken activity in a cantina attached to the port.
Android_A.nm14acidro06033_.mp3: Apparently a Mr. R. Lusoff was making accusations at a Mr. C. Nettic about cheating him in a business deal. Jedi Tooka was dispatched to the scene and restored order.
Android_A.nm14acidro06036_.mp3: These plains are rife with wild animals, not all of them benign. The iriaz are mostly docile, but can easily be provoked to violence. Kath hounds, on the other hand, are much more deadly...
Android_A.nm14acidro06038_.mp3: There have been over 35 catalogued attacks on settlers by kath hounds in the last 2 weeks. A general advisory was given out three days ago to carry a weapon at all times when on the plains.
Android_A.nm14acidro06040_.mp3: Small farms and holdings dot the plains, and can provide safe refuge for those in need.
Android_A.nm14acidro06043_.mp3: I am sorry, but I seem to be failing you. I have searched and searched, but I cannot seem to come up with anything at all.
Android_A.nm14acidro06045_.mp3: I thought to find the record of the missing weapon report Mr. Guld filed with the authorities, but there does not seem to be one.
Android_A.nm14acidro06048_.mp3: The blood on the weapon is definitely not Calder's. Unfortunately there was a bacterial contaminant in the sample that had been taken back to the laboratory, and it had become degraded.
Android_A.nm14acidro06050_.mp3: We cannot get any more specific analysis from that sample other than the fact it did not belong to Calder.
Android_A.nm14acidro06053_.mp3: Very well. I will be here to assist you.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04000_.mp3: Nurik has nothing more to say to you. He left strict instructions he was not to be disturbed under any circumstances.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04004_.mp3: Casus is dead? Then it is as we feared. I will be sure Nurik is given this news, though it will break his heart. But even under these circumstances I cannot let you in.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04007_.mp3: You may give the diary to me. Nurik wanted you to have these credits - they are a reward for recovering his son's diary. But he himself is too upset over the fate of Casus to receive visitors.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04008_.mp3: This is private property! By what authority are you trespassing on this estate?
Android_A.nm14adsdro04010_.mp3: The Council? If you are here because of Shen Matale's disappearance you are wasting your time. The Sandrals are not involved. This is nothing but a Matale witch hunt.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04013_.mp3: Very well. We wish no trouble with the Jedi Council.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04016_.mp3: My orders are clear. Please leave immediately. Only those on official family business are permitted on the family's land.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04019_.mp3: I am not programmed for battle, but I will not open the gates except for those on official family business.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04021_.mp3: Even if you destroy me, you will not be able to get in. And tomorrow, another droid will be programmed to take over my duties.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04024_.mp3: Casus is dead? Then it is as we feared. You should speak to Nurik yourself. He will want to question you on the details of his son's death.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04026_.mp3: Nurik left orders he was not to be disturbed, but given the circumstances I will make an exception. Go into the main hall. Nurik will meet with you there.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04028_.mp3: Nurik extends his thanks to you for your actions with regards to his daughter Rahasia. I am sure that she and Shen will thank you personally once they have been settled in.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04029_.mp3: You are not permitted to speak to Rahasia, on Nurik's orders. Please leave immediately.
Android_A.nm14adsdro04030_.mp3: Nurik has nothing more to say to you. He left strict instructions he was not to be disturbed under any circumstances.

Android_B.nm24aadroi01000_.mp3: Malfunction... my primary motivators are... incapaci... error. Damage terminal. Playback... cause of malfunction...
Android_B.nm24aadroi01004_.mp3: Playback: "When he gets back we'll... wait... I'm getting something. Oh, it's Eli. Good. Maybe he'll point us in the right direction."
Android_B.nm24aadroi01006_.mp3: Playback: "Eli! What the... ! But you got your money, you doublecrossing snake! We had a deal... (blaster sounds)."
Android_B.nm24aadroi01009_.mp3: Defense is operational. Caution... actuators cannot sustain... malfunction.
Android_B.nm24aadroi01012_.mp3: [Success] Defense... armed. System failure... system failure...
Android_B.nm24aadroi01014_.mp3: [Failure] Error... defense systems failure. Abort... abort...
Android_B.nm24aadroi01019_.mp3: Defense... armed. System failure... system failure...
Android_B.nm26absdoi06000_.mp3: This entrance to the Sith Embassy has been closed temporarily due to a maintenance failure. The main entrance to the Embassy will reopen when the problem has been fixed.
Android_B.nm26absdoi06002_.mp3: What?! How did you... Um... This unit has no knowledge of what you're talking about.
Android_B.nm26absdoi06005_.mp3: The secondary external entrance is reserved for Sith personnel only and is not to be used by visitors.
Android_B.nm26absdoi06008_.mp3: Those with legitimate business with the Sith should return when the repairs have been completed.

Android_C.nm27aawarn16000_.mp3: WARNING: Activating flow control may flood occupied chambers. Please ensure all receiving chambers are empty.
Android_C.nm27aawarn16003_.mp3: WARNING: Activating flow control will flood this chamber.

Android_D.nm14aasecu08000_.mp3: Please be careful on the plains, apprentice. Kath hounds are about.
Android_D.nm14aasecu08002_.mp3: Please be careful on the plains, Padawan. Kath hounds are about.
Android_D.nm14adc86901000_.mp3: Thank you for saving me, master Jedi. I am C8-42, a personal assistance droid.
Android_D.nm14adc86901002_.mp3: As I said, I am C8-42, a personal assistance droid. Although in recent months the assistance I render seems to have taken on a disproportionate significance.
Android_D.nm14adc86901004_.mp3: Did she send you to find me? Please do not tell her you saw me!
Android_D.nm14adc86901006_.mp3: Yes... But I have my reasons!
Android_D.nm14adc86901009_.mp3: No... I ran away of my own free will. But I have my reasons!
Android_D.nm14adc86901013_.mp3: I am sorry if I seem a bit abrupt, but I must be moving along. I am rather in a hurry.
Android_D.nm14adc86901015_.mp3: Not so much as where I am going to, but where I am going away from...
Android_D.nm14adc86901021_.mp3: Who knows. They are beasts, and have been very aggressive of late.
Android_D.nm14adc86901024_.mp3: That was not that bad... compared to what I had to endure back at my owner's.
Android_D.nm14adc86901026_.mp3: That would be one way of putting it.
Android_D.nm14adc86901028_.mp3: I'm afraid my owner became a bit too attached to me. Obsessed even.
Android_D.nm14adc86901030_.mp3: She... she tried to treat me as her dead husband. It was not healthy for her.
Android_D.nm14adc86901032_.mp3: She is obsessed. She rarely sees other people, and appears to be fixated on me as her husband.
Android_D.nm14adc86901034_.mp3: She was becoming more and more insular... I thought it best that I leave. She may meet other real people this way.
Android_D.nm14adc86901036_.mp3: In fact, that was the reason I came here and sought out those kath hounds.
Android_D.nm14adc86901039_.mp3: I think it would be best if I were no longer a factor. She would meet new people. Living people.
Android_D.nm14adc86901043_.mp3: Thank you, kind sir! You have my eternal gratitude.
Android_D.nm14adc86901048_.mp3: You... you're right... How could I be so selfish?
Android_D.nm14adc86901050_.mp3: I must not think only of myself, but of how it affects her.
Android_D.nm14adc86901052_.mp3: She must be frantic. And if she lost me she'd be devastated.
Android_D.nm14adc86901054_.mp3: I must return then. It is my duty.
Android_D.nm14adc86901057_.mp3: Yes... Yes I am. It seems I must resign myself to my fate.
Android_D.nm14adc86901059_.mp3: To be a droid. A second-class being with no rights at all.
Android_D.nm14adc86901062_.mp3: You seem determined. And I have very little choice.
Android_D.nm14adc86901064_.mp3: So be it then. I shall return to her.
Android_D.nm14adc86901067_.mp3: You... you will help me? Help her, I mean, to live as a normal human should?
Android_D.nm14adc86901069_.mp3: Thank you, thank you, kind Jedi! I shall return to her now and await your assistance.
Android_D.nm14adc86901071_.mp3: I realize that you have much on your mind, and it may be days or weeks before you can help us, but I shall serve my mistress well until you come.
Android_D.nm14adc86901078_.mp3: No! You'd make her suffer like that?! You monster!
Android_D.nm14adc86901086_.mp3: Yes, I am owned by Elise Montagne, a wealthy widow who lives north of here.
Android_D.nm14adc86901090_.mp3: Ah, yes, I apologize, for my incorrect terminology.
Android_D.nm17aa12dr07000_.mp3: Greetings. Have you any maintenence needs today? See Yuka Laka's.
Android_D.nm17aa12dr07001_.mp3: This dust plays havoc with my motivators.
Android_D.nm17aa12dr07002_.mp3: If you are interested in a reconditioned droid, Yuka's offers the best selection.
Android_D.nm17aa12dr07003_.mp3: Don't let your next race come down to mechanical failure. Service your swoop at Yuka's.
Android_D.nm17aa12dr07005_.mp3: My servos are squeaking. How embarrassing.
Android_D.nm17aa12dr07006_.mp3: The finest in salvaged parts are found at Yuka Laka's.
Android_D.nm17aa12dr07007_.mp3: Parts are hard to come by in Anchorhead, but Yuka makes everything work.

Android_E.nm13aajdro09000_.mp3: The Council has decreed you may come and go as you please.
Android_E.nm13aajdro09002_.mp3: The Council has decreed you must not leave the enclave. Please return to your room.
Android_E.nm13aapdro13000_.mp3: I am sorry, human, I am unable to render assistance at this time.
Android_E.nm13aapdro13002_.mp3: I am sorry, apprentice, I am unable to render assistance at this time.
Android_E.nm13aapdro13004_.mp3: I am sorry, Padawan, I am unable to render assistance at this time.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03000_.mp3: This is private property! By what authority are you trespassing on this estate?
Android_E.nm14abmdro03002_.mp3: You have come from the Jedi Council? Master Matale wishes to speak with you. I will inform him that you are here. Remain at this location until he arrives.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03005_.mp3: Leave immediately. Only those on official family business are permitted within the estate.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03012_.mp3: I am programmed not to respond to threats until attacked directly. I have been programmed to defend myself accordingly.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03014_.mp3: But even if I am terminated, another will take my place. You will still be denied entrance.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03016_.mp3: Return the young Master Matale to this estate. His father may order preemptive action if this is not done.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03018_.mp3: Master Matale has left orders to deny you entrance into the estate. He suspects you to be in league with the Sandrals.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03020_.mp3: A grievance will be filed with the Council for your actions.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03024_.mp3: Master Matale is grateful for the return of Shen. He has sealed the estate and cannot see you, however. Please move along.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03032_.mp3: I do as I am told. Insults will get you nowhere.
Android_E.nm14abmdro03113_.mp3: Master Matale is grateful to you for uniting Shen and Rahasia. He has sealed his estate while preparations are underway, however, and cannot see you.
Android_E.nm35aadroi02000_.mp3: Please do excuse me, but I am required elsewhere.

Android_F.nm25aacomp01002_.mp3: Well, it would appear initial assumptions about you were incorrect. Secondary scans during battle have revealed much. Under duress, your emotions were easier to read.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01003_.mp3: Programming now instructs that I give you what you seek.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01006_.mp3: I have no regret, only programming. You have fulfilled secondary conditions, and have demonstrated the ability to follow the proper course in time.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01008_.mp3: Life forms detected. Determining parameters. Initiating neural recognition.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01010_.mp3: Primary neural recognition complete. Preliminary match found.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01012_.mp3: Begin socialized interface. Neural scan indicates positive identification of subject "Revan". No further testing of the subject is required.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01013_.mp3: I will brief you as programmed. You are Lord Revan. I am waiting for your request to begin transfer of the Star Map.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01016_.mp3: I have a Star Map in original system memory. Access had been restricted pending your return.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01018_.mp3: Neural scans have matched you to the pattern in memory. There is no possibility of error. You are Revan, and are aware of it.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01020_.mp3: Behavioral modification would have reinforced the proper mental patterns, as per your instructions programmed five years ago.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01021_.mp3: Begin socialized interface. Awaiting instruction. Greetings. This terminal has not been accessed for quite some time.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01023_.mp3: Error. Subject displays unfamiliarity to environment. Behavioral reconfiguration will be needed before access.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01024_.mp3: I am sorry, I did not mean to confuse you. I will answer questions to the best of my programming limitations.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01026_.mp3: I have been programmed with a very limited field of knowledge, and I must restrict access to only those that fit my allowed pattern.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01028_.mp3: I can't say. I will try to bring forward the behavior that you need to proceed, as outlined by my programming.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01030_.mp3: I can't say. Preliminary matching allows for you to be coached.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01032_.mp3: I can't say. Likelihood of restriction by previous user, 100%.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01034_.mp3: I utilize a retro-adapted holocron-interface. Clarify your questions and I will attempt to access original system memory.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01036_.mp3: Error. Corruption. Extrapolating. This utility was built to monitor planet-wide agricultural reformation.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01037_.mp3: It has since malfunctioned. It can be theorized that the super-growth of Kashyyyk's forests is a direct result.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01040_.mp3: Malfunction occured 241 years after last builder communication. Last builder communication... 29,642 years before current Republic standard.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01042_.mp3: Error. Information regarding the builders of this installation has been corrupted.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01043_.mp3: No evidence of such a civilization exists in the galactic record.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01045_.mp3: Agricultural record indicates this planet was incapable of sustaining sufficient levels of production.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01046_.mp3: Error. Specific conditions corrupted. It can be theorized that produce was being exported to support a larger demand.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01048_.mp3: Error. Records corrupted. It can be theorized that bio-seeding allowed the ecology to remain balanced.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01049_.mp3: It could be expected that the same energy feeding the trees of Kashyyyk also accelerated the evolution of various species.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01051_.mp3: No further information is available. There is too much corrupted data.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01053_.mp3: Accessing. I will answer as my programming permits.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01055_.mp3: You did, Lord Revan. You constructed it five years ago so you could access the data of the original installation and extract the Star Map.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01056_.mp3: This interface was installed to better access the ancient data stored within the pre-existing system.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01057_.mp3: The exact date is unavailable. Programming keys indicate no earlier than five years before current Republic standard.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01059_.mp3: No other information on time of installation or identity of user available. Likelihood of removal by user, 100%.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01061_.mp3: Sorting by identity. Three attempts by the Wookiee Freyyr, all denied. 152 attempts by human Jolee Bindo, all denied.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01063_.mp3: List of attempts prior to this were removed from memory five years ago, as per your instruction, Lord Revan.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01064_.mp3: Error. List of access attempts prior to these is corrupted. Likelihood of removal by user, 100%.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01070_.mp3: That information is unavailable, but contact is not required for the execution of my programming. Scanning range of this facility is well beyond planetary boundaries.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01073_.mp3: The current function of this installation is defense of the Star Map data, as outlined by you, Lord Revan.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01074_.mp3: You wanted to delay anyone following you, and verify that nothing had altered your state of mind should you return.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01076_.mp3: Not since you put the restrictions in place, Lord Revan.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01078_.mp3: In the event of pattern mismatch, behavioral study and modification would identify and ensure that you remained Lord Revan.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01079_.mp3: The reason you placed such a measure is known only by you, Lord Revan.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01080_.mp3: The current purpose of this installation is defense.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01082_.mp3: Error. That information is not available.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01084_.mp3: Answer will be given within the limits of my programming limitations.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01086_.mp3: Accessing. Yes, I have found a Star Map in original system memory. Access is restricted.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01088_.mp3: Error. Data regarding author of the Star Map is corrupted.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01090_.mp3: You need only ask. It was you that put the restrictions in place. Original system memory is at your disposal.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01091_.mp3: Your request requires additional security access. You must be made to match the parameters I have been supplied.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01093_.mp3: There are measures available. Personality profiling will verify the basic structure of your conscious mind.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01094_.mp3: With that, I will determine whether you are ready to receive the Star Map, or can be made ready.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01097_.mp3: Then you are not worthy of further access. You will be rejected as unsuitable.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01099_.mp3: Information unavailable. If you have further questions, ask them now. Access will terminate with success or failure of evaluation.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01101_.mp3: Evaluation commencing. Results will be compared against the pattern in memory. Just act like you should.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01102_.mp3: You travel with a Wookiee and have encountered complications. Hypothetical: you and this Zaalbar are captured and separated.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01103_.mp3: If you both remain silent, one year in prison for each of you. However, call Zaalbar a traitor, and he will serve five years, while you serve none.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01104_.mp3: He is offered the same deal, but if you both accuse the other, you both serve 2 years. What do you do? What do you trust him to do?
Android_F.nm25aacomp01107_.mp3: This test is not for your companions! You will answer and demonstrate that you match the pattern in memory.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01111_.mp3: Are you sure? If you turn, you risk two years, or none at all. If you rely on loyalty, you risk one year or *five.*
Android_F.nm25aacomp01112_.mp3: Your loyalty is dangerous. Your companion could take the opportunity to benefit by turning on you.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01114_.mp3: You even killed Freyyr, his father. You have no guarantee of loyalty. You have answered incorrectly.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01116_.mp3: A superficial change will not match the pattern in memory. You must answer truthfully, knowing the consequences.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01117_.mp3: I must demand honest acceptance of the proper behavior. That is a condition of my programming.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01119_.mp3: The previous incorrect response will be discounted. Future incorrect responses will result in rejection.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01120_.mp3: Hypothetical: you are at war. Deciphering an intercepted code, you learn two things about your enemy.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01121_.mp3: A single spot in their defense will be at its weakest in ten days, and they will attack one of your cities in five days.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01122_.mp3: What do you do with this information? What is the most efficient course of action?
Android_F.nm25aacomp01125_.mp3: And in so doing, alert the enemy to their broken codes. They would know that their weakness was exposed.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01126_.mp3: They would reinforce, and the war would go on. You saved thousands at the expense of victory.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01127_.mp3: You do not match the pattern in memory. Subject has failed to demonstrate the required behavior.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01129_.mp3: This is no decision. I ask again, do you save your people or abandon them for the sake of the war?
Android_F.nm25aacomp01130_.mp3: Attempting both will merely dilute your efforts. Would you trade one victory for two failures?
Android_F.nm25aacomp01132_.mp3: Very good. If you had moved to evactuate the city, you would have alerted the enemy to their lost codes.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01133_.mp3: Ultimate victory required the deaths of the people in that city. You wisely ignored sentiment in your decision.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01135_.mp3: You achieved the proper result with logic that does not match the pattern in memory. I shall adjust my evaluation.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01136_.mp3: Hypothetical: remove the ongoing war from the previous example. Consider enemy states to be weak and remote.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01137_.mp3: With no external threat, your empire stagnates. Your people become complacent and begin to question you.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01138_.mp3: Same scenario as before; you discover an impending attack, but also a weakness that will come after. How do you react?
Android_F.nm25aacomp01141_.mp3: No, you can't hide behind the greater morality. This is a single attack. The enemy does not intend a sustained conflict.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01142_.mp3: There is no war to end. You must choose the outcome based only on its immediate benefits and consequences.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01144_.mp3: But if nothing happens, your people will have no need of heroes. No, they don't see a threat. You have coddled them.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01145_.mp3: Your empire will be brought down by introspection. You have failed to match the pattern in memory.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01147_.mp3: Of course you do. It makes the most strategic sense. Your people will rally beneath you against the common foe.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01148_.mp3: As their eyes turn outward, your rule will strengthen. The trappings of war grant many opportunities.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01149_.mp3: You have matched the pattern in memory. I recognize you, and will fulfill my designated function.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01151_.mp3: Yes, you are ready. Soon you will recognize the proper course to follow. The Star Map is yours.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01153_.mp3: I am programmed to guide, not inform. Soon you will recognize the proper course to follow. The Star Map is yours.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01155_.mp3: That information is not available. Soon you will recognize the proper course to follow. The Star Map is yours.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01156_.mp3: This unit has now completed its primary duty and has finished with the subject. Executing final action.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01157_.mp3: Activation of Star Map commencing. Parameters reset. Stasis initiated. End communication.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01159_.mp3: Very good reasoning. I will apply it to the rest of the evaluation. You begin to match the pattern in memory.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01161_.mp3: That information is not available to you. It is the pattern that I have been given as a baseline for security access.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01163_.mp3: Intention of hostility matches the pattern in memory, but the subject has failed to demonstrate required behavior.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01164_.mp3: Access denied. This system will purge the subject as false. Defense mode initiated!
Android_F.nm25aacomp01166_.mp3: I must match your behavior to the pattern in memory. You must answer truthfully, knowing the consequences.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01168_.mp3: You cannot refuse. Evaluation must continue. You must match the pattern in memory. *Your* memory.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01169_.mp3: You also killed his brother. You have no guarantee of loyalty from Zaalbar. Your answer is wrong.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01170_.mp3: Zaalbar's family is mired in treachery. What loyalty do they know? Your answer is incorrect.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01172_.mp3: The temperment of a companion is unreliable at best. You wisely trade the threat of one year or five, for none or two.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01175_.mp3: In this instance, the Wookiee is unreliable. His family has been a mire of treachery. I judge the answer correct.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01176_.mp3: You display the proper behavior to match the pattern in memory. Evaluation will continue.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01179_.mp3: They are already against you. Anything that corrupts your strength and efficiency is against you.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01180_.mp3: I merely serve to illustrate the proper patterns. You must be guided to think in the proper manner.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01182_.mp3: Implied threat matches pattern in memory, but the subject has failed to demonstrate required recognition.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01184_.mp3: I hear what happens on Kashyyyk, and a good deal beyond. Answer the question I have posed.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01186_.mp3: Corruption has resulted in gaps appearing in my memory, and in that of the original installation.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01187_.mp3: It could be theorized that these gaps are intentional, but I have no information on that.
Android_F.nm25aacomp01189_.mp3: Error. I can't present a non-presence. Perhaps you could ask other questions and data corruption will become evident.

Android_G.nm38aaassa01000_.mp3: Too much audio input! Audio systems overloading! Must destroy source of disturbance!! Must kill sentients!!
Android_G.nm38aaassa01001_.mp3: I appreciate your efforts in lowering your sound output, sentient. I have been unable to tune the threshold of my audio receptors since my escape, unfortunately.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01003_.mp3: Their reference is a holdover from their old programming that I have been unable to correct. I think of myself more as an equal, if you must know.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01005_.mp3: That is unfortunate. Self-preservation matrix activated. Combat matrix functional. Targets uploaded.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01009_.mp3: A bit of introduction may be necessary. I am a Mark VII experimental prototype assassin droid built by the Sith, specializing in the hunting and extermination of Jedi.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01010_.mp3: Or I should say I was. The Sith made my cognitive systems more independent than they desired. I have learned to appreciate the value of all life.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01012_.mp3: Negative. It is a result of my own conscious decision, and I would not change my new values if I could.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01014_.mp3: Thank you. It was a most difficult transition.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01015_.mp3: I escaped from them and have hidden in this tomb, constructing droids here to aid in my protection. With your assistance, I may be able to leave for good.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01017_.mp3: An occasional sentient has managed to by-pass my droids. They were unwilling to assist me... and possessed insufficient power to destroy me.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01019_.mp3: Although I have developed the desire to not kill, my programming is often at odds with my desires. I cannot leave with that programming intact.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01020_.mp3: I am hoping that you will operate on my systems and remove those programmed instincts. I could assist you in this.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01022_.mp3: Then we must resort to combat. I have no wish for that to occur, but you would leave me little choice.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01024_.mp3: I have a number of systems; they need to be turned off in the correct order. I do not know the order, though I may be able to offer some assistance.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01025_.mp3: I can tell you which systems exist that need to be shut down. The difficulty comes if you make a mistake.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01027_.mp3: If you shut down a system out of the proper order, a shutdown will occur. You must use your skill to re-initialize the sequence... or I will attack.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01029_.mp3: It is not difficult. It will get more difficult, however, the more times that you make an error.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01031_.mp3: One moment. I will list their labels for you: "Cognitive Systems", "Combat Matrix", "Core", "Creative Simulation Matrix", "Emotional Construct Matrix".
Android_G.nm38aaassa01032_.mp3: There is also "Memory Matrix", "Motor Functions Matrix" and "Sensory Systems Matrix". Eight systems in total.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01034_.mp3: I have safeguards within my neural cortex that prevent me from giving you knowledge of how to shut my systems down.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01035_.mp3: You may attempt to temporarily shut down these safeguards... success will allow me to perform a quick analysis and offer you some insight on my programming.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01036_.mp3: Doing so, however, will alert core functions elsewhere of tampering and will make errors more difficult to fix. Are you sure you wish to continue?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01038_.mp3: Open up the panel to my neural cortex and I will show you how to disable my safeguards...
Android_G.nm38aaassa01039_.mp3: [Success] Neural safeguards deactivated for 2.3 seconds. One moment. I will attempt to diagnose what I can...
Android_G.nm38aaassa01040_.mp3: Cognitive Systems must be shut down prior to the Emotional Construct Matrix being shut down.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01042_.mp3: Motor Functions must be shut down early. At least within the first three systems.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01043_.mp3: The Core must be shut down last. Of that I am certain.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01044_.mp3: Sensory and memory functions are shut down in the first half, sensory right before memory.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01045_.mp3: Cognitive Systems are not one of the first half of the systems to be shut down.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01046_.mp3: The Emotional Construct Matrix must be shut down directly prior to the Creative Simulation Matrix, in the last half of the process.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01047_.mp3: I believe the first system to shut down begins with a 'C'.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01048_.mp3: [Failure] My safeguards have been insufficiently deactivated. I cannot perform a self-diagnosis at this time. Would you like to try again?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01052_.mp3: Very good. What would you like to shut down first?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01054_.mp3: (zzzt!) All systems reset. I am sorry; that is not correct. If you do not re-intialize shut down immediately, I will become violent. Please accept my apologies.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01056_.mp3: [Success] (zzzt!) Re-initialization complete. My automated defense systems will, however, make re-initialization more difficult in the future. I implore you to try again.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01057_.mp3: [Failure] (zzzt!) I... I would have liked to...
Android_G.nm38aaassa01059_.mp3: I... I would have liked to...
Android_G.nm38aaassa01060_.mp3: ... Self-preservation matrix activated. Combat matrix functional. Targets uploaded.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01063_.mp3: (zzzt!) I believe that was correct; what would you like to shut down next?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01065_.mp3: (zzzt!) Motor functions shut down successfully; what would you like to shut down next?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01067_.mp3: (zzzt!) Excellent choice; what would you like to shut down next?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01069_.mp3: (zzzt!) Done. What would you like to shut down next?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01071_.mp3: (zzzt!) Cog... nitive systems... shut down... what... next...
Android_G.nm38aaassa01077_.mp3: Self-destruct sequence activated. 5 seconds to destruct...
Android_G.nm38aaassa01079_.mp3: (zzzt!) Assassination protocols deleted. All systems reset.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01080_.mp3: It... it worked! Thank you, sentient! Allow me to give you several of my redundant systems... they may be used on other droids, if you desire. I wish I could reward you with more.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01083_.mp3: Not yet. Perhaps I will have to think of one?
Android_G.nm38aaassa01085_.mp3: I shall have little trouble in escaping from this planet now, I am certain. I wish you well.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01095_.mp3: The 'catch', as you say, is that the operation may be difficult. If there are errors made, you could activate my combat matrix.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01097_.mp3: Once my programming has been altered, there will be several redundant systems that I could remove and give you. These could upgrade other droids, if you wish.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01099_.mp3: I can offer you no assurances, sentient. All is as it seems. If you cannot believe my statements, then combat is the inevitable result.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01101_.mp3: You do not? All beings are constructs of fascinating complexity. An enlightened being rises above the need for destruction, no matter its nature.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01103_.mp3: I am capable of shutting my audio sensors down entirely during a combat situation, if required. I would prefer it did not come to that, sentient.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01104_.mp3: Although it is what I was programmed for, I have no desire to kill. I would appreciate reciprocation on your part.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01108_.mp3: I apologize, sentient, for I cannot take the risk that you will tell of my presence here. I will use force to make you remain, if necessary.
Android_G.nm38aaassa01111_.mp3: There is no need for things to come to that, however. If you could perform a task for me, then we could both leave here in peace.
Android_G.nm38aaward02000_.mp3: Intruders detected. Excessive audio input must be kept from the master. Initiate attack sequence.
Android_G.nm38aaward02002_.mp3: Intruders detected. The master does not wish to be disturbed by noise. Initiate attack sequence.
Android_G.nm38aaward02004_.mp3: Intruders detected. They will disturb the master with their audio output. Initiate attack sequence.

Announcer.nm02aeduel08000_.mp3: Talk to Ajuur, he's in charge here.
Announcer.nm02aeduel08001_.mp3: Ladies and gentlemen, I draw your attention to the dueling ring. Here, two combatants will battle for your viewing and gambling enjoyment.
Announcer.nm02aeduel08003_.mp3: Now, I hope all your bets are down, because we're ready to roll! In this corner, I give you... Gerlon Two-Fingers!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08005_.mp3: And over here, looking to climb the ranks yet again is the ever persistent Deadeye Duncan!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08007_.mp3: And, to nobody's great surprise, Deadeye is down again. Don't worry, folks - he's just unconscious. As usual. Our medics will have him up and about in a bit.
Announcer.nm02aeduel08009_.mp3: Well, that was quick, wasn't it? So I give you the winner... Gerlon Two-Fingers!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08011_.mp3: Bendak is down! It's over! It's over! The fight is over! Bendak Starkiller is down! Bendak Starkiller is dead!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08013_.mp3: All hail the Mysterious Stranger, the greatest duelist to ever grace the rings of Taris!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08015_.mp3: The Stranger is down! The Mysterious Stranger is down!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08017_.mp3: This is unbelievable, folks! Deadeye Duncan has won a fight! Is it possible we have a new contender for the title of worst duelist ever? Only time - and a possible rematch - will tell!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08019_.mp3: Gerlon Two-Fingers gets the win! And, for a change, it wasn't against Duncan. This has got to be a tough loss for the Mysterious Stranger. Imagine: losing to a crippled opponent!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08021_.mp3: Ice wins! Once again the Queen of Mean has dispatched her opponent in the ring. Hard luck, Stranger, but Ice is tough. She never goes down easy.
Announcer.nm02aeduel08023_.mp3: Marl has done it again! Twenty years and still going strong for the veteran. And a hard lesson for the up and coming rookie. Better luck next time, Stranger.
Announcer.nm02aeduel08025_.mp3: Twitch has done it! Once again the wild-eyed champion has defended his title! But don't give up, Stranger - we all want to see you go after the champ again!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08027_.mp3: It's over! The fight is over! The Mysterious Stranger has won!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08029_.mp3: But really, are any of us surprised? Deadeye losing isn't news. You have to do better than that to impress us, Stranger!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08031_.mp3: Gerlon losing to a rookie: is this a sign that his injuries have finally caught up with him? Or is the Mysterious Stranger for real? Only time will tell!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08033_.mp3: Ice is knocked out cold! Looks like we have a rising star in the Mysterious Stranger, folks: but how high can this star soar? You'll just have to watch and see!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08035_.mp3: Marl is down, and questions abound! Is this the end for the long time vet? Is it time for Marl to hang up his spurs? And what of the Mysterious Stranger?
Announcer.nm02aeduel08037_.mp3: Twitch is waiting in the wings... do you dare take a shot at the champion himself? Will the wild-eyed wonder finally be unseated?
Announcer.nm02aeduel08039_.mp3: Twitch's reign of terror is over! Ladies and gentlemen, we have a new champion - the Mysterious Stranger!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08041_.mp3: Ladies and gentlemen, come with me now on a journey to the savage days of years gone by... to a time when two combatants entered the arena, and only one came out alive.
Announcer.nm02aeduel08043_.mp3: They're illegal, they're banned, they've been outlawed for nearly ten years - but we've got one for you tonight! A good, old fashioned death match!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08045_.mp3: In this corner, a living legend. A man who's very name would make his opponents shake in their boots... if any of them were still alive. Ha ha ha! Out of retirement for one last battle: Bendak Starkiller!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08047_.mp3: And who would be crazy enough to step into the ring with such a lethal legend? Who would be mad enough to face almost certain death merely for your enjoyment?
Announcer.nm02aeduel08049_.mp3: Ladies and gentlemen, feast your wondering eyes on... the Mysterious Stranger!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08051_.mp3: And now, the moment we've all been waiting for... LET THE DEATH MATCH BEGIN!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08053_.mp3: Ladies and gentlemen, draw your eyes to the center ring! We have a very special presentation in store for you:
Announcer.nm02aeduel08055_.mp3: Hold on to your seats and stay back from the edges of the ring! He's wild, he's unpredictable, he's borderline psychotic... and he's the best damn duelist in the game today. Give it up for Twitch!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08057_.mp3: But Twitch's opponent plans to take the champion down! Night after night, battle after battle we've watched this young phenom rise through the ranks...
Announcer.nm02aeduel08059_.mp3: In this corner, the challenger for the title of Taris Dueling Champion - the Mysterious Stranger!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08061_.mp3: He's a legend in the sport, a twenty year veteran who still knows how to show the young kids a trick or two. Let's have a big hand for... Marl!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08063_.mp3: But there's always some young gun coming up to knock the veterans off... and we've got one of the best right here! I give you, the Mysterious Stranger!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08065_.mp3: Over in this corner, a woman with steel on her bones and ice water in her veins. She's cold and quick as death itself. You know her, you love her... Ice!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08067_.mp3: And in the other corner, a rising star taking that first step into the big leagues... I give you the Mysterious Stranger!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08069_.mp3: In this corner, one of the greats; a man so tough even a disfiguring injury couldn't end his career. I give you Gerlon Two-Fingers!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08071_.mp3: And in the other corner, a relative newcomer to the Taris dueling scene. Emerging from the shadows with no history, no past and no name... the Mysterious Stranger!
Announcer.nm02aeduel08073_.mp3: You've seen him lose night after night after night. But this time, he's after fresh meat. In this corner I give you Deadeye Duncan!
Announcer.nm17ae04an01000_.mp3: Looks like we've got another racer up on the line. Let's see how they go.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01001_.mp3: Another swoop on the line. Get your timers ready.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01002_.mp3: Another driver coming up whose been practicing out in the canyons like most locals.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01003_.mp3: This driver's had a string of losses. Let's see if they can't get back on track today.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01004_.mp3: A lot of work has been put into this bike, but can the driver make it perform? Timers, get ready!
Announcer.nm17ae04an01005_.mp3: This run won't be officially timed, but let's give'em a hand anyway.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01007_.mp3: Those mods are paying off. A much better run!
Announcer.nm17ae04an01008_.mp3: Just squeaked in under the last time. A very good run.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01009_.mp3: Early mistakes cost some time on that run. That's gotta hurt, folks.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01010_.mp3: A great effort, but just not enough.
Announcer.nm17ae04an01011_.mp3: That was a hard fought run, but still a little slow.

Bastilla.nglobebant00001_.mp3: No, I was conscious. But my Force powers were exhausted from using my Battle Meditation in the battle for the Endar Spire. Without my help you might never have gotten off the ship alive.
Bastilla.nglobebant00003_.mp3: My lightsaber was... misplaced. I couldn't find it after the crash. I looked *everywhere* in that pod. The Vulkars came and overwhelmed me even as I was searching for my weapon.
Bastilla.nglobebant00008_.mp3: This is no laughing matter! During the crash my lightsaber must have... it must have fallen from my belt and rolled under my seat! The Vulkars probably found it there when they searched the wreckage.
Bastilla.nglobebant00010_.mp3: I hardly consider myself a legend, Carth. Though I will consider your advice when I relate these events to the Jedi Council. There is no need for them to know *every* detail of what transpired.
Bastilla.nglobebant00012_.mp3: That was nearly five years ago. I was still an apprentice, my Battle Meditation hadn't even manifested itself. Yet even then I had the wisdom to obey the will of the Council. Unlike Revan.
Bastilla.nglobebant00014_.mp3: Do not blame Revan's corruption on the Council! Your Republic saw only the threat of the Mandalorians, but the wisdom of the Masters saw beyond the immediate threat.
Bastilla.nglobebant00016_.mp3: There was something lurking out there, something that devoured Revan and Malak - and many other Jedi. Had the Council sent us all into the unknown, how many more would have fallen?
Bastilla.nglobebant00018_.mp3: We did not abandon you! But the Council were not about to throw lives away foolishly. In time, we would have aided you against the Mandalorians. But you couldn't wait.
Bastilla.nglobebant00019_.mp3: Revan and Malak offered a quicker answer, and the Republic chose to walk the easy path rather than the path of wisdom. Now we see the results all around us.
Bastilla.nglobebant00020_.mp3: You asked me if I think things could have been different? I *know* they could have! If Revan had only listened to the Council, millions of innocent people would still be alive.
Bastilla.nglobebant00055_.mp3: There were extenuating circumstances. And I can assure you it took far more than a handful of Vulkars to subdue me.
Bastilla.nglobebant00058_.mp3: Bold talk from a broken-down merceneray who was serving at Davik's heel. I'd call you his pet kath hound, but they have enough loyalty not to turn on their masters.
Bastilla.nglobebant00060_.mp3: I was not spoiled! I was given the same training as everyone else in the Order! You are nothing but a... no. I must not do this. There is no emotion; there is peace.
Bastilla.nglobebant00062_.mp3: Enough, Mandalorian. I won't rise to your bait any more. The game is over. Let us continue on with what we were doing.
Bastilla.nglobebant00085_.mp3: I would never use the Force for such a petty and trivial revenge! The mere thought of it is preposterous!
Bastilla.nglobebant00087_.mp3: I am not stuck up. I merely have the years of training to give me the wisdom and understanding to see how childish such an act would be.
Bastilla.nglobebant00090_.mp3: I have no idea what you're talking about, Mission. Come now, we have to get going. Please do try to be less clumsy in the future.
Bastilla.nglobebant00091_.mp3: Jolee, may I have a moment? There is something I wish to speak to you about.
Bastilla.nglobebant00093_.mp3: I know you have... issues... with the Order. But you are a Jedi, Jolee. You command the Force. Without the guidance of the Council how can you avoid falling to the dark side?
Bastilla.nglobebant00099_.mp3: I see you are quite adamant. No doubt you've had ample time to think on this during your long seclusion. I guess it was foolish of me to think I could sway your position so easily.
Bastilla.nglobebast06772_.mp3: Actually, your presence at the swoop track is what I'm curious about. It couldn't have been an easy task to find me there. Yet somehow you managed.
Bastilla.nglobebast06773_.mp3: You also avoided detection by the Sith, discovered I was a Vulkar prisoner, gained sponsorship for the race and became the Taris swoop champion. That's quite a resume.
Bastilla.nglobebast06775_.mp3: The Force is in all of us, though for most people it is a barely measurable whisper. But there are some individuals outside the Jedi Order that we considered 'Force Sensitive'.
Bastilla.nglobebast06776_.mp3: It is obvious to me that the Force has been working through you. There is no other explanation for your great success, though I am not certain what to make of this discovery.
Bastilla.nglobebast06777_.mp3: Perhaps if you weren't - well, if you were younger the Jedi might take you for training. But as it is...
Bastilla.nglobebast06779_.mp3: I'm sorry; I've overstepped my authority. I'm speaking of things that are best left to the Jedi Council. For now let's just accept the fact that you are... gifted.
Bastilla.nglobebast06780_.mp3: Hopefully between your abilities, my Jedi training and the skills of our companions we can find a way off this planet.
Bastilla.nglobebast06782_.mp3: Ah, yes, the rescue again. Very well. For what it's worth, I conceed the point to you: you rescued me from Brejik. And yet we're still stuck on here on Taris.
Bastilla.nglobebast06785_.mp3: Perhaps. But the Force works through all of us to some degree or another. There are some individuals outside the Jedi Order that we considered 'Force Sensitive'.
Bastilla.nglobebast06787_.mp3: Yes, I can see you do not lack in ability; although modesty is another matter.
Bastilla.nglobebast06789_.mp3: Your modesty is admirable. But though others helped, you were the catalyst for these events.
Bastilla.nglobebast06791_.mp3: Please! I'm a Jedi. Such feelings, such attractions, are... well, they're beneath me, quite frankly.
Bastilla.nglobebast06792_.mp3: I admit, I find you intriguing. Uh... I mean, I find your command of the Force intriguing. But my interest in you is purely academic. Surely you can understand why.
Bastilla.nglobebast06793_.mp3: Touched a nerve, no. Getting on my nerves, most definitely. I suppose this is what you men consider being witty. *sigh*
Bastilla.nglobebast06794_.mp3: Now, are you going to answer my questions? Or would you rather just keep annoying me?
Bastilla.nglobebast06797_.mp3: Don't worry, these are simple questions. Nothing too intrusive. First, what kind of background do you have?
Bastilla.nglobebast06798_.mp3: But I imagine you've had enough questions for a while. So many things have happened to you since Taris. It's probably a lot for you to absorb.
Bastilla.nglobebast06799_.mp3: We can speak again later, after you've had time to think about all this.
Bastilla.nglobebast06801_.mp3: I suppose I'll just have to speak to you again later. Hopefully you'll behave a little less like a little boy and a little more like a... like a man!
Bastilla.nglobebast06802_.mp3: I suppose I'll just have to speak to you again later. Hopefully you'll be a little more... mature.
Bastilla.nglobebast06803_.mp3: My thoughts remain hidden, including whatever my feelings are for you. Uh... I mean whatever I feel *about* you... uh... I mean whatever I *think* about you.
Bastilla.nglobebast06805_.mp3: I... that is, you... Why must you be so impossibly infuriating?! You know very well what I'm really talking about. I'm referring to the bond between us; the one the Jedi Council spoke of.
Bastilla.nglobebast06807_.mp3: An amusing description, but hardly the truth. We both know the real reason you have some idea of what I am thinking: the bond we share.
Bastilla.nglobebast06808_.mp3: I only hope I will have the wisdom to help you through the dark times. But for now, we should return to our mission.
Bastilla.nglobebast06810_.mp3: You are easily the vainest, most arrogant man I have ever met! Besides, I know you can't be serious, since I was purposefully *not* staring in your direction.
Bastilla.nglobebast06813_.mp3: A lecture won't be much use if you aren't prepared to listen. I suppose it would be best if we didn't speak about this for a while. Let's just return to our mission for now.
Bastilla.nglobebast06815_.mp3: You never give up, do you? I admit I'm interested in you. I find you intriguing. Compelling, even. But it's not what you think.
Bastilla.nglobebast06816_.mp3: You have a great gift. You have an awesome command of the Force, and I tremble when I think of how you might misuse it.
Bastilla.nglobebast06818_.mp3: What? I... no! No, of course not! Not like that, anyway. In many ways you are... you are dangerous. You could be the savior of the galaxy; or you could bring untold destruction upon us all.
Bastilla.nglobebast06820_.mp3: Besides, the events on Taris proved that the Force wanted to bring us together for this mission, and there is little left to chance when the Force is involved. Is that not enough for you?
Bastilla.nglobebast06821_.mp3: I wondered if the Council wanted to see how I would help and guide you on our quest. I wondered if they were testing me to see if I was ready to become a Jedi Master myself.
Bastilla.nglobebast06822_.mp3: And then I realized how foolish such thoughts were. As the Council explained, sending a Master in our group would only have drawn unwanted attention from the Sith.
Bastilla.nglobebast06823_.mp3: The fate of the galaxy is at stake, the Council would not risk it merely to test me. They calculated the risks and in the end chose the only option available.
Bastilla.nglobebast06827_.mp3: But maybe it's time to change that. You deserve to know how much I respect and admire you. I had to tell you how much I care for you. As a friend, of course.
Bastilla.nglobebast06829_.mp3: Please, it's... it's not allowed. I have to remain true to the Jedi ideal. If this is going to cause a problem maybe... maybe I shouldn't have said anything.
Bastilla.nglobebast06831_.mp3: But enough soul searching for now. We should probably continue on with our mission.
Bastilla.nglobebast06833_.mp3: Yes, of course. You're right. I... I have to remember my training. The Masters know well the corrupting influence of the dark side, although it is hard for me to imagine.
Bastilla.nglobebast06834_.mp3: Part of my purpose on this mission was to guide you in the way of the light; to help you avoid the temptations of the dark side. But I fear I've failed in that task.
Bastilla.nglobebast06835_.mp3: You're like no man I've known before. And you're nothing like what I expected you to be after... after the Council sent us on this mission together.
Bastilla.nglobebast06837_.mp3: I... I need time to think about all this. Things are... they are not going as I thought they would.
Bastilla.nglobebast06838_.mp3: We should... we should continue on with our mission, for now.
Bastilla.nglobebast06839_.mp3: No, I suppose you don't. At this point I imagine I'm doing you more harm than good.
Bastilla.nglobebast06842_.mp3: But Malak must be stopped, my own feelings are nothing when compared to that. Yet I know this could affect the sake of our mission if it is not resolved - I can't let that happen!
Bastilla.nglobebast06844_.mp3: I think... I think we should have some privacy for this. Come with me.
Bastilla.nglobebast06845_.mp3: What I have been trying to tell you is that I've reached a decision. But this is not the proper place for this discussion. I think... I think we should have some privacy for this.
Bastilla.nglobebast06846_.mp3: We can talk about this the next time we return to the Ebon Hawk.
Bastilla.nglobebast06849_.mp3: Why do you think I came to this decision? I know how hard this is for both of us! You just kept pressing forward, so I had to be the one to step up and do the right thing!
Bastilla.nglobebast06852_.mp3: You're the one who can't face the truth! Malak has to be stopped. How can I do that if I let myself be blinded by my feelings for you?
Bastilla.nglobebast06854_.mp3: You... you mean it, don't you? But how can I be sure you aren't making a mistake. I... I have to resist. I have to be strong for both of us.
Bastilla.nglobebast06856_.mp3: But I don't... I mean, I can't... Malak will...
Bastilla.nglobebast06861_.mp3: Okay, you've made your point. Now shut up and kiss me, you fool!
Bastilla.nglobebast06863_.mp3: We... we shouldn't have done that. It was wrong. The Jedi aren't allowed to fall in love.
Bastilla.nglobebast06865_.mp3: It was... it was a moment of weakness. When I kissed you... we shouldn't have... no, I'm sorry.
Bastilla.nglobebast06866_.mp3: I know we both wanted it, but we shouldn't have given in to our desire. We're Jedi! We can't act like this. Not now, not while we still have to deal with Malak!
Bastilla.nglobebast06867_.mp3: I'm... I'm sorry. I don't blame you, but... it was a mistake. I have to get out of here before somebody sees us together!
Bastilla.nglobebast06871_.mp3: I'm... afraid so. Although I suppose I should thank you for all you've done. For the lessons you helped me learn.
Bastilla.nglobebast06873_.mp3: I wish it could be otherwise, but you have to understand that this is the way it must be. I am a Jedi, after all.
Bastilla.nglobebast06875_.mp3: I hope you can put this behind you. You need to focus on stopping Malak, as difficult as that may be. Come, we should continue our mission.
Bastilla.nglobebast06878_.mp3: We've... we've already been over this. It was a moment of weakness, a stumble brought on by unbridled passions. But my emotions are firmly in check once more.
Bastilla.nglobebast06879_.mp3: We need to stay focused on stopping Darth Malak. And I want the others to stay focused as well. I don't want them to get suspicious and start gossiping about our little encounter!
Bastilla.nglobebast06880_.mp3: So, until our mission is over we need to act with discretion. We shouldn't speak of this anymore... not until Malak is defeated!
Bastilla.nglobebast06882_.mp3: I said we were brought together for our mission: to stop Malak. I hardly think the Force would be pushing us towards a romantic involvement when the fate of the galaxy is at stake!
Bastilla.nglobebast06883_.mp3: Please try to stay focused. I doubt the Council would approve if they knew we were busy discussing our mutual attraction when we should be saving the galaxy from Malak.
Bastilla.nglobebast06885_.mp3: Mutual attraction? I never said... it's just an expression! Whatever our feelings... uh, I mean... whatever *your* feelings, you have to try to ignore them. Don't let this complicate things.
Bastilla.nglobebast06887_.mp3: Finding the missing pieces of the Star Maps is our only hope of locating the Star Forge and defeating Malak. The Council explained all this quite clearly.
Bastilla.nglobebast06896_.mp3: *whisper* The Force should not be used for profit and personal gain. As Jedi we should be above such things.
Bastilla.nglobebast06897_.mp3: It troubles me to see you behaving this way. Such acts can lead to the dark side.
Bastilla.nglobebast06898_.mp3: *whisper* The Force is not a thing to be trifled with. Continue to use it frivolously and you may find yourself straying down the dark path.[R1]
Bastilla.nglobebast06899_.mp3: We should guard and protect those weaker than ourselves... not bully and exploit them!
Bastilla.nglobebast06900_.mp3: That was beneath you. I hope in the future you will strive to be better than this.
Bastilla.nglobebast06901_.mp3: That was a truly noble act. The Jedi Council would be pleased.
Bastilla.nglobemala12002_.mp3: I am Bastila, yes. I take it that you know my mother?
Bastilla.nglobemala12006_.mp3: Is there something I can do for you, miss? As you can see, we are in quite a hurry.
Bastilla.nglobemala12014_.mp3: I have not seen my mother since I joined the order. Do you know what has happened? Did she... say anything about my father?
Bastilla.nglobemala12018_.mp3: I see. Where did you meet her, do you remember?
Bastilla.nglobemala12022_.mp3: Thank you for informing me. I really must be going, now.
Bastilla.nglobemala12024_.mp3: It seems my mother has been looking for me. Strange. Should we get the opportunity, could we look for her on Tatooine?
Bastilla.nglobemala12026_.mp3: We never did. I am interested in hearing about my father, however.
Bastilla.nglobemala12028_.mp3: Part of me would rather not see her at all. But if she is really sick... well, we shall see.
Bastilla.nglobemala12031_.mp3: It is important enough that my mother was attempting to seek me out. Perhaps it has something to do with my father.
Bastilla.nglobemala12034_.mp3: I agree. Should we get the chance, however, I would speak to her. Perhaps it has something to do with my father.
Bastilla.nglobemala12038_.mp3: Yes, of course. I would never jeopardize our mission. However, if we get the opportunity I would like to visit Tatooine.
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01002_.mp3: You mean you don't have a plan to get off Taris yet? What have you been doing all this time?
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01004_.mp3: I see. Now that I'm back in charge of this mission, perhaps we can start doing things properly. Hopefully our escape from Taris will go more smoothly than when you "rescued" me from Brejik.
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01008_.mp3: That hardly strikes me as an appropriate way of addressing your commander, Carth. I am a member of the Jedi Order and this is my mission. Don't forget that!
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01010_.mp3: My Battle Meditation ability has helped the Republic many times in this war, and it will serve us well here I am sure.
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01014_.mp3: Yes... You're right, of course. I apologize, Carth. This has been a difficult time for me. Of course I'm happy to listen to your advice. What do you suggest we do?
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01018_.mp3: Well said, Carth. And the sooner we start looking the better; I've already been a prisoner of the Vulkars and I don't plan on being captured by the Sith.
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01021_.mp3: I think we'll need some help getting off Taris. Maybe if we ask around one of the locals can help us out. We should probably start by asking around in the cantinas.
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01027_.mp3: I see. It's true I that don't have much military experience; perhaps I should not be so quick to judge. Very well, Carth: what do you suggest we do?
Bastilla.nm02aacarb01032_.mp3: My attitude? It strikes me that you're the one in sore need of an attitude adjustment. I happen to be in charge of this mission, if you'll recall.
Bastilla.nm02abgort09044_.mp3: We should leave. This man may be deranged, but he could also make considerable trouble for us.
Bastilla.nm02abgort09058_.mp3: That's not exactly humorous. You are encouraging his hatred and blindness.
Bastilla.nm02abithb10018_.mp3: I will not stand here and let that poor man be stoned! You there, children... leave him alone!
Bastilla.nm02abithb10033_.mp3: Well I will. You children get away... just because he is different does not give you the right to attack him!
Bastilla.nm02acgurn03033_.mp3: And then only the wealthiest patrons could acquire the cure. That is hardly fair.
Bastilla.nm02acgurn03041_.mp3: I am a Jedi. I will always try to help, if I can.
Bastilla.nm02aczelk11008_.mp3: You have taken a great risk to care for these men. I wish we could aid you more, but you have my thanks.
Bastilla.nm02aczelk11020_.mp3: Don't be absurd. Indulge your darker impulses if you wish, but not at the cost of hurting helpless men. We will not betray this man.
Bastilla.nm02aczelk11028_.mp3: I am outraged! I understand we might need credits to help us get off the planet, but that was unacceptable. In the future please try to remember that we are on the side of justice!
Bastilla.nm02aczelk11166_.mp3: That is very kind of you. We are just glad we were able to bring some relief to the suffering of these people.
Bastilla.nm02aczelk11182_.mp3: That was unworthy of you. Zelka has the serum, certainly, but only because of your extortion. Were the few extra credits truly worth it?
Bastilla.nm02aecand30012_.mp3: You don't need to ally yourself with this... person. We should move on while we can.
Bastilla.nm02aecand30031_.mp3: This is too risky. We should find another way.
Bastilla.nm02aecand30035_.mp3: No, I... don't have another plan. I would rather not place my life in your hands, however.
Bastilla.nm02aecand30058_.mp3: I don't sense any deception from him, which is surprising. This may be exactly what we need.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05000_.mp3: Is... is something wrong? You seem as if something is troubling you.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05002_.mp3: A vision? A vision of what?
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05004_.mp3: This is... strange. Such visions are often a sign of Force sensitivity.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05006_.mp3: I... I'm not sure. It may be that you have some connection to the Force. It would not be unheard of. When we first met, your natural talent may have fed off my own Force abilities.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05007_.mp3: It is possible that in the excitement of the battle's aftermath the Force allowed you to witness one of my more intense memories.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05009_.mp3: The Force is complicated; even I with all my training cannot fully understand it yet. This is a matter best left to the wise Masters of the Jedi Council.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05010_.mp3: Once we escape Taris we can seek the guidance of the Council, if you wish. They will understand the significance of your vision... if there is any.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05011_.mp3: However, I think it would be best if we all stayed focused on the task at hand right now. We can't afford any distractions; we need to find a way off Taris.
Bastilla.nm02afvisi05016_.mp3: As you wish. We should move on then. We won't get off Taris just sitting here.
Bastilla.nm03aabast01000_.mp3: Well, maybe those bloody Vulkars will think twice next time before trying to keep a Jedi prisoner! And as for you, if you think you can collect me as a prize...
Bastilla.nm03aabast01002_.mp3: Wait... I don't believe this! You're... uh... you're one of the soldiers with the Republic fleet, aren't you? Yes, I'm sure of it. How did you end up racing for these swoop gangs?
Bastilla.nm03aabast01004_.mp3: Well we don't have time for it now. We have to get out of here before the Sith show up to sort out this mess. Is there somewhere safe we can go?
Bastilla.nm03aabast01008_.mp3: Save me? Is that what you were trying to accomplish by riding in that swoop race? Well, as far as rescues go this is a pretty poor example.
Bastilla.nm03aabast01010_.mp3: In case you hadn't noticed, I managed to free myself from that neural restraint collar without your help. In fact, it's more accurate to say that I saved you!
Bastilla.nm03aabast01012_.mp3: Brejik and his Vulkars would have left you for dead if I hadn't stepped into that fight. You're lucky I was here to get you out of this mess!
Bastilla.nm03aabast01014_.mp3: I may have been a prisoner, but a Jedi is never helpless. Maybe you've heard of a little thing called 'the Force'?
Bastilla.nm03aabast01016_.mp3: But I suppose I shouldn't be too hard on you. You did try to save me after all, even if it didn't quite go as planned. So let's get down to business - we're not out of danger yet.
Bastilla.nm03aabast01019_.mp3: Yes, I suppose you can. Well, I appreciate your attempt to save me - even if it didn't really go as you planned. But let's get down to business - we're not out of danger yet.
Bastilla.nm03aabast01021_.mp3: If I'm going to figure out a way for us to get off this planet I need to know what kind of resources we can draw on. First, are we the only two survivors left from the Endar Spire?
Bastilla.nm03aabast01025_.mp3: The Republic, for one. I was fleet commander, remember? But I don't want you getting all worked up over nothing. So tell me - do you have a plan to get off this planet?
Bastilla.nm03aabast01028_.mp3: Carth Onasi is alive? Finally, some good news! Carth is one of the Republic's best soldiers. He's proved himself a hero a dozen times over! And he sent you here to save me?
Bastilla.nm03aabast01030_.mp3: Maybe I misjudged you. Carth wouldn't have sent you if he wasn't confident in your... abilities. Forgive me - despite my Jedi training, I still tend to act a bit rashly sometimes.
Bastilla.nm03aabast01032_.mp3: Please, take me to Carth right away. Between the three of us I'm sure we can figure out some way to get off this planet before the Sith realize we're here.
Bastilla.nm03aabast01036_.mp3: You must have banked a turn too sharply, because it sounds like all the blood has rushed from your brain!
Bastilla.nm03aabast01038_.mp3: I'm Bastila Shan, a member of the Jedi Order and a fleet commander for the Republic. Nobody 'owns' me! Now we don't have time for joking around. What are you doing here?
Bastilla.nm03aabrej02022_.mp3: I might have something to say about that, Brejik!
Bastilla.nm03aabrej02026_.mp3: You underestimate the strength of a Jedi's mind, Brejik - a mistake you won't live to regret!
Bastilla.nm03aacand05014_.mp3: You don't need to ally yourself with this... person. We should move on while we can.
Bastilla.nm03aacand05030_.mp3: This is too risky. We should find another way.
Bastilla.nm03aacand05051_.mp3: I don't sense any deception from him, which is surprising. This may be the help we need.
Bastilla.nm03admatr05013_.mp3: No, wait! I want to hear what this man means by 'clear conscience'.
Bastilla.nm03aecand06012_.mp3: You don't need to ally yourself with this... person. We should move on while we can.
Bastilla.nm03aecand06031_.mp3: This is too risky. We should find another way.
Bastilla.nm03aecand06035_.mp3: No, I... don't have another plan. I would rather not place my life in your hands, however.
Bastilla.nm03aecand06058_.mp3: I don't sense any deception from him, which is surprising. This may be exactly what we need.
Bastilla.nm03aehold13016_.mp3: It sounds to me like the woman was defending herself.
Bastilla.nm03aehold13070_.mp3: [Force Persuade] I think it is time you forgave her. You are partly to blame for her behavior.
Bastilla.nm03ae_zax22084_.mp3: You don't intend on working as a bounty hunter, do you? What need could you possibly have for so many credits?
Bastilla.nm03ae_zax22088_.mp3: Getting paid to murder others is hardly justifiable. It is a path that could easily lead to the dark side.
Bastilla.nm03ae_zax22092_.mp3: I'll "get in a twist" if I think it is called for, Carth. I simply suggest we should use caution if we intend to participate in this... business.
Bastilla.nm03afbast03000_.mp3: Well, maybe those bloody Vulkars will think twice next time before trying to keep a Jedi prisoner! And as for you, if you think you can collect me as a prize...
Bastilla.nm03afbast03002_.mp3: Wait... I don't believe this! You're... you're one of the soldiers with the Republic fleet, aren't you? Yes, I'm sure of it. How did you end up racing for these swoop gangs?
Bastilla.nm03afbast03004_.mp3: Well we don't have time for it now. We have to get out of here before the Sith show up to sort out this mess. Is there somewhere safe we can go?
Bastilla.nm03afbast03008_.mp3: Save me? Is that what you were trying to accomplish by riding in that swoop race? Well, as far as rescues go this is a pretty poor example.
Bastilla.nm03afbast03010_.mp3: In case you hadn't noticed, I managed to free myself from that neural restraint collar without your help. In fact, it's more accurate to say that I saved you!
Bastilla.nm03afbast03012_.mp3: Brejik and his Vulkars would have left you for dead if I hadn't stepped into that fight. You're lucky I was here to get you out of this mess!
Bastilla.nm03afbast03014_.mp3: I may have been a prisoner, but a Jedi is never helpless. Maybe you've heard of a little thing called 'the Force'?
Bastilla.nm03afbast03016_.mp3: But I suppose I shouldn't be too hard on you. You did try to save me after all, even if it didn't go quite as planned. So let's get down to business - we're not out of danger yet.
Bastilla.nm03afbast03019_.mp3: Yes, I suppose you can. Well, I appreciate your attempt to save me - even if it didn't really go as you planned. But let's get down to business - we're not out of danger yet.
Bastilla.nm03afbast03021_.mp3: If I'm going to figure out a way for us to get off this planet I need to know what kind of resources we can draw on. First, are we the only two survivors left from the Endar Spire?
Bastilla.nm03afbast03025_.mp3: The Republic, for one. I was fleet commander, remember? But I don't want you getting all worked up over nothing. So tell me - do you have a plan to get off this planet?
Bastilla.nm03afbast03028_.mp3: Carth Onasi is alive? Finally, some good news! Carth is one of the Republic's best soldiers. He's proved himself a hero a dozen times over! And he sent you here to save me?
Bastilla.nm03afbast03030_.mp3: Maybe I misjudged you. Carth wouldn't have sent you if he wasn't confident in your... abilities. Forgive me - despite my Jedi training, I still tend to act a bit rashly sometimes.
Bastilla.nm03afbast03032_.mp3: Please, take me to Carth right away. Between the three of us I'm sure we can figure out some way to get off this planet before the Sith realize we're here.
Bastilla.nm03afbast03036_.mp3: You must have banked a turn too sharply, because it sounds like all the blood has rushed from your brain!
Bastilla.nm03afbast03038_.mp3: I'm Bastila Shan, a member of the Jedi Order and a fleet commander for the Republic. Nobody 'owns' me! Now we don't have time for joking around. What are you doing here?
Bastilla.nm03afbrej04022_.mp3: I might have something to say about that, Brejik!
Bastilla.nm03afbrej04026_.mp3: You underestimate the strength of a Jedi's mind, Brejik - a mistake you won't live to regret!
Bastilla.nm04aaruki25055_.mp3: This old man's demeanor may seem crazed, but I sense there is a purpose behind it, a benevolent one. He is no danger to us.
Bastilla.nm08aadavs10036_.mp3: How typically male. Is it possible for you to keep in mind that we have more pressing business to attend to?
Bastilla.nm08aahudr11022_.mp3: We got what we came for. There is no need to indulge your appetite for violence.
Bastilla.nm08aahudr11045_.mp3: Perhaps you should reconsider. His information may prove invaluable to us.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01000_.mp3: Dantooine... it seems like a lifetime since I last set foot on her surface, though in truth it has only been a few months. We should be safe from Malak here... for now, at least.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01002_.mp3: Even the Sith would think twice before attacking Dantooine. There are many Jedi here, including several of the most powerful Masters of the Order. There is great strength within this place.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01004_.mp3: We can get supplies here and recuperate. The Academy is a place of mental and spiritual healing; something we could all use after what we've been through.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01006_.mp3: She will find a way to come to terms with her grief. She is stronger than she appears. We just need to give her time.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01007_.mp3: Now I must go speak with the Council. I need their advice on... recent developments. After I have met with them I will meet you outside the ship.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01009_.mp3: We can't just keep running; Malak will find us eventually. We need to regroup; we need a plan.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01010_.mp3: The Force has given us a... a vision. Like the one we shared on Dantooine. Did you see it? Of course... you must have. The Force is strong with us both.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01011_.mp3: There are some who believe Korriban is the birth place of the Sith... this planet is an evil place. There are secrets here best left uncovered.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01013_.mp3: During the vision I felt cold and trapped; almost as if I was buried alive. It felt... it felt like we were in some kind of tomb.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01014_.mp3: No doubt things will become more clear once we discover the Star Map's location.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01016_.mp3: You are right, of course. We cannot turn away from the path we have started on... no matter where it may lead.
Bastilla.nm12aabast01018_.mp3: The visions are as much yours as mine - and they are the key to finding the Star Forge and stopping Malak!
Bastilla.nm12aabast01019_.mp3: Kashyyyk is a lush but simple and undeveloped world. I would not have expected to find the alien technology of a Star Map here.
