Bindo.nm35aajole09041_.mp3: What's done is done. The Republic will likely appeal the matter eventually and he'll be free. I just... I just would like to know if that's best.
Bindo.nm35aajole09042_.mp3: Sunry was a good man once. And a good friend. I'll miss him.
Bindo.nm35aajole09043_.mp3: Innocent, mm? I don't know what to make of it, to tell the truth. Do you think justice has been done?
Bindo.nm35aajole09045_.mp3: I see. I am not so sure. If he did kill that woman, Sunry's going to have to live with that on his conscience.
Bindo.nm35aajole09046_.mp3: And if he's justified her death in his mind... well... Sunry was a good man, once. I only hope that is still the case. I enjoyed his company.
Bindo.nm35aajole09048_.mp3: But that has little to do with the law, does it? A sad state of affairs, that. Too bad, really... Sunry was a good man, once.
Bindo.nm35aajole09050_.mp3: You got yourself a fast little ship. Heh. I'd forgotten what engines sounded like. The closest thing to that on Kashyyyk is an uller in mating season. Ugh! Frightful.
Bindo.nm35aajole09052_.mp3: Or it could be for the free food. What's the gunk that comes out of the synthesizer on this bucket, anyway? Do you never clean the darned thing?
Bindo.nm35aajole09054_.mp3: I'm old, damn it! I'm allowed to be enigmatic when I want to be, and don't you go telling me otherwise.
Bindo.nm35aajole09055_.mp3: You know, you remind me of someone else I knew ages ago. Pleasant enough fellow, great destiny... all of that. Breath like a bantha.
Bindo.nm35aajole09057_.mp3: Oh ho ho, very funny. Is it my fault that some people are so easily annoyed? They're like impatient little children. With blasters.
Bindo.nm35aajole09058_.mp3: Anyway, where was I? Oh, yes. Andor Vex, was his name. The Force swirled around him like a hurricane, that's how great his destiny was.
Bindo.nm35aajole09060_.mp3: No, you wouldn't have. Sometimes swirling Force is just swirling Force. It gets us old Jedis excited at our age so we go "ooo, destiny!"
Bindo.nm35aajole09061_.mp3: Well, it turned out that poor Andor believed a wee bit too much in the infallibility of that destiny. That overconfidence turned out to be his downfall.
Bindo.nm35aajole09063_.mp3: I don't know. Are you overconfident? I hadn't noticed. Even if I had, I would never comment on it. We're talking about Andor, remember?
Bindo.nm35aajole09064_.mp3: Let's see... oh, yes. Andor's downfall. I was pretty young, myself, when it happened. At the time, I thought that Andor's destiny couldn't be more boring.
Bindo.nm35aajole09066_.mp3: Well, let's just say that I was a strapping young lad with a full head of hair and Coruscant was a small town with a well, heh heh.
Bindo.nm35aajole09067_.mp3: I was just about to abandon Andor to whatever the Force intended for him when his ship was overtaken by a Dimean warship.
Bindo.nm35aajole09068_.mp3: Now, you've probably never heard of the Dimeans, but at the time they were a nasty lot led by a nastier overlord named Kraat. Tall fellow. Big teeth.
Bindo.nm35aajole09069_.mp3: Kraat has us hauled onto the bridge of his ship for questioning, and that's when I knew that Andor's destiny was at hand.
Bindo.nm35aajole09071_.mp3: Of course he did! Haven't you been listening? It was not in the way you'd probably expect, though.
Bindo.nm35aajole09073_.mp3: Swirling Force, remember? Jedi here? Granted, I was just interpreting the signs, but we get trained in that sort of thing. More or less.
Bindo.nm35aajole09075_.mp3: Well, Andor decides that his destiny makes him invulnerable and starts making all sorts of demands. Free me now, I'm not answering questions, blah blah blah. Don't you know who I am?
Bindo.nm35aajole09076_.mp3: Kraat decides he's had enough and begins crushing Andor's neck. I told the boy he should have kept his mouth shut. I think he agreed, too... or those could have just been gurgling noises. Well... well, anyway.
Bindo.nm35aajole09077_.mp3: Finally, Kraat has enough of Andor and tosses him aside into this giant energy intake shaft. Andor gets sucked in and starts bouncing around, heh, screaming... heh.
Bindo.nm35aajole09078_.mp3: Maybe Andor hit something sensitive on the way down or just didn't agree with the reactor core, next thing I know all the ship's alarms are ringing.
Bindo.nm35aajole09080_.mp3: Everyone panics and I run, barely making it to the ship in time before the explosion. Kraat dies horribly, and the Dimeans never quite recovered.
Bindo.nm35aajole09081_.mp3: Changed the political course of the entire sector for centuries to come. I'd call that quite a destiny, wouldn't you?
Bindo.nm35aajole09083_.mp3: Well, now, that's the ingratitude of youth for you. I relate an exciting tale and do I get thanked for it? No, no, it's all 'me me me!' Hmph.
Bindo.nm35aajole09085_.mp3: What?! Are you kidding?! What are the odds of that happening, anyway? A billion to one?
Bindo.nm35aajole09086_.mp3: You should do so well as to be sucked into the engine of some evil Sith Lord, you know. Andor was a hero... sort of.
Bindo.nm35aajole09088_.mp3: Well, hey, the chances may not be great, but when one has the opportunity to see something like that twice in a lifetime...
Bindo.nm35aajole09089_.mp3: Anyway, go on. My throat is dry and you're making me cranky. Shoo!
Bindo.nm35aajole09091_.mp3: You know, if you keep interrupting, it will take even longer. Have you no patience at all? How did you get as old as you are anyway?
Bindo.nm35aajole09093_.mp3: Well, he had a much better food dispenser than you do. That and the fact that even then I wasn't an altogether impatient *twit*.
Bindo.nm35aajole09095_.mp3: Does it have to have a point? I thought we were just talking about Andor. Is something wrong with your attention span?
Bindo.nm35aajole09097_.mp3: I am not! I've no need to make things up, with my poor memory and all. You just sit still and let me finish, damn it.
Bindo.nm35aajole09099_.mp3: Well, it's not so much a hurricane as a slight breeze. But that doesn't mean anything: destiny is sometimes in the eye of the beholder.
Bindo.nm35aajole09101_.mp3: I did. Just because someone has the Force swirling about them doesn't always mean they have a great destiny, but it doesn't hurt to check it out.
Bindo.nm35aajole09103_.mp3: No, but it could be. An Anduvian salt tablet would clear that right up, you know.
Bindo.nm35aajole09105_.mp3: So I am. Tell you what... when you get to be my age, you can go ahead and answer any question you like, too. You have my permission.
Bindo.nm35aajole09107_.mp3: How impatient can one person be? You must have driven your mother mad. All that gurgling and fussing... heh, babies are cute, but annoying.
Bindo.nm35aajole09109_.mp3: Wow, you're not much for interrogation, are you? Is this as hard as you try? Remind me to sign up for your next torture session.
Bindo.nm35aajole09111_.mp3: No, I never did, did I?
Bindo.nm35aajole09113_.mp3: Of course you do. I know things, remember? You think you could make it around this part of the galaxy without me? Don't answer that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09114_.mp3: At any rate, I already told you why I wanted to leave. I'd seen everything I wanted to on Kashyyyk. Time to go, time to move on.
Bindo.nm35aajole09116_.mp3: To bed. I'm old and tired, you know.
Bindo.nm35aajole09118_.mp3: How many kilometer-high trees can you find an interest in before you figure you've had enough? I'd bet you can't be bothered to stay in one room for more than fifteen minutes.
Bindo.nm35aajole09119_.mp3: And then there's all the critters in the Shadowlands... I'm just happy to be back in space, doing something new. Is that too much to ask?
Bindo.nm35aajole09121_.mp3: So I could. Not having a ship does tend to put a damper on that kind of idea, however.
Bindo.nm35aajole09122_.mp3: I'll admit... for all its flaws, Kashyyyk was home enough. But when you came along and I saw the destiny you had before you, I couldn't help but be intrigued.
Bindo.nm35aajole09124_.mp3: Of course not. Weren't you listening last time? I can see that you have a destiny before you... but the details are far from clear.
Bindo.nm35aajole09125_.mp3: In fact, everything about you that I can see is odd. Slightly off, as if my eyes are trying to trick me. Something... something is very dark about you...
Bindo.nm35aajole09126_.mp3: ... but bah! I'm sure you don't need to hear my ruminations. You've probably got enough nosy Jedi offering you one opinion after another to make you sick.
Bindo.nm35aajole09128_.mp3: Your future will come of its own accord, trust me. Sometimes navel-gazing at it doesn't get you anywhere.
Bindo.nm35aajole09129_.mp3: I wouldn't worry about it too much, if I were you. You remind me a bit of Nomi, heh heh, and that can't be all bad.
Bindo.nm35aajole09131_.mp3: Nomi Sunrider. She came late to the Force, just as you have, and became one of the greatest Jedi ever. Oh, fine, fine lass.
Bindo.nm35aajole09132_.mp3: Whether you'll follow the same path remains to be seen. For one thing, we'll never get anywhere if you stand around chatting up old men all day...
Bindo.nm35aajole09134_.mp3: Oh, stop being such a baby. Are you always so quick to turn aside an ally? Got too many of them, do you?
Bindo.nm35aajole09136_.mp3: Nonsense. Have I ever refused to help you when you asked? How confused can one person be, anyway?
Bindo.nm35aajole09138_.mp3: Good, since I didn't offer to be one. You think anyone would want to mentor you with that kind of attitude? Not me, I'm past that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09139_.mp3: One thing I will say is that this little escapade does remind me a bit of my adventuring days before the war. Ahh, those were exciting times.
Bindo.nm35aajole09140_.mp3: Or at least it would remind me of those times if we didn't stand around. What's keeping you? You're too young to be so talkative. Shoo! Shoo!
Bindo.nm35aajole09142_.mp3: Well I for one am quite content to let you make your own mistakes. Just because I want to see where this ends up doesn't mean I need to tell you how to get there.
Bindo.nm35aajole09144_.mp3: I'll remind you that *you're* the one who started pumping me for information. Like an old man doesn't have anything better to do. Hmph.
Bindo.nm35aajole09146_.mp3: Interest? Well, I certainly don't have a vested interest... call it more idle curiosity. Your destiny is... rather unclear.
Bindo.nm35aajole09148_.mp3: Have I offered a single opinion? No, I haven't, though you could do far worse than hear a couple of mine. Your destiny, after all, is rather unclear.
Bindo.nm35aajole09150_.mp3: You got a smart mouth on you there, you know that? If ullers could talk, they'd sound like that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09152_.mp3: There, now, was that so hard? An old man has to be allowed some petty eccenticities. Nice to see you agree, for once.
Bindo.nm35aajole09154_.mp3: The hermit says he's tired of living alone in the giant forest and you find that hard to believe? How cynical are you?
Bindo.nm35aajole09156_.mp3: You live in an overgrown stump with the tachs beating down your door and you tell me how happy you would be. I was pleased just to have visitors.
Bindo.nm35aajole09158_.mp3: Elusive? Me, elusive? Heh. Obviously you've never tried to grab a Twi'lek dancing girl after drinking too much Ondaran willek juice.
Bindo.nm35aajole09160_.mp3: My, my, somebody woke up on the wrong side of the starship this morning, I see. Is that a chip on your shoulder or are you a bit surly today?
Bindo.nm35aajole09162_.mp3: Did I say that? Strange the tricks memory plays on you when you get older.
Bindo.nm35aajole09164_.mp3: Didn't I say that my past was my affair? You don't see me poking and prodding you with questions, do you?
Bindo.nm35aajole09166_.mp3: Well that's a relief. Maybe an old man can finally get some peace around here. Now, run along and do whatever you were doing, already.
Bindo.nm35aajole09168_.mp3: I'm not here to satisfy your curiosity! No staring at the old man, that's what the sign says, dammit!
Bindo.nm35aajole09170_.mp3: Hmph. I might be. But a mouthy young thing like yourself shouldn't get to call me an old coot, dammit.
Bindo.nm35aajole09171_.mp3: And besides... you don't really want to hear about me. We're talking ancient history, probably before you were born. History bores kids. Proven fact.
Bindo.nm35aajole09173_.mp3: Oh fine, fine, have it your way. Just don't cry about it later.
Bindo.nm35aajole09176_.mp3: So you're not. Fine, have it your way. Just don't say I didn't warn you.
Bindo.nm35aajole09177_.mp3: Yes, yes, I was an adventurer. Happy now? I wasn't even done with my Jedi training back then. I had a full head of hair and an eagerness to see absolutely everything.
Bindo.nm35aajole09178_.mp3: Sound familiar? The Council was never very happy with willful, brash Jolee Bindo, you see. Even less so when I began my smuggling career.
Bindo.nm35aajole09180_.mp3: Don't look at me like that, dammit! I wasn't always the wrinkled coot I am now, you know. I can still fight, too, so wipe off that smirk I see there.
Bindo.nm35aajole09182_.mp3: You're very sure of that, are you? My, my, you must be very learned and experienced to know so many things. At any rate, I was still a Padawan at the time.
Bindo.nm35aajole09184_.mp3: At the time the Ukatis system was interdicted by its own King. He preferred to keep his people starving and poor, all the better to oppress them.
Bindo.nm35aajole09185_.mp3: The Senate was trying to negotiate a peace, but they were getting nowhere as usual. I decided I wasn't going to wait.
Bindo.nm35aajole09186_.mp3: I found myself a ship and a partner and we began smuggling food and supplies to the Ukatis citizenry through the blockade.
Bindo.nm35aajole09188_.mp3: Oh, it was. I was a half-decent pilot in those days... and with the Force guiding me, we made it through some tough spots nobody else would have.
Bindo.nm35aajole09190_.mp3: Pilot, smuggler... several other things, too. Or did you suppose I was always a crotchety hermit?
Bindo.nm35aajole09192_.mp3: Well... we didn't *buy* all the equipment, per se. Some were happy to donate goods. Some we just, ah, knew had more than they could use...
Bindo.nm35aajole09194_.mp3: 'Stole' is such a harsh word. They would have donated those goods readily enough if they were compassionate. I considered it a tax on the greedy.
Bindo.nm35aajole09195_.mp3: We only got caught once. A lone Ukatish frigate shot us down and forced a crash landing. I thought the Force had abandoned me, as I remember.
Bindo.nm35aajole09197_.mp3: Well, as it happens, getting shot down turned out to be very fortunate. That day was the day I...
Bindo.nm35aajole09199_.mp3: Well, that... that was the day I met my wife.
Bindo.nm35aajole09201_.mp3: It's alright. When you're digging through the trash, you shouldn't be surprised when you encounter something unpleasant.
Bindo.nm35aajole09203_.mp3: You know another way to get a wife? But, yes... that's when I met her.
Bindo.nm35aajole09205_.mp3: No. No, that was a good memory. There are just... much worse ones that followed.
Bindo.nm35aajole09206_.mp3: I... If it's all the same to you, I'd prefer to stop talking now. My mouth is starting to draw flies.
Bindo.nm35aajole09208_.mp3: Oh, so you're going to speak for the Force now, are you? I deserved to crash, is that it?
Bindo.nm35aajole09210_.mp3: Hmph. As I recall, I'm not the only person in this conversation who's been shot down out of the sky recently.
Bindo.nm35aajole09212_.mp3: Why not? There were millions of people crying out for aid. What else was I supposed to do?
Bindo.nm35aajole09214_.mp3: Don't be stupid. Are you doing nothing? If nothing's not good enough for you there's no reason it should have been good enough for me back then, either.
Bindo.nm35aajole09216_.mp3: I don't want to talk about that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09218_.mp3: Maybe, but I doubt it. I'm made stubborn that way.
Bindo.nm35aajole09220_.mp3: Now that's a unique method of getting someone to talk. Thunder about like a bantha in a circuit shop. Does that work for you often?
Bindo.nm35aajole09222_.mp3: Yes you do. You may mean well enough, but my private affairs are just that: private.
Bindo.nm35aajole09223_.mp3: Let me tell you something. Once you've lived as many years as I have, you'll have yourself a long, long list of memories.
Bindo.nm35aajole09224_.mp3: If you're lucky, most of them will be good. If you're not, some will be bad. If you're really unlucky, some will be so bad you never want to be reminded of them again... ever.
Bindo.nm35aajole09225_.mp3: You'll go far away, to a place that doesn't hold any memories at all. And there you'll be happy just to forget and be forgotten.
Bindo.nm35aajole09227_.mp3: You say that now, but I'm talking to you from across the breadth of many years experience. That is a gap I simply can't cross for you.
Bindo.nm35aajole09230_.mp3: Heh. Partly, maybe. I doubt I could ever explain it to you fully, even if I wanted to.
Bindo.nm35aajole09232_.mp3: There are worse things to call yourself, for better reasons. If you don't think it's even possible that you might be flinging those words at yourself one day, you're younger than I thought.
Bindo.nm35aajole09233_.mp3: Let me ask you this: have you ever been in love? Truly in love, I mean, and not simple infatuation.
Bindo.nm35aajole09235_.mp3: Exactly. You're still at the beginning of your life. There will be women in your life... perhaps many women... but if you're fortunate you'll find love once.
Bindo.nm35aajole09236_.mp3: Exactly. You're still at the beginning of your life. There will be men in your life... perhaps many men... but if you're fortunate you'll find love once.
Bindo.nm35aajole09237_.mp3: The Jedi, with their damnable sense of over-caution, would tell you love is something to avoid. Thankfully, anyone who's even partially alive knows that's not true.
Bindo.nm35aajole09239_.mp3: Love doesn't lead to the dark side. Passion can lead to rage and fear, and can be controlled... but passion is not the same thing as love.
Bindo.nm35aajole09240_.mp3: Controlling your passions while being in love... that's what they should teach you to beware. But love, itself, will save you... not condemn you.
Bindo.nm35aajole09241_.mp3: Ahhhh, but listen to me go on as if I had all the answers. What do I know of love anymore? I'm just a lonely old man who's not even a Jedi.
Bindo.nm35aajole09243_.mp3: Hmph. Maybe. Do you want to avoid the greatest things in life simply because they come with some complications?
Bindo.nm35aajole09244_.mp3: Love causes pain, certainly. Inevitably love is going to lead to as much sorrow and regret as it does joy. I suppose there are perfect, eternal loves out there... but I haven't seen any.
Bindo.nm35aajole09245_.mp3: How you deal with the bad part of love is what determines your character, what determines the dark side's hold over you.
Bindo.nm35aajole09247_.mp3: I suppose it could. It would take a strong person to make that kind of commitment, I think. Someone with a great sense of self.
Bindo.nm35aajole09249_.mp3: Bah. A life without risk is boring. Is that how you want to live? You want love, you've got to fight for it.
Bindo.nm35aajole09251_.mp3: I haven't changed my mind. I'm still not going to talk about it. You go and find your own love if you want to know so badly.
Bindo.nm35aajole09252_.mp3: I'll tell you one thing: sometimes, no matter how hard you try, you and the one you love simply aren't meant to be together.
Bindo.nm35aajole09253_.mp3: The trick is to know when that is, to know when it's time to fight and when it's time to part ways.
Bindo.nm35aajole09254_.mp3: Hmph... there I go waxing philosophical again. Somebody blast me already! Let's get going before I start talking in riddles, dammit!
Bindo.nm35aajole09256_.mp3: Don't I? Hmph. Maybe you're right. It seems whatever I have to say is falling on deaf ears, anyhow.
Bindo.nm35aajole09257_.mp3: So go on, go on, run amok and kiss the bantha for all I care. I won't comment on it.
Bindo.nm35aajole09259_.mp3: You do, do you? I wouldn't listen too closely... I'm no authority on anything. I just think that the greatest things in life shouldn't be avoided because they come with a few complications.
Bindo.nm35aajole09262_.mp3: And why not? All this nonsense about avoiding love is so much foo-foo. I shouldn't be the only one who realizes that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09264_.mp3: Heh heh. Who said I left the Jedi?
Bindo.nm35aajole09267_.mp3: Well, technically, I was only a Padawan... not that that makes a difference to most. But as for the order, itself... no, I never left it. It left *me*.
Bindo.nm35aajole09269_.mp3: You know what I hate? Well... you know, lots of things, really. But I'm old and easily annoyed. But that's beside the point. What I *really* hate are how most people view the Jedi.
Bindo.nm35aajole09270_.mp3: Everyone thinks that Jedi are perfect, that they can do no wrong. They think the Jedi Council is completely incapable of injustice.
Bindo.nm35aajole09272_.mp3: Hmph. I guess you aren't as stupid as you sometimes act. No doubt you've been on the receiving end of Jedi justice at least once, eh?
Bindo.nm35aajole09274_.mp3: Damn right I disagree. The Jedi are just as capable of injustice as anyone else. They may *try* harder, sure, but sometimes they get it wrong.
Bindo.nm35aajole09276_.mp3: Quiet, you. I'm not talking about me. Talking about the Jedi as a whole. They are just as capable of imperfection and injustice as anyone else, as you can obviously see.
Bindo.nm35aajole09277_.mp3: And I'm not even talking about how some of us fall to the dark side. No, that's plenty indication of our fallibility, but it's something else entirely.
Bindo.nm35aajole09278_.mp3: No, I'm talking about how, more often than not, your average robe-wearing Jedi can try to do the right thing and still be completely *wrong*.
Bindo.nm35aajole09280_.mp3: *sigh* I suppose I'm not being very clear, am I?
Bindo.nm35aajole09281_.mp3: Come to think of it, I don't have to be clear. Someone my age is entitled to ramble, dammit! But for your sake I'll try to explain.
Bindo.nm35aajole09282_.mp3: I'll tell you a little tale about a Jedi Master I once knew. Hortath, I think. Or was it Hartoth? I could never get it straight...
Bindo.nm35aajole09284_.mp3: Where was I, then? Oh. Oh, yes... Master Hortath. He was a kindly old Jedi who meant well, but the most near-sighted thing in the Core, I swear.
Bindo.nm35aajole09285_.mp3: He would walk into walls, knock over tables, mistake apprentices for rancor beasts... that sort of thing. And he was too proud to submit to proper treatment.
Bindo.nm35aajole09286_.mp3: Some used to counsel him and urged "Use the Force, Master Hortath. Allow the Force to see for you." But he refused to believe that his eyes were failing.
Bindo.nm35aajole09287_.mp3: He simply squinted more and more as the years went on, the other Jedi resignedly passing it off as the amusing quirk of a compassionate old man.
Bindo.nm35aajole09289_.mp3: I'm not finished yet! Now shush.
Bindo.nm35aajole09292_.mp3: So one day a young Padawan meets Master Hortath in the courtyard and, not knowing of his blindness, asks him for directions to the Council.
Bindo.nm35aajole09293_.mp3: Quite sure of himself, Hortath gave the lad directions... which happened to lead back outside and away from the enclave.
Bindo.nm35aajole09294_.mp3: The Padawan is confused, naturally. He asks if Master Hortath is sure, and of course Master Hortath says that he is.
Bindo.nm35aajole09295_.mp3: The Padawan suggests that perhaps he should ask someone else... but the proud Hortath now feels insulted. He tells the Padawan to take the route he prescribed and no other.
Bindo.nm35aajole09296_.mp3: Rather dejectedly, the Padawan did as he was told... and so ended up leaving the Jedi Order forever.
Bindo.nm35aajole09297_.mp3: It was decided that the boy's fate was to leave the Order anyway... though whether that was out of respect for Hortath or because the boy went on to something else, well, we'll never know.
Bindo.nm35aajole09301_.mp3: Not much. I never knew the Padawan nor met Master Hortath, himself. He was before my time.
Bindo.nm35aajole09304_.mp3: No, no. Both of them were from before my time. Well before the Sith Wars, even.
Bindo.nm35aajole09306_.mp3: The tale is about blindness and I thought the point was clear. At any rate, you think about it. You're the one who asked why the Jedi left me, remember?
Bindo.nm35aajole09307_.mp3: Now let's get going. My feet are itching for a good run.
Bindo.nm35aajole09309_.mp3: Considering that it's about blindness, I think that's an appropriate response. You're the one who asked why the Jedi left me, remember?
Bindo.nm35aajole09311_.mp3: *Sigh* You know the problem with the youth of today? They're young.
Bindo.nm35aajole09313_.mp3: You're the one who was asking me about the Jedi, dammit! Now do you want the story or not?
Bindo.nm35aajole09316_.mp3: Boring you, am I? Well you just keep your questions to yourself next time. No need for old men to go and make nuisances of themselves.
Bindo.nm35aajole09318_.mp3: No, no. The Jedi always treated me well. It would be foolish and untrue to say otherwise. That's not what I meant, anyway.
Bindo.nm35aajole09320_.mp3: That's true, but it's not what I meant. I guess I'm not being clear, am I?
Bindo.nm35aajole09322_.mp3: Oh, is it? Hmph. There are moments when I think you must be much older than you seem... but this isn't one of them.
Bindo.nm35aajole09324_.mp3: Something wrong with your ears? I thought folks only went deaf when they got to my age. I follow the Jedi Way and use the Force, don't I? That makes me a Jedi last time I checked.
Bindo.nm35aajole09325_.mp3: But the order, itself, the Jedi Council and so forth... no, I'm not a part of that and haven't been for a long time. And good riddance, I say!
Bindo.nm35aajole09329_.mp3: Hmph. A rogue, am I? You speak as if there must be something wrong with me, like not being part of the order makes me a criminal.
Bindo.nm35aajole09331_.mp3: Don't get so uppity, dammit! The point I was trying to make, if you decide to actually listen, is that I never left the order. The order left *me*.
Bindo.nm35aajole09333_.mp3: Bad, bad men. Women, too, to be fair.
Bindo.nm35aajole09335_.mp3: Oh, indeed. They make a fine sandwich, also. Heh heh heh. But don't tell the Jedi Council I said that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09337_.mp3: Who's playing games? Ask the next Sith you see if they're bad and they'll set you straight.
Bindo.nm35aajole09339_.mp3: *sigh* And just what gave you the impression that I know anything more about the Sith than you do?
Bindo.nm35aajole09341_.mp3: Oh... that's right. Damn the ears of the young! I was expecting you to be your usual inattentive self when I mentioned that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09342_.mp3: So it's true, yes, I fought plenty of Sith. That was during the time of Exar Kun... oh, fourty years ago now? Has it been that long?
Bindo.nm35aajole09344_.mp3: No, no, of course not. The Sith have come and gone for ages. They were not called Sith many thousands of years ago, perhaps, but the dark side was always present without a doubt.
Bindo.nm35aajole09345_.mp3: Oh, sure, occasionally the light side comes close to vanquishing the dark, but the dark always returns.
Bindo.nm35aajole09346_.mp3: The fact that Exar Kun was defeated didn't mean the Sith would never return, as they obviously have now. Everyone knows that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09348_.mp3: That... is not a pleasant time to remember. After Exar Kun fell to the dark side, he attempted to recruit other Jedi to his cause.
Bindo.nm35aajole09349_.mp3: What surprised us... what took us completely unprepared... was how utterly successful he was. Many Jedi joined him and became Sith, themselves.
Bindo.nm35aajole09350_.mp3: Why they did I... I will never truly know. But they did. Battle broke out throughout the order... pupil against master, we fought ourselves...
Bindo.nm35aajole09352_.mp3: Yes. More than difficult... next to impossible. How do you fight against someone you love?
Bindo.nm35aajole09354_.mp3: Easy now to call them traitors. Tell me... how do you fight against someone that you love?
Bindo.nm35aajole09355_.mp3: Bah. I dislike such memories. It leaves a taste in the mouth that... it is a sadness I thought I had put aside long ago.
Bindo.nm35aajole09356_.mp3: Ask me again about the war some other time. Just... not now. I would prefer to be by myself for now.
Bindo.nm35aajole09358_.mp3: I've often held the opinion that history has one basic flaw: it is seldom heeded.
Bindo.nm35aajole09359_.mp3: So go on and greet the world with your spite. Let's see where it takes you. You certainly don't need to hear any more from me.
Bindo.nm35aajole09361_.mp3: Ah. Exar was a Jedi who was... corrupted... by ghosts of the old Sith. Or so they say. He attempted to conquer the Republic and create a new Golden Age of the Sith.
Bindo.nm35aajole09363_.mp3: Better to say he was defeated... but essentially, yes. The victory did not come easily, however.
Bindo.nm35aajole09365_.mp3: A Sith believes he commands the Force... but it is the dark side who commands him. You know this, there is little else I could truly add.
Bindo.nm35aajole09372_.mp3: [Success] I suppose you're going to nag me until I cough it up, aren't you? Nothing is private anymore, it looks like.
Bindo.nm35aajole09373_.mp3: *sigh* There's no escaping it, I guess. So be it.
Bindo.nm35aajole09374_.mp3: My wife's name was Nayama. She was the Ukatis enforcer who shot me out of the sky, if you remember.
Bindo.nm35aajole09376_.mp3: My wife had plenty to do with the war. Upon meeting her, I knew right away that she was strong in the Force. That's why she was able to shoot me down.
Bindo.nm35aajole09377_.mp3: Nayama was a marvel of a woman. Fiery, determined, smart... she dragged me to the capital and foiled three of my attempts to escape prison. Oh, and that body...
Bindo.nm35aajole09379_.mp3: Well... yes, that. Needless to say I eventually won her over. That was after I kidnapped her upon being broken out of the Ukatis prison, mind you. But uh, that's another story entirely.
Bindo.nm35aajole09380_.mp3: At any rate, I wanted to train her in the Jedi way. The Council refused my request, naturally. I was still a Padawan at the time.
Bindo.nm35aajole09382_.mp3: I did. I wasn't the first and I won't be the last. The problem with self-righteous folk is they think they're more right than everyone else.
Bindo.nm35aajole09384_.mp3: Easy to say so now. At the time I just thought I was right.
Bindo.nm35aajole09386_.mp3: Nayama was intrigued by the idea of becoming a Jedi. She liked the idea of power too much, perhaps, but I certainly didn't see that at the time.
Bindo.nm35aajole09387_.mp3: I believed in her and trained her in secret. I ignored her willful nature... I loved her too much to see fault in her.
Bindo.nm35aajole09388_.mp3: And she loved me, too. I know she did. At the time, our love was a shared bliss... better than anything I had known before or since.
Bindo.nm35aajole09390_.mp3: Exar Kun is what happened. Nayama was inspired by Exar's promises of a new Golden Age. She wanted to join him.
Bindo.nm35aajole09391_.mp3: She came to me, pleading with me to throw aside what she called the decrepit trappings of the Jedi... to join her in Exar's war.
Bindo.nm35aajole09393_.mp3: I... hadn't thought so. Not right then. I was too proud to believe that of her. I had trained her myself... I loved her.
Bindo.nm35aajole09395_.mp3: No of course I didn't kill her. How could I? I pleaded with her to reconsider, to think about what she was doing.
Bindo.nm35aajole09397_.mp3: I pleaded with her to reconsider, to think about all that she was throwing away... to think about what she would become.
Bindo.nm35aajole09398_.mp3: She would have none of it. Finally, in frustration, she attacked me. She drew her lightsaber and attempted to strike me down.
Bindo.nm35aajole09399_.mp3: It was a scene being repeated everywhere throughout the galaxy. Pupil against master. In my case... it was a long and terrible battle, but I defeated her.
Bindo.nm35aajole09401_.mp3: No... no. I had her at my mercy, disarmed and defenseless. She looked up at me and she knew... she knew I couldn't do it.
Bindo.nm35aajole09403_.mp3: But I should have. Sometimes I convince myself otherwise... but it's no use. She had fallen to the dark side when she raised her saber against me.
Bindo.nm35aajole09405_.mp3: Yes. I think she truly fell the moment she raised up her saber against me. I have played that instant in my head... so many times.
Bindo.nm35aajole09407_.mp3: Was I? Sometimes I convince myself that I couldn't have done otherwise... that I couldn't have seen that she had truly fallen to the dark side. But, yes, I was a fool.
Bindo.nm35aajole09408_.mp3: And I let her go. To my shame, she went on to kill many Jedi during the war until she, herself, was slain in the final battle.
Bindo.nm35aajole09409_.mp3: I grieved for her death, inevitable as it was, even as the Jedi Council put me on trial for my actions once the war was over.
Bindo.nm35aajole09411_.mp3: I had trained Nayama against their wishes. I had failed to kill her when I had the chance, and she went on to kill others.
Bindo.nm35aajole09412_.mp3: It was a travesty, of course. I told you that even the Jedi were capable of great injustices, didn't I?
Bindo.nm35aajole09414_.mp3: Not at all. They found me innocent.
Bindo.nm35aajole09416_.mp3: Of course I deserved to be punished. They found me innocent.
Bindo.nm35aajole09418_.mp3: But I deserved to be tried. They found me innocent.
Bindo.nm35aajole09419_.mp3: Even though I... deserved every punishment and more... they let me go. Mitigating circumstances, they said. I deserved compassion, they said.
Bindo.nm35aajole09420_.mp3: That... that was when the Jedi left me. That was when they failed me.
Bindo.nm35aajole09422_.mp3: No. Maybe you don't, at that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09424_.mp3: For my pride? For my cowardice? Which do you think is the act more befitting a Jedi?
Bindo.nm35aajole09426_.mp3: They may have been able to forgive me. I... could never forgive myself.
Bindo.nm35aajole09429_.mp3: Yes, I do, I suppose. Does that surprise you?
Bindo.nm35aajole09430_.mp3: Ahhh... it is all so long ago. Lost in the winds, I suppose. Nobody cares what an old man believes anymore, do they?
Bindo.nm35aajole09431_.mp3: Let's continue on with the task at hand. I would prefer to think of the present today.
Bindo.nm35aajole09433_.mp3: Bah. You got ears that work, don't you? I was a smuggler, way way back. I got shot down once over Ukatis. THAT story, yes.
Bindo.nm35aajole09435_.mp3: No I'm not senile, dammit! Not yet, anyway. Hmmm... well at least I don't think so. At any rate, I'll tell the story the way I want to.
Bindo.nm35aajole09436_.mp3: [Failure] *Sigh* I'm not interested in your demands. I'll tell my story when I'm damn good and ready... which isn't now, so shoo!
Bindo.nm35aajole09438_.mp3: Hmm. Such a charming and persuasive manner you have there. Forget it!
Bindo.nm35aajole09442_.mp3: Oh, that was not until many years later, to tell the truth. I spent quite some time wandering the galaxy.
Bindo.nm35aajole09444_.mp3: Why wouldn't they? I had refused my promotion to Jedi... I was a Padawan who had left the Order, nothing more.
Bindo.nm35aajole09445_.mp3: I traveled from one civilized system to the next, never staying long. I don't even think I knew what I was searching for.
Bindo.nm35aajole09447_.mp3: Nothing so extravagant. I merely traveled from place to place... I don't even think I knew what I was searching for.
Bindo.nm35aajole09448_.mp3: It wasn't as if my travels were pleasant, either. There were plenty of folks who distrusted the Jedi after the war... or worse.
Bindo.nm35aajole09450_.mp3: If people weren't treating me with suspicion, they were looking at me with greed. I don't know how many thought they could make use of me for their own ends.
Bindo.nm35aajole09451_.mp3: I got so sick of the treachery and deceit I left the civilized parts of the galaxy and headed instead for the uncivilized parts.
Bindo.nm35aajole09453_.mp3: Actually I was on my way somewhere else when I crash-landed on Kashyyyk. The ship I was using was a rust-bucket.
Bindo.nm35aajole09455_.mp3: I'd taken some damage passing through an unexpected asteroid field, as I recall, but I wasn't completely without some systems. I could still guide her a bit when I crashed.
Bindo.nm35aajole09456_.mp3: It wasn't what a would call the smoothest landing, especially considering I ended up smack in the depths of the Shadowlands. But I lived.
Bindo.nm35aajole09458_.mp3: Hmph. I'm no mechanic. And besides, after you plunge nose-first into the trunk of a five-kilometer high tree, chances are you don't have much ship left.
Bindo.nm35aajole09460_.mp3: Sure, why not? It seemed like an interesting enough place to spend a couple of decades exploring.
Bindo.nm35aajole09462_.mp3: Hmmm. That was a challenge at first. You've seen the kind of creatures that exist down there... and you missed the really big ones.
Bindo.nm35aajole09463_.mp3: I was still able to rely on the Force to keep me safe for the most part. The rest of the trick is keeping out of the way of most of the predators.
Bindo.nm35aajole09465_.mp3: No, that's true. Still... most of the creatures grew accustomed to me, and I to them. At least none of them ever heard of a Jedi.
Bindo.nm35aajole09467_.mp3: Bah, what do you know? I'd done enough wandering by that point, thank you very much. I felt at peace in the Shadowlands.
Bindo.nm35aajole09469_.mp3: They did at first, oh yes. I can't say I was overly pleased to encounter a group of indigenous giant carpets either, I can assure you of that.
Bindo.nm35aajole09471_.mp3: No, no. I was the intruder in their land, after all. They got to trust me well enough after a couple of decades of my aid.
Bindo.nm35aajole09473_.mp3: Well that was after two decades of helping them. They certainly didn't trust me at first.
Bindo.nm35aajole09475_.mp3: And why would I have been interested in that? You can't spend five minutes in a Wookiee village without coming out smelling like wet fur.
Bindo.nm35aajole09476_.mp3: No, no, let them rule themselves. They can screw up their history just like every other race before them. No, I helped them in other ways.
Bindo.nm35aajole09478_.mp3: When I could. I would assist the few young ones who would get lost in the Shadowlands or attacked unexpectedly by the wildlife.
Bindo.nm35aajole09479_.mp3: I must say... for a while there, the Wookiees actually thought I was some kind of benevolent forest god. Amusing, really. I set them straight eventually.
Bindo.nm35aajole09481_.mp3: At first, when the slavers took to hunting down lone Wookiees in the fringes of the Shadowlands, I did my best to divert them.
Bindo.nm35aajole09482_.mp3: Later, when Chuundar made his deal I didn't see any point. I wasn't here to save them from their own sad follies, after all.
Bindo.nm35aajole09484_.mp3: Nonsense. I had no idea that's what they were thinking for a long time. I just thought they were being friendly neighbours, leaving fruit and such for me.
Bindo.nm35aajole09485_.mp3: Later, when I started to understand some of their grunting, I realized they would say prayers to the 'hairless one' before descending into the forest.
Bindo.nm35aajole09486_.mp3: Hmph. Hairless one. I used to have plenty of hair, I tell you. *Ahem* Well, at any rate, it took a few bruises, but I set the record straight.
Bindo.nm35aajole09488_.mp3: I traveled to Rrookworro and met with the chieftain in front of everyone. Freyyr swatted at me just to see if I was real or not.
Bindo.nm35aajole09489_.mp3: I was real, and while it was a light swat, Wookiees are terribly strong. I was knocked out cold for a day. The Wookiees all thought it was quite funny.
Bindo.nm35aajole09491_.mp3: Not really. Kashyyyk is a place you can feel very small in. It felt good to devote my time to helping people and living simply.
Bindo.nm35aajole09493_.mp3: What can I say? I did it all for the Wookiees.
Bindo.nm35aajole09495_.mp3: The Wookiees. Well, okay, maybe I needed some time on a quiet and remote planet... but if you ever need a friend, an incredibly strong hairball isn't a bad call.
Bindo.nm35aajole09497_.mp3: Why, thank you. You're not so bad, yourself, all things considered.
Bindo.nm35aajole09499_.mp3: I suppose I am, in a way, despite the smell. For a race of gardeners, they've developed quite interestingly.
Bindo.nm35aajole09501_.mp3: You remember the alien computer, correct? Kashyyyk was meant to be an agricultural planet. The Wookiees were made for a reason.
Bindo.nm35aajole09502_.mp3: Or, at least, that's what I'm thinking. But I'm an old man who's had a long time to develop that opinion, so don't argue with me.
Bindo.nm35aajole09504_.mp3: See? Now you know how I feel half the time.
Bindo.nm35aajole09505_.mp3: At any rate, we should be moving along, don't you think? If you sat around this long in the Shadowlands, a tach would eat you.
Bindo.nm35aajole09509_.mp3: I suppose so. Not everyone would understand why the Jedi would suddenly start killing themselves and tearing up half the galaxy, would they?
Bindo.nm35aajole09511_.mp3: I was lost. I couldn't conceive of returning to the Jedi, so what would you propose I'd done?
Bindo.nm35aajole09518_.mp3: Hmmm... what's the best way for me to approach this? Ah, perhaps it's time for a little story...
Bindo.nm35aajole09522_.mp3: You just keep quiet there, you! I've had to put up with all your busy-body questions, haven't I? Well, now you'll listen to a story, dammit!
Bindo.nm35aajole09523_.mp3: *ahem* Now where was I? Oh yes, the story... you almost made me forget about it. Nice try, but I'm not that old just yet. Heh heh.
Bindo.nm35aajole09524_.mp3: Now, then. A young man sees a terribly venemous snake in his small village. Nervous, he watches the snake carefully until it leaves.
Bindo.nm35aajole09525_.mp3: The young man follows the snake into the forest. He clears the branches out of its path and helps it over obstacles. He even works to keep it fed.
Bindo.nm35aajole09527_.mp3: Shush! Many nights pass and still the young man continues to follow the snake. He even follows it into the sands of the great desert.
Bindo.nm35aajole09528_.mp3: In the desert, the snake eventually grows hungry. It turns and bites the young man, its poison quickly working its way into his system.
Bindo.nm35aajole09529_.mp3: Finally curious, the snake looks at the boy as he lays dying and asks, "Why were you foolish enough to follow me all the way out into the desert?"
Bindo.nm35aajole09530_.mp3: The boy looks back and replies, "Did I follow you? I thought I was leading you away from everyone else..." And then he died.
Bindo.nm35aajole09532_.mp3: Well, now, that's what I wanted to see for myself.
Bindo.nm35aajole09534_.mp3: I've come a long way as it is, and I'm going to die anyway so that doesn't bother me in the least.
Bindo.nm35aajole09536_.mp3: Well, then... let's hope you're not the young man, either.
Bindo.nm35aajole09538_.mp3: The real question is whether or not I'm as frightened as I should be, isn't it?
Bindo.nm35aajole09540_.mp3: I've told you before that you have a destiny before you. This does not mean, however, that your future is already written. They are not the same thing.
Bindo.nm35aajole09541_.mp3: You have the choice of which direction you take your destiny in. More than engine-sucking Andor, certainly... but even he had a choice.
Bindo.nm35aajole09542_.mp3: So far you've chosen to take a darker path. You know the consequences of that... we'll see if you decide to stay your course.
Bindo.nm35aajole09543_.mp3: So far you've chosen to take the lighter path. Can you stay that course, even through the challenges ahead? We'll have to wait and see.
Bindo.nm35aajole09544_.mp3: I'm not here to judge you or tell you which path to take. I'm here ready to offer you my help... should you ask for it.
Bindo.nm35aajole09545_.mp3: I do that because I think it's important. More important than remaining in my home and pretending the galaxy doesn't exist. That's why I'm here.
Bindo.nm35aajole09547_.mp3: Heh. I'm rather glad I came, too, really. You're a fine young lad. I hope... I hope things turn out well for you.
Bindo.nm35aajole09548_.mp3: Heh. I'm rather glad I came, too, really. You're a fine young lass. I hope... I hope things turn out well for you.
Bindo.nm35aajole09550_.mp3: Hmph. So you say, but it's my time to waste. Perhaps I can influence your decision, perhaps not... only time will tell, won't it?
Bindo.nm35aajole09552_.mp3: That's very kind of you, but while elsewhere may be safer, elsewhere isn't where I think I should be. Besides... what's an old man to fear from death, eh?
Bindo.nm35aajole09553_.mp3: Now, then... I've chatted enough for one lifetime. Let's get this show on the road, shall we?
Bindo.nm35aajole09555_.mp3: Oh, I get it. Let's play with the old man's head, is it? He's half-senile, he'll forget I said anything! Wait uh, what was this about, anyway?
Bindo.nm35aajole09556_.mp3: Stop bothering me with your questions! I can barely hear myself think.
Bindo.nm35aajole09557_.mp3: *Sigh* I have no idea what you're talking about. Rabble rabble... what are you saying.
Bindo.nm35aalash07031_.mp3: Now where are you going with this, I wonder?
Bindo.nm35aalash07033_.mp3: It was just an idle question. Don't get so testy, damn it.
Bindo.nm35aautha22169_.mp3: Heh. It shows innovative something, that's for sure.
Bindo.nm35aayuth24014_.mp3: You don't say? Well, the master loves tombs, don't you master?
Bindo.nm35aayuth24206_.mp3: You sound very much like... someone I used to know.
Bindo.nm37aafree04051_.mp3: Now this you don't see every day. This... this is an old spirit full of the Force. I sense great sadness and regret. Walk carefully...
Bindo.nm37aafree04108_.mp3: Hmph. The Sith consumed themselves, did they? Hm. I suppose that eventually that'd be all they'd have left to fight.
Bindo.nm37aashaa05006_.mp3: Hmph. Typical. Always ready to jump at what they perceive to be the easier path.
Bindo.nm38aaassa01110_.mp3: Well... so much for the sanctity of life?
Bindo.nm38abmeke03018_.mp3: There's always remorse. And atonement. That's the harder path, though, boy. Think you can do that?
Bindo.nm39aastar99008_.mp3: The Sith are big on the ancient power of the dark side. It only makes sense we'd find one of those Star Maps in a place like this.
Bindo.nm39aastar99009_.mp3: So, now that we've got the Star Map what say we get out of here. The dampness in these tombs is hard on my old bones.
Bindo.nm39aayuth04107_.mp3: Take an old man's advice, Yuthura. I know the Jedi aren't as perfect as they think they are, but they're way is a lot better than the way of the Sith.
Bindo.nm40aacart05048_.mp3: I don't think I could use my Force powers to convince a whole squadron of troopers to let me go free, but maybe I can use it to get them to take me to a separate cell.
Bindo.nm40aacart05050_.mp3: They'll probably only leave a single guard to watch over an old man like me. I could use the Force to convince the guard to set me free, then I could free the rest of you.
Bindo.nm40aacart05052_.mp3: I've learned a few things in my time, kid. Don't underestimate the Force, for one. But it's your call. If you want to try a different plan, go ahead.
Bindo.nm40aajole07000_.mp3: Guard, I need to speak with you.
Bindo.nm40aajole07004_.mp3: This cell is too drafty. My old bones could catch a chill in here. We don't want that. You better let me out.
Bindo.nm40aajole07008_.mp3: You shouldn't have let me out, sonny. That was wrong. Admiral Karath won't be too happy with you disobeying his orders.
Bindo.nm40aajole07012_.mp3: You deserve to be locked up in the cell for disobeying orders.
Bindo.nm40aajole07018_.mp3: Then I'll be sure to never let you out. Goodbye, sonny.
Bindo.nm40adcart01003_.mp3: Bah. Malak won't kill her, don't be foolish. He'll want to use her battle meditation against the Republic. Turn her to the dark side and the Sith will always be victorious.
Bindo.nm40adcart01057_.mp3: What about me? I already knew who you were, though it wasn't my place to tell you. Better off that you know, if you ask me.
Bindo.nm40adcart01058_.mp3: Does it change anything? I'm not here to judge you. You'll do what you have to, and I'll help if I can.
Bindo.nm40adcart01079_.mp3: Think you'd never heard of the Force before. Seems obvious enough to me it was meant to be.
Bindo.nm40adcart01124_.mp3: Where is Bastila? What happened on that ship?
Bindo.nm41aablac01018_.mp3: Wait a minute - do you understand these creatures? You must have learned their language when you came here in search of the secrets of the Star Forge. Back when you were still Revan.
Bindo.nm41aacart03003_.mp3: She was always in danger of being seduced by the dark side, Carth. Bastila was strong, but she was always impatient and headstrong. Malak preyed upon her weaknesses.
Bindo.nm41aacart03004_.mp3: This planet is a tainted place, the Star Forge and the Temple have twisted the Force into an instrument of evil - just as Malak has twisted Bastila into a servant of the Sith.
Bindo.nm41aacart03006_.mp3: Malak has a strong hold on Bastila now - it will be difficult for her to break free of his influence. Especially considering her long association with you.
Bindo.nm41aacart03008_.mp3: In the end we all choose our own path, but keep in mind the role that you played in her downfall. You and the task assigned to her by the Jedi Council.
Bindo.nm41aacart03009_.mp3: Remember the bond that was forged between you when she rekindled the spark that was your life. Through that bond she touched your memories... and also the echo of the dark taint within you.
Bindo.nm41aacart03013_.mp3: No doubt. I must say that it's good to have you with us, my dear. For a minute there I thought you might decide... well, never mind what I thought.
Bindo.nm41aacart03036_.mp3: I feel more confident now than I ever did before. The Force is with us, Mission.
Bindo.nm41aacart03037_.mp3: Well, I'm an old man and I know you should take love when you can find it. Good for you two, I say.
Bindo.nm41aacart03039_.mp3: Answer: I have no idea what they speak of, droid. Organic meatbags are an eternal mystery to me.
Bindo.nm41aacart03045_.mp3: I'm not sure what's in store for us, but I sense Bastila still has a role to play. I have no doubt she'll be waiting for us on the Star Forge.
Bindo.nm41aacart03049_.mp3: Weakness has nothing to do with the corruption of the dark side. A Jedi must always guard against pride and the desire for power. Especially you.
Bindo.nm41aacart03054_.mp3: She's not dead, Carth - though that might have been easier for you to accept. She's fallen to the dark side and fled to the Star Forge.
Bindo.nm41aacart03115_.mp3: You know, during our rather rapid descent I noticed the hulls of many crashed ships scattered across the landscape. Maybe the parts you need can be found among their wreckage.
Bindo.nm41aacart03126_.mp3: I fear Bastila will find the lure of the dark side difficult to resist. She is strong in the Force, but she is also impulsive, willful and proud - as you once were, Revan.
Bindo.nm41aacart03128_.mp3: I am glad to hear you say that. Now that you know your true identity I was afraid you might slip back over to the dark side. If Bastila feels as you do there may yet be hope for her.
Bindo.nm41aacart03130_.mp3: Let us hope it does not come to that.
Bindo.nm41aacart03134_.mp3: So do I, Mission. So do I.
Bindo.nm41aacart03136_.mp3: I remember... though I hoped you would not be so quick to embrace the being you once were. If Bastila feels as you do then she is lost to us, Revan.
Bindo.nm41aacart03137_.mp3: I just hope we're not too late. Bastila's been Malak's prisoner for a long time. If he turns her to the dark side she'll join him and the Sith will become invincible.
Bindo.nm41aastar03001_.mp3: I can feel the power of the dark side emanating from that space station. It almost feels like... like it's alive. That must be where Malak has taken Bastila.
Bindo.nm41aastar03005_.mp3: What was that? What's wrong? Did one of the Sith fighters hit us?
Bindo.nm41adguid01003_.mp3: Wait... you can't go in there alone!
Bindo.nm41adguid01006_.mp3: You might be walking into a trap... maybe Malak himself is waiting inside. Even if he isn't, that temple will be crawling with Dark Jedi. You'll need all the help you can get.
Bindo.nm41adguid01009_.mp3: Your destiny - maybe the fate of the entire galaxy - could be forever changed inside that Temple. I'm not about to let you face that alone. Not after my premonition. There's a reason I had that vision.
Bindo.nm41adguid01011_.mp3: So you just tell that guide of yours to do whatever he has to do to get us all inside the Temple.
Bindo.nm41adguid01014_.mp3: I don't know what he said, but it sounds like your guide's being stubborn. We don't have time for this.
Bindo.nm41adguid01015_.mp3: The Republic fleet is on the way and we're stuck on this planet until we deactivate that disruptor field. You have to convince him to get us inside that Temple!
Bindo.nm41adguid01020_.mp3: Why do I get the feeling this is going to take a while? Still, we better stay ready. As soon as those shields go down we have to get inside the temple.
Bindo.nm41adguid01025_.mp3: Not exactly the way I would have handled it, but given the circumstances it'll do.
Bindo.nm41adguid01027_.mp3: I had a... a premonition. A vision through the Force. There's great danger inside that Temple. I can't let you face it alone.
Bindo.nm44acevil01030_.mp3: Come on, Bastila. We have to escape before Malak shows up!
Bindo.nm44acevil01053_.mp3: It's not to late for you, Bastila. The dark side is evil but it isn't all powerful. You can still fight against it. Don't let it consume you.
Bindo.nm44acevil01056_.mp3: Listen to me... the dark side leads to death and destruction. I've seen the horrors the Sith have unleashed on the galaxy. Turn away from this path.
Bindo.nm44acevil01058_.mp3: Don't do this, kid. I don't want to, but I'll fight you if I have to. Even if it costs me my life.
Bindo.nm44acevil01064_.mp3: I'm a Jedi... I'll never bow down to the Sith. If you go through with this I have no choice but to do battle against you.
Bindo.nm44acevil01080_.mp3: No! Don't give into your anger. Remain calm, remain focused. Don't let her twist your mind like this!
Bindo.nm44acexit03002_.mp3: Hold on - you have to disable the energy shield around this Temple before we can leave. I saw a computer up here. It might be connected to the power generators of this place.
Bindo.nm44acexit03003_.mp3: And if you don't disable the disruptor field protecting the Star Forge, the Ebon Hawk won't be able to leave the planet without crashing.

Calo.nglobecalo02000_.mp3: I have to give you credit... you've led me on quite a chase. But nobody gets away from Calo Nord in the end!
Calo.nglobecalo02004_.mp3: You got lucky on Taris; the Sith attack saved you from a quick and gruesome death. But I promise you, the Sith won't be getting in my way this time!
Calo.nglobecalo02013_.mp3: Let's go, boys... it's show time!
Calo.nm03aacalo04004_.mp3: There's a bounty on your little green heads. I'm here to collect.
Calo.nm03abcalo03004_.mp3: There's a bounty on your little green heads. I'm here to collect.
Calo.nm08aacalo03000_.mp3: You may have me outnumbered and outgunned, but if I'm going down I'm taking all you with me! This thermal detonator will blow us all to bits!
Calo.nm08aacalo03002_.mp3: Damn those Sith! They'll bring this whole hangar down around our ears!
Calo.nm08aadavi08002_.mp3: It's not like you to take on partners, Canderous. You're getting soft.
Calo.nm08aadavi09004_.mp3: I'll take care of them, Davik. I've been looking forward to this for a long time!
Calo.nstn12stun01009_.mp3: I am hard to kill, Lord Malak.

Carth.nglobebant00000_.mp3: Bastila, I was wondering something. How did those Vulkars manage to capture a famous Jedi like you? Were you knocked out when your escape pod crashed?
Carth.nglobebant00002_.mp3: Fair enough. But I've seen you Jedi in action. There's no way those thugs would have stood a chance against your lightsaber.
Carth.nglobebant00004_.mp3: Wait a minute, let me get this straight. You *lost* your lightsaber? Ha-ha! I mean, isn't that a violation of some kind of Jedi code or something?
Carth.nglobebant00009_.mp3: Hey, hey, hey, don't get mad. I'm sorry. It's just funny to think of a legendary Jedi losing her lightsaber. Take my advice: this is one detail you might want to keep out of the history texts.
Carth.nglobebant00011_.mp3: Bastila, did you ever think about joining all the Jedi who were running off to follow Revan and Malak when they went to fight the Mandalorians?
Carth.nglobebant00013_.mp3: I guess. Still, do you ever wonder if things could have been different? Would Revan and Malak still have been corrupted if the Council had supported them instead of dragging its feet?
Carth.nglobebant00017_.mp3: So you're saying we should have done nothing? Just let the Mandalorians conquer us unopposed? I mean, the Republic was under attack, and the Order abandoned us!
Carth.nglobebant00021_.mp3: Yeah, right. And every single one of them would be speaking Mandalorain. I think we're done here. Let's just get back to the task at hand.
Carth.nglobebant00024_.mp3: I'll be honest, Mission, Taris would rate pretty low. The prejudice, the rich spoiling themselves while the poor are crushed beneath them - not a pretty picture.
Carth.nglobebant00026_.mp3: Trust me, Mission. There are a lot of worlds better than Taris. There are worse, too. But Taris is no place for a kid to live on her own - even a kid who's got a Wookiee to look out for her.
Carth.nglobebant00028_.mp3: Don't you snap at me, missy! You want a lecture? How's this: only bratty little children fly off the handle because of a simple comment.
Carth.nglobebant00032_.mp3: And I sure as hell don't need this. Let's just drop it and get back to what we were doing.
Carth.nglobebant00034_.mp3: Are you ready to have a civil chat? Or are is this going to be another childish tantrum?
Carth.nglobebant00036_.mp3: Yeah, I know. And I'm sorry about what I said, too. I'm just a little on edge lately. Not surprising considering all we've been through. But I shouldn't take it out on you.
Carth.nglobebant00038_.mp3: Mission, you have to know that we don't think you're helpless. Look where we are, look at what we're doing. You're not just along for the ride.  We need you.
Carth.nglobebant00040_.mp3: Ah, it's no big deal. I know how it is. Sometimes you just need to hear a few words of encouragement. Kids are like that.
Carth.nglobebant00044_.mp3: I try not to think about my past battles too much. The horrors of war are something I'd rather not relive.
Carth.nglobebant00048_.mp3: I'm not a warrior, I'm a soldier. There's a difference. Warriors attack and conquer, they prey on the weak. Soldiers defend and protect the innocent - mostly from warriors.
Carth.nglobebant00050_.mp3: Justification through victory? So what happens when you lose? You know, like you did against us.
Carth.nglobebant00052_.mp3: Nice speech. I bet you tell yourself that every night so you can sleep. I don't want to talk about this anymore, Canderous. The war is over. You lost.
Carth.nglobebant00102_.mp3: So, Jolee, you decided to leave your little hermitage in the forest and come help us stop the Sith. I guess you realized this was worth coming out of retirement for, huh?
Carth.nglobebant00104_.mp3: Okay, old man, you lost me there. Are you trying to make a point?
Carth.nglobebant00109_.mp3: That's an interesting theory, but I don't buy it. The Republic stands for something; it's stood for something for fifteen thousand years. And if it falls, everything will change forever.
Carth.nglobecart04932_.mp3: I'm no Jedi, but are you really supposed to be using the Force for things like this?
Carth.nglobecart04933_.mp3: Why did you do that? Sometimes... sometimes I just can't understand how you can be so cruel.
Carth.nglobecart04936_.mp3: With all the violence and bloodshed we've seen, it's kind of nice to help someone for a change.
Carth.nm01aacart01008_.mp3: You made it just in time! There's only one active escape pod left. Come on, we can hide out on the planet below!
Carth.nm01aacart01010_.mp3: I'm a soldier with the Republic, like you. We're the last two crew members left on the Endar Spire.
Carth.nm01aacart01012_.mp3: Bastila's escape pod's already gone, so there's no reason for us to stick around here and get shot by the Sith. Now come on - there'll be time for questions later!
Carth.nm01aacart04931_.mp3: We're hit! Damage is critical! The Hawk won't hold!
Carth.nm02aacarb01000_.mp3: Bastila - you're alive! Finally, things are looking up. Now we just need to figure out a way to get off this planet.
Carth.nm02aacarb01006_.mp3: I know you're new at this, Bastila, but a leader doesn't berate her troops just because things aren't going as planned. Don't let your ego get in the way of the real issues here.
Carth.nm02aacarb01012_.mp3: Your talents might win us a few battles, but that doesn't make you a good leader! A good leader would at least listen to the advice of those who have seen more combat than she ever will!
Carth.nm02aacarb01016_.mp3: First off we can't get hung up on who's in charge; we all need to work together if we want to get off this rock. The answer's out there, we just have to find it.
Carth.nm02aacarb01025_.mp3: You know, I had my doubts about this mission but I figured the Jedi Council wouldn't put you in charge if you weren't prepared. But here you are, acting like a spoiled child!
Carth.nm02aacart02000_.mp3: Whoa, hold on. Don't try to get up yet. You were smashed up pretty bad when we crash landed here on Taris.
Carth.nm02aacart02001_.mp3: Don't worry, we should be safe here in this apartment. I gave you something to help you sleep. Just get some rest and let the kolto packs do their job.
Carth.nm02aacart02002_.mp3: Good to see you up, instead of thrashing around in your sleep. You must have been having one hell of a nightmare. I was wondering if you were ever going to wake up.
Carth.nm02aacart02003_.mp3: I'm Carth, one of the Republic soldiers from the Endar Spire. I was with you on the escape pod, do you remember?
Carth.nm02aacart02005_.mp3: Well, you've been slipping in and out of consciousness for a couple of days now, so I imagine you're pretty confused about things. Try not to worry. We're safe... at least for the moment.
Carth.nm02aacart02006_.mp3: We're in an abandoned apartment on the planet of Taris. You were banged up pretty bad when our escape pod crashed, but luckily I wasn't seriously hurt.
Carth.nm02aacart02007_.mp3: I was able to drag you away from our crash site in all the confusion, and I stumbled onto this abandoned apartment. By the time the Sith arrived on the scene we were long gone.
Carth.nm02aacart02010_.mp3: You don't have to thank me. I've never abandoned anyone on a mission, and I'm not about to start now. Besides, I'm going to need your help.
Carth.nm02aacart02012_.mp3: Taris is under Sith control. Their fleet is orbiting the planet, they've declared martial law and they've imposed a planet-wide quarantine. But I've been in worse spots.
Carth.nm02aacart02013_.mp3: I saw on your service records that you understand a remarkable number of alien languages. That's pretty rare in a raw recruit, but it should come in handy while we're stranded on a foreign world.
Carth.nm02aacart02014_.mp3: There's no way the Republic will be able to get anyone through the Sith blockade to help us. If we're going to find Bastila and get off this planet, we can't rely on anybody but ourselves.
Carth.nm02aacart02016_.mp3: That smack to your head did more damage than I thought. Bastila's a Jedi. She was with the strike team that killed Darth Revan, Malak's Sith master.
Carth.nm02aacart02017_.mp3: Bastila is the key to the whole Republic war effort. The Sith must have found out she was on the Endar Spire and set an ambush for us in this system.
Carth.nm02aacart02018_.mp3: I believe Bastila was on one of the escape pods that crashed down here on Taris. For the sake of the Republic war effort, we have to try and find her.
Carth.nm02aacart02020_.mp3: Bastila is no ordinary Jedi. She has a rare gift the Jedi call Battle Meditation. Bastila's power can influence entire armies.
Carth.nm02aacart02021_.mp3: Through the Force Bastila can inspire her allies with confidence and make her enemies lose their will to fight. Often, that's all it takes to tip the balance in a battle.
Carth.nm02aacart02022_.mp3: Of course, there are limits to what she can do. But from what I understand of her ability, it requires great concentration and focus to maintain her Battle Meditation.
Carth.nm02aacart02023_.mp3: The attack on the Endar Spire happened so fast she never had a chance to use her Battle Meditation. Like us, she barely got out alive.
Carth.nm02aacart02026_.mp3: Bastila's going to need our help. Many of Darth Malak's followers can use the dark side of the Force, and the Sith have already killed more than their share of Jedi in this war.
Carth.nm02aacart02027_.mp3: Nobody will be looking for a couple of common soldiers like us. And if we're careful we can move about the planet without attracting notice; a luxury Bastila won't have.
Carth.nm02aacart02028_.mp3: She's going to have half the Sith fleet looking for her. They know how important she is to the war effort.
Carth.nm02aacart02030_.mp3: Bastila's going to need our help. Many of Darth Malak's followers have mastered the dark side of the Force, and the Sith have already killed more than their share of Jedi in this war.
Carth.nm02aacart02031_.mp3: I doubt anyone's specifically looking for us anymore: we're not that important. But if we're careful we can move about the planet without attracting notice; a luxury Bastila won't have.
Carth.nm02aacart02032_.mp3: She's going to have half the Sith fleet looking for her. They know how vital she is to the war effort.
Carth.nm02aacart02033_.mp3: Bastila is no ordinary Jedi. She has a rare gift the Jedi call Battle Meditation. Bastila's power can influence entire armies.
Carth.nm02aacart02035_.mp3: Through the Force Bastila can inspire her allies with confidence and make her enemies lose their will to fight. And often, that's all it takes to tip the balance in a battle.
Carth.nm02aacart02036_.mp3: But there are limits to what she can do. From what I understand of her ability, it requires great concentration and focus to maintain her Battle Meditation.
Carth.nm02aacart02037_.mp3: The attack on the Endar Spire happened so fast she probably never even had a chance to use her power. I'm guessing she barely got out alive, and now she's trapped here just as we are.
Carth.nm02aacart02038_.mp3: The whole planet is under quarantine. No ships can land or take-off. So if Bastila's going to escape Taris, she's going to need our help. And we'll probably need hers.
Carth.nm02aacart02040_.mp3: While you were out I did some scouting around. There are reports of a couple escape pods crashing down into the Undercity. That's probably a good place to start.
Carth.nm02aacart02041_.mp3: But the Undercity is a dangerous place. We don't want to go in there unprepared. It won't do Bastila any good if we go and get ourselves killed.
Carth.nm02aacart02042_.mp3: Taris is a pretty big place; luckily I found an old swoop droid to help us get around. I've got him sitting by the apartment door. Do you know how a swoop droid works?
Carth.nm02aacart02044_.mp3: Swoop droids are autopiloted land speeders. Through remote signals we can have them fly in to pick us up or drop us off at a location in a fraction of the time it would take to walk there.
Carth.nm02aacart02045_.mp3: The swoop can only operate in large, open locations. It can't take us down into the Undercity or inside a shop, but it could take us to a central location in the Upper or Lower City.
Carth.nm02aacart02046_.mp3: You can signal the swoop from the map screen of your datapad. It uses the map coordinates to plot its course, so if we haven't explored an area the swoop can't get the data to access it.
Carth.nm02aacart02048_.mp3: I've entered all the details on how to use the swoop droid into the electronic journal on your datapad if you want to check them out later.
Carth.nm02aacart02050_.mp3: I'll tell you whatever I can, though I...I don't know how much help it'll be.
Carth.nm02aacart02052_.mp3: I understand why you want to know more about me; I...I kinda get the feeling we'll be spending a lot of time together over the next while.
Carth.nm02aacart02053_.mp3: But this isn't really the best time for long introductions; we should stay focused on the task at hand. There'll be time for that later.
Carth.nm02aacart02055_.mp3: Everything I know about Malak is pretty much common knowledge. He escaped the trap that killed Darth Revan, his Sith Master. With Revan's death, Malak became the new Dark Lord.
Carth.nm02aacart02056_.mp3: It's obvious that Malak's a ruthless tyrant who'll crush anyone who stands in his way... just like Revan was. Experience has shown that the Sith won't stop until the Republic lies in ruins.
Carth.nm02aacart02057_.mp3: Malak and his Sith don't respect anything except raw, brutal power. It's hard to imagine how someone who used to be a Jedi could become such a monster!
Carth.nm02aacart02059_.mp3: Malak and Revan were once both part of the Jedi Order, but they were young and headstrong. And against the wishes of the Council they went to battle the Mandalorians on the Outer Rim.
Carth.nm02aacart02060_.mp3: Something happened out there. Something corrupted them and drew them over to the dark side. Or maybe there was something rotten inside them all along. I don't know.
Carth.nm02aacart02061_.mp3: They formed an army of ex-Republic soldiers and Jedi who had fallen to the dark side, with Revan at their head... until Revan was killed by Bastila's Jedi strike team.
Carth.nm02aacart02062_.mp3: But even that didn't slow the Sith down. Malak just stepped in and assumed Revan's role. He took control of the Sith armada and resumed the bloody conquest of the Outer Worlds.
Carth.nm02aacart02064_.mp3: How can you say that? The Sith are butchers! Soldiers, civilians - I mean, they don't care who they kill! Even...even children!
Carth.nm02aacart02065_.mp3: Right now the Republic is the only thing keeping Malak's brutal fist from crushing the entire galaxy... and it won't be long until even the Republic falls to the Sith fleet.
Carth.nm02aacart02067_.mp3: I hope you're right. But the Republic hasn't been able to stop them so far, even with the support of the Jedi Council. I think Bastila might be the galaxy's last hope.
Carth.nm02aacart02071_.mp3: Taris was once a magnificent planet-wide metropolis of towering skyscrapers. But that was a long time ago.
Carth.nm02aacart02072_.mp3: The Upper City, where the rich citizens live, is...is still pretty safe. If it wasn't for the Sith occupation and the planet-wide quarantine it might not even be that bad a place to live.
Carth.nm02aacart02073_.mp3: But farther down things have degenerated. The...the Lower City is nothing but a slum overrun by swoop-bike gangs waging a never-ending war for control. And the Undercity is, well, even worse.
Carth.nm02aacart02074_.mp3: The lowest level of Taris is a wasteland overrun by rakghouls; mindless, diseased mutants that attack on sight. I've already entered all this info into your data-pad journal.
Carth.nm02aacart02077_.mp3: Good idea. We can use this abandoned apartment as a base, and we can probably get some equipment and supplies here in the Upper City. Just remember to keep a low profile.
Carth.nm02aacart02078_.mp3: I've heard some grim stories about the Dark Jedi interrogation techniques. They say the Force can do terrible things to a mind. It can wipe away your memories and destroy your very identity!
Carth.nm02aacart02079_.mp3: But I figure if we don't do anything stupid we should be okay. I mean, after all, they're... they're looking for Bastila, not a couple of grunts like us. Alright, soldier, let's move out.
Carth.nm02aacart02082_.mp3: You mean besides a chance to get off this planet before the Sith find you? Do you...do you have any idea what the Sith do to prisoners of war?
Carth.nm02aacart02084_.mp3: Good. We need to work together if we're going to survive.
Carth.nm02aacart02086_.mp3: Oh, I get it. Never mind that the Sith will destroy the Republic and ravage the galaxy. You're only in this for the credits.
Carth.nm02aacart02087_.mp3: Don't worry. The Republic pays its mercenaries well. You help me find Bastila and they'll make it more than worth your while, I'm sure. Plus, it might be your only chance to get off Taris.
Carth.nm02aacart02089_.mp3: Don't be a fool! You're not getting off this world without help, and you can't hide here forever. Do you have any idea what will happen when the Sith find you?
Carth.nm02aacart02093_.mp3: I don't. But Bastila's young, and she has a powerful command of the Force. We survived the crash landing, so I'm willing to bet that she may have, too.
Carth.nm02aacart02094_.mp3: Besides, what's the alternative? I mean, if she's dead, then no one can stop Malak and his Sith from wiping out the Republic. And I'd rather operate on the assumption that she survived.
Carth.nm02aacart02096_.mp3: I don't think you understand the situation. We can't hide on this planet forever. Eventually the Sith will find us... and, trust me, you don't want that.
Carth.nm02aacart02097_.mp3: Getting off this world isn't going to be easy... we'll probably need Bastila's help. Not to mention that without her, the whole Republic war effort is doomed.
Carth.nm02aacart02101_.mp3: I'm not surprised. You took a serious blow to the head. You're probably having all kinds of strange dreams. I wouldn't worry too much about it.
Carth.nm02aadia004066_.mp3: What's wrong with you? She doesn't deserve this!
Carth.nm02aajani05016_.mp3: There's no need to antagonize the man. Besides... do you want to live in filth? I sure don't.
Carth.nm02aalarr06024_.mp3: Look, I know we're trying to keep a low profile but this kind of attitude will draw attention we don't need.
Carth.nm02aalarr99029_.mp3: And I can tell you from experience that they aren't any good at all against a simple vibroblade. That's why the Republic has been training soldiers in hand-to-hand and melee combat.
Carth.nm02abbull02010_.mp3: You're giving him a hundred credits? Generous.
Carth.nm02abbull02018_.mp3: Are you joking? We don't need this guy's credits. Just go on, we were happy to help.
Carth.nm02abdrun05032_.mp3: Oh, great. We're fighting the drunks, are we? Man, do they stink.
Carth.nm02abgort09042_.mp3: Come on. We should keep moving. Kook or no, people like him can make trouble for us.
Carth.nm02abithb10020_.mp3: Hey, aren't you...? Hey, hey stop that, you kids! Leave him alone!
Carth.nm02abithb10035_.mp3: Well, I will. You kids... get lost before I kick your sorry butts! Now, now beat it!!
Carth.nm02abjani11121_.mp3: You'd think people would be a little more tolerant of others in this day and age. *sigh* I guess stupidity and ignorance will never go out of style.
Carth.nm02absith18022_.mp3: *whispers* We're going to need some kind of disguise if we want to get past this guy.
Carth.nm02acboun01030_.mp3: *whisper* I know we have to be careful about drawing attention to ourselves, but are we just going to let them drag this guy off?
Carth.nm02acgurn03035_.mp3: If you haven't noticed, not much about this place is fair.
Carth.nm02acgurn03037_.mp3: That doesn't mean we have to actively work to make it worse, Carth.
Carth.nm02acgurn03039_.mp3: We're not in a position to be much more than just realists, are we?
Carth.nm02acgurn03051_.mp3: And then only the rich could afford the cure. Just let the poor suffer, right?
Carth.nm02ackebl04042_.mp3: Hmm. I've heard of the Exchange. Bad organization to cross. If anyone has blockade-breaking ships, however, it's them.
Carth.nm02ackebl04070_.mp3: Mostly? What do you mean by that?
Carth.nm02aczelk11006_.mp3: Well, for that you have my thanks. It's good to know that at least some of these men ended up in compassionate hands.
Carth.nm02aczelk11018_.mp3: No, it's *not*. The Sith would torture these men, or worse. You're not threatening this man while I'm present.
Carth.nm02aczelk11026_.mp3: I understand some extra credits might help us in our mission, but I don't approve of your methods. Zelka's a good man... you shouldn't have done that.
Carth.nm02aczelk11184_.mp3: So you twisted a few extra credits out of him. Hope it was worth it.
Carth.nm02adalie03006_.mp3: What are you doing? There's no need to go around drawing attention to ourselves. You there... just get out of here.
Carth.nm02adsarn07036_.mp3: You've got to expect at least a little risk if you want some credits, don't you?
Carth.nm02adsarn07053_.mp3: Sounds like this could work. Mind you, do we really have another choice?
Carth.nm02adscar09039_.mp3: Wow, that was sure generous of you. I just hope we don't end up needing those credits later on.
Carth.nm02adscar09040_.mp3: I know we might need credits, but there has got to be a better way to get them than this!
Carth.nm02adsith10057_.mp3: *whisper* I know all about Sith interrogations. This isn't going to end well.
Carth.nm02adyung12049_.mp3: Sounds like this could work. Not like we have much choice in the matter though, do we?
Carth.nm02aebend03033_.mp3: You sure you want to get involved in this? Seems a bit pointless to me. Up to you.
Carth.nm02aecand30008_.mp3: Careful. Mercs like this haven't a lick of conscience... they'll betray you in a heartbeat. This could be a trap.
Carth.nm02aecand30039_.mp3: Well, That's... it's not a bad plan. It might just work.
Carth.nm02aecand30060_.mp3: Hmm. Much as I hate to say it, he's probably right. We're going to need that ship.
Carth.nm02aeduel12121_.mp3: Vibroblades and blasters? And nobody ever dies? How come I get the feeling you're trying to take us for a ride?
Carth.nm02aeduel12122_.mp3: This is for the best. We could use the credits from these duels, but using your real name is too risky. The Sith might have come across a crew manifest back on the Endar Spire.
Carth.nm02aegana14022_.mp3: *whisper* Careful what you say. I get the feeling this spoiled brat could cause us more trouble than she's worth.
Carth.nm03aacand05010_.mp3: Careful. Mercs like this haven't a lick of conscience... they'll betray you in a heartbeat. This could be a trap.
Carth.nm03aacand05038_.mp3: That's... not a bad plan. It might just work.
Carth.nm03aacand05053_.mp3: Hmm. Much as I hate to say it, he's probably right. We're going to need that ship.
Carth.nm03aakand01004_.mp3: And when we win the race, we get Bastila, right?
Carth.nm03aakand01009_.mp3: Explode? Are you crazy? Why would we risk riding that thing, then?
Carth.nm03aakand01025_.mp3: You're talking like Brejik didn't steal that engine, himself, to begin with!
Carth.nm03aakand01050_.mp3: Are you sure about this? I want to get Bastila back... but taking contracts to kill people is a bit much. Even if it is just more biker scum.
Carth.nm03admatr99075_.mp3: Hold on a second. I want to hear what he means by 'clear conscience'.
Carth.nm03aecand06008_.mp3: Careful. Mercs like this haven't a lick of conscience... they'll betray you in a heartbeat. This could be a trap.
Carth.nm03aecand06039_.mp3: That's... not a bad plan. It might just work.
Carth.nm03aecand06060_.mp3: Hmm. Much as I hate to say it, he's...he's probably right. We're going to need that ship.
Carth.nm03aehold13087_.mp3: Yeah, right. Sounds to me like she was defending herself.
Carth.nm03aemiss14037_.mp3: So we noticed. Still, you seem like an odd pair.
Carth.nm03aemiss14074_.mp3: You showed a lot of guts dealing with those Vulkars, kid. You got a name?
