Carth.nm03ae_zax22086_.mp3: It couldn't hurt, could it? Enough credits could help grease a lot of wheels.
Carth.nm03ae_zax22090_.mp3: Well, it's my experience that the targets of these bounties are usually criminals, themselves. So don't get all in a twist over it.
Carth.nm03ae_zax22195_.mp3: I can't see anything wrong with getting rid of people like that - as long as we don't end up on the list of their victims.
Carth.nm03ae_zax22196_.mp3: Okay, I don't know about Davik's special contracts. Justice is one thing, but doing a crime lord's dirty work is something else.
Carth.nm04aagend05047_.mp3: No offense, but I can see why people normally avoid this place.
Carth.nm04aaigea07074_.mp3: I get the feeling if it wasn't for Gendar, this place would be a lot worse off than it is.
Carth.nm04aaigea07075_.mp3: Watch yourself. There's something slimy about this guy. I wouldn't trust him as far as I could throw him.
Carth.nm04aamiss10026_.mp3: Do you know where he's being kept?
Carth.nm04aamiss10038_.mp3: I guess with a Wookiee at your side you've got to figure you can handle the odd rakghoul attack.
Carth.nm04aamiss10039_.mp3: Hold on a second. Don't just brush her off like this; Gadon said this girl's the only one who can get us inside the Bek base.
Carth.nm04aaoutm14060_.mp3: I don't believe this planet! Even the beggars are trying to shake us down.
Carth.nm04aaoutm14062_.mp3: I'm sure you are, miss. It's just too bad your little welcoming committee is there to give people a bad first impression.
Carth.nm04aaoutw23039_.mp3: So you just lock them away in a cage?
Carth.nm04aaruki25053_.mp3: Be careful... this one might be crazy enough to be dangerous.
Carth.nm04aaruki25151_.mp3: From what I've seen of Taris, it doesn't look like much has changed. Except for the Upper City, people here are just as bad off as the poor in your little history.
Carth.nm04aaruki25152_.mp3: Sounds like a myth to me. Something to give the people here some false hope to cling to so they don't go mad with despair.
Carth.nm08aadavs10019_.mp3: There's no need to threaten these poor women. It's not their fault their life is like this.
Carth.nm08aadavs10044_.mp3: Umm... not to interrupt your fun, but we do have to get underway...
Carth.nm08aadavs11036_.mp3: Come on. I mean... I love a massage as much as the next guy, but we're not exactly on vacation here. We need to get going.
Carth.nm08aahudr11013_.mp3: We should go now. We got what we needed.
Carth.nm08aahudr11020_.mp3: Hey! There's no need for that. Just... just run, pal, before my friend here decides to start blasting.
Carth.nm08aahudr11043_.mp3: We may need that ship. Are you sure we shouldn't free him?
Carth.nm10aavulk05004_.mp3: Why? What's up on the second level?
Carth.nm10aavulk05012_.mp3: You...you don't think he could be of help? I mean, why kill him?
Carth.nm10aavulk05016_.mp3: Well, not that I object, really. I just... I'd rather not throw aside anything that could help us right now.
Carth.nm10aavulk05032_.mp3: Wait, now... we, we could probably use this guy, don't you think?
Carth.nm10aavulk05035_.mp3: Okay, you hear that, scum? You get a reprieve. Now give us some information to make it worth it.
Carth.nm10aawait07013_.mp3: You may know more than you think, miss. Help us and we'll help you, okay?
Carth.nm10aawait07029_.mp3: No, no wait. This girl is no threat to us. Just run along, miss, and get out of here. And do it quickly before the Vulkars come back.
Carth.nm10abvulk08012_.mp3: Th...that's us. New lab techs. You're a perceptive one.
Carth.nm10ackand01006_.mp3: And when we win the race, we get Bastila, right?
Carth.nm10ackand01013_.mp3: Explode? Are...are you crazy? Why would we risk riding that thing, then?
Carth.nm10ackand01038_.mp3: You're talking like Brejik didn't steal that engine, himself, to begin with!
Carth.nm10ackand01079_.mp3: Are you sure about this? I mean, I want to get Bastila back... but taking contracts to kill people is a bit much. Even if it is just more biker scum.
Carth.nm11aagado02010_.mp3: Don't fool yourself. The Sith would never commit to that kind of operation. They'd... they'd probably do something much more grand and deadly.
Carth.nm11aagado02038_.mp3: So how do you propose we go about rescuing Bastila, then? We can't fight all the gangs.
Carth.nm11aagado02101_.mp3: Uh, very tactful. Are you itching for a fight or something?
Carth.nm11aagado02173_.mp3: They still think Bastila is just a Republic Officer. That could work to our advantage. Maybe she'll even figure out a way to escape from the Vulkar base on her own.
Carth.nm11aazaer09030_.mp3: Gadon sounds like the kind of person who you'd want in charge down here. At least to me.
Carth.nm12aabast01001_.mp3: Safe? You saw what his fleet did to Taris: there wasn't a building over two stories high left standing! They...they turned the planet into one big pile of rubble.
Carth.nm12aabast01005_.mp3: Maybe you're right. It isn't easy to witness the annihilation of an entire planet. I know Mission must be taking it pretty hard.
Carth.nm12aac02001001_.mp3: Sith Interdictor ship. They must have been waiting for us on the hyperspace route. We're caught in their tractor beam.
Carth.nm12aac02001003_.mp3: It's the Leviathan. Saul Karath's vessel. My old mentor.
Carth.nm12aac03001000_.mp3: The Star Forge... I've never seen anything like it.
Carth.nm12aac03001001_.mp3: I'm transmitting these coordinates to Admiral Dodonna.  Maybe a quick strike by the Republic can cripple the Sith fleet.
Carth.nm12aac03001002_.mp3: Message is away. Now we can just wait for the Republic to show up. We should be safe here - we're outside their sensor range.
Carth.nm12aac03001004_.mp3: A small vanguard of Sith fighters, coming in hard!  Someone needs to get on those gun turrets. ## Take those fighters out before they report our position to the main fleet!
Carth.nm12aac04001000_.mp3: We've got problems! We've flown into some kind of disruptor field. All my instruments are jammed! We've got massive overloads in all systems!
Carth.nm12aac04001001_.mp3: I'm picking up a single planet in this system.  I'll try and put us down there.  Hold on.
Carth.nm12aac05001000_.mp3: The Republic Fleet must have got the message I sent as we were crashing onto that planet. I'm picking up a transmission from them now.
Carth.nm12aac05001002_.mp3: Admiral Dodonna, this is Carth Onasi. We are receiving your transmission.
Carth.nm12aac05001004_.mp3: The Star Forge wasn't constructed by the Sith, Admiral. We don't have time for me to fully explain it, but that space station is far older than you can imagine.
Carth.nm12aac05001006_.mp3: You can't do that, Admiral.  The Star Forge is a factory of immense power.  It's been churning out the capital ships, snub fighters and assault droids that have powered the Sith war effort. ## You have to destroy the Star Forge now or you'll be fighting an unending wave of reinforcements.
Carth.nm12aac05001011_.mp3: It's because of Bastila, Admiral.  She turned to the dark side and become Malak's apprentice. ## We suspect she's somewhere on that space station right now, ## using her Battle Meditation against you and your fleet.
Carth.nm12aac05001021_.mp3: Don't worry, Admiral. The Ebon Hawk and her crew are going to see this through to the end!
Carth.nm12aastar03000_.mp3: The Star Forge... it's huge. I've never seen anything like it before.
Carth.nm12aastar03002_.mp3: I'm transmitting these co-ordinates to Admiral Dodonna. Maybe a quick strike by the Republic can cripple the Sith fleet.
Carth.nm12aastar03003_.mp3: Message is away. We should probably wait for the Republic fleet to show up before we try and rescue Bastila. We'll need cover if we want to fly in and dock on the Star Forge.
Carth.nm12aastar03004_.mp3: We've got company... a small vanguard of Sith fighters, coming in hard! Get on those gun turrets! Take those fighters out before they report our position to the main fleet!
Carth.nm12aastar03006_.mp3: No, it's something else. We've flown into some kind of disruptor field. All my instruments are jammed... we've got massive overloads on all systems!
Carth.nm12aastar03007_.mp3: I'm picking up a single planet in this system. I'll try and put us down here. Hold on - this may be a rough landing.
Carth.nm13aaahla03013_.mp3: Not to mention that I wouldn't mind getting out of this enclave for a bit. I mean, come on, how bad could it be?
Carth.nm13aabast01006_.mp3: This looks like a door... but I don't see any way to open it
Carth.nm13aabast01022_.mp3: An audience with the Jedi Council? That's pretty unusual for someone who isn't even a Jedi. What's this about, Bastila?
Carth.nm13aabast01026_.mp3: Well, I don't like being left out of the loop, but I'm not looking to get you in any trouble with the Jedi Masters. We'll do things your way for a while.
Carth.nm13aacart02000_.mp3: Dantooine looks peaceful enough, but packs of kath hounds roam these plains. We need to keep our guard up while we're out here.
Carth.nm13aacart02002_.mp3: Patrol droids - they may be programmed to attack on sight!
Carth.nm13aacart02004_.mp3: This morning's getting stranger by the minute. First Bastila comes out looking like she saw a ghost, and now you.
Carth.nm13aacart02006_.mp3: Well, Bastila did mention that you should go to the Council chambers before she left. It is no doubt urgent, so you shouldn't keep them waiting.
Carth.nm13aacart02008_.mp3: No, she didn't. She didn't seem well, as I recall... and for that matter neither do you. Are you alright?
Carth.nm13aacart02012_.mp3: Well, I can't say I blame you. I... I haven't exactly been sleeping well myself. Here I thought things would get better once we escaped Taris.
Carth.nm13aacrat07088_.mp3: I'm not an expert on the Jedi, but this seems like the kind of thing that could get a person into a lot of trouble.
Carth.nm13aajuha11026_.mp3: First the Jedi trick you into becoming an enemy, then they welcome you back as a friend. I can't say I approve of their training methods.
Carth.nm13aashen16004_.mp3: I wish you the best of luck, Shen. I hope you two find the happiness I once knew myself.
Carth.nm13aavand17310_.mp3: *whisper* It's obvious he doesn't believe you. He must have some reason for letting you get away with this lie. I swear, I'll never understand these Jedi.
Carth.nm14aaelis04038_.mp3: Wow. She really misses her droid, doesn't she?
Carth.nm14aaelis09008_.mp3: I don't think I've ever felt so bad for a droid before.
Carth.nm14aajon006024_.mp3: Is that an impersonation of Bastila? If it is, it's a good one.
Carth.nm14aajon006031_.mp3: I say we look for these Mandalorians. I fought them in the war... they're nothing but vicious pirates. We should... we should stop them if we can.
Carth.nm14abahla01005_.mp3: Somehow I imagine the story from the Sandrals would sound just about the same, don't you?
Carth.nm14abahla01028_.mp3: You would be willing to risk open war over this?
Carth.nm14abahla01030_.mp3: And here I thought you would blame us, if we failed. It seems everyone is responsible for your actions except for you.
Carth.nm14abahla01033_.mp3: What can I say? You pick up a few things.
Carth.nm14abahla01050_.mp3: I've seen men like Ahlan Matale before. He's so convinced that his hatred is justified he's prepared to do anything. And if we don't intervene, there will be war.
Carth.nm14abmdro03007_.mp3: These settlers have come to Dantooine seeking privacy. Perhaps we should respect their wishes.
Carth.nm14acbolo01023_.mp3: Heh heh... that's sort of funny, but you should really be serious about this, no?
Carth.nm14acbolo01346_.mp3: You did good. You might just make a proper Jedi yet, who knows?
Carth.nm14acbolo01351_.mp3: Maybe he thought he was shooting Calder?
Carth.nm14adcuts02362_.mp3: What are you doing? Are trying to get everyone here killed?
Carth.nm15aabast02014_.mp3: That sounds like quite a supposition. What if you're wrong?
Carth.nm16aanuri01014_.mp3: That's quite a line. You actually believe that? Don't you think someone is allowed to value privacy?
Carth.nm16aanuri01018_.mp3: Actually, it is. All I'm saying is that not everybody welcomes the sight of a Jedi with open arms. Better get used to it.
Carth.nm16aanuri01020_.mp3: I've seen an evasion or two in my time... enough to know when I hear it.
Carth.nm16aanuri01058_.mp3: This man just lost his son! I can't believe you're trying to squeeze extra credits out of him.
Carth.nm16aaraha02010_.mp3: You don't think that perhaps there's more to look at here, do you? That maybe everything isn't what it appears?
Carth.nm16aaraha02036_.mp3: Yeah, that's the way to go about it. Make things worse for these people, why don't you?
Carth.nm17aa03sh01059_.mp3: Why did you do that?! It's not like we're badly in need of credits, for crying out loud.
Carth.nm17aa03sh01117_.mp3: No justice. Makes you wonder sometimes if the Republic even exists at all, out here.
Carth.nm17aa03sh01160_.mp3: This isn't right! We should be helping people, not making their lives miserable.
Carth.nm17aa03sh01164_.mp3: I'm glad to see we're still the good guys here. Sometimes I think we forget that.
Carth.nm17aa11iz05063_.mp3: Leader of our tribe? Heh. That's a new one.
Carth.nm17aa11iz05104_.mp3: Hmm. I wonder just how long ago the little fella is talking, here?
Carth.nm17aa11iz05116_.mp3: What. You're joking, right? Just because he's small doesn't mean he's any more trustworthy than a Gamorrean, Bastila. Don't be naive.
Carth.nm17aa11iz05120_.mp3: Well, you might have pointed that out in the first place. Jedi senses I trust. Wishful thinking I don't.
Carth.nm17aaiziz99152_.mp3: I know Jawas don't have the best reputation, but that doesn't mean we can just treat them like this!
Carth.nm17ac08hk01079_.mp3: Droid like this usually doesn't have former owners that survived, it would be my guess.
Carth.nm17ac08yu02017_.mp3: Sounds like you've got a faulty droid on your hands.
Carth.nm17ac08yu02075_.mp3: And was this a droid of his own... or something stored in that warehouse?
Carth.nm17ad03gu03016_.mp3: Hey, don't push your luck, fellas.
Carth.nm17ad03gu03051_.mp3: There's only one language you Gamorreans ever understand. A blaster to your forehead.
Carth.nm17ad03ta06014_.mp3: Hey! You talk to her with a bit of respect in your voice or you'll end this conversation minus a few teeth! Got it?
Carth.nm17ae04ce02099_.mp3: Right. Tell me why we're talking to this guy again?
Carth.nm17ae04ce02108_.mp3: I'm sure they wouldn't mind *some* of the credits, as opposed to getting it stolen out of their pockets.
Carth.nm17ae04ga03063_.mp3: Maybe we should spend less time shaking people down for credits and more time on finding a way to stop the Sith.
Carth.nm17ae04ni04009_.mp3: I'm impressed, helping a kid like Nico off to a decent start. Good job.
Carth.nm17ae04ni04106_.mp3: That Hutt's going to suck every credit he can out of that kid, then toss him aside. Might as well have sold him to slavers.
Carth.nm17af07ja05010_.mp3: Hence the 'unclear' part. Or did you miss that?
Carth.nm17af07ja05023_.mp3: Hmm. These Jawas sure aren't the trusting type, are they?
Carth.nm17af07ja05027_.mp3: Well, for once, I'll agree with you.
Carth.nm17ag10cz01175_.mp3: *whisper* I don't know much about the Jedi code, but I know I'd rather see those credits in our hands than in the hands of Czerka Corp or the Sith.
Carth.nm18ab10ta05019_.mp3: *sigh* I guess we should help him out.
Carth.nm18ackoma99135_.mp3: There's an unwritten code of loyalty. You just don't turn on your allies like this. Any good soldier would tell you that.
Carth.nm18acstar99000_.mp3: Anyone else get the feeling that finding this Star Map in the back of this krayt dragon's cave is more than just a coincidence?
Carth.nm18acstar99007_.mp3: We should probably get going now. We've found the Star Map, and I'm guessing there isn't much else worth seeing on this planet.
Carth.nm22aadaso07060_.mp3: I have to admit, I'm surprised you let him get away. I don't know if I could have been as forgiving.
Carth.nm22aaelix08042_.mp3: No business sense? You mean they don't like to be cheated out of all their belongings and freedom.
Carth.nm22aaelix08057_.mp3: No, they're not. An honest man is pretty scarce, too, wouldn't you say?
Carth.nm22aajano06095_.mp3: Humane, you call it? Beneficial? Sounds like a bunch of excuses, if you ask me.
Carth.nm22aajano06097_.mp3: Are you saying you approve of this?!
Carth.nm22aajano06111_.mp3: Odd energy signatures? Have you ever checked those out?
Carth.nm22aazaal01036_.mp3: The Wookiee was looking pretty agitated back in the ship. You think it's wise to leave him unattended?
Carth.nm22aazaal01038_.mp3: He looked like there was something he needed to do. Besides, we don't know this planet. He could prove useful.
Carth.nm22aazaal01040_.mp3: Good or bad, he's got to have some interest in Kashyyyk. I'd rather have him with us.
Carth.nm22aazaal01042_.mp3: I agree, but he could prove useful. He'd certainly know the place. And I wouldn't mind keeping an eye on him.
Carth.nm22abchor02044_.mp3: Why not do something about it, then?
Carth.nm22abdehn06018_.mp3: Put it down? You killed him, you mean.
Carth.nm22abdehn06111_.mp3: It's a good thing Zaalbar isn't here to see this. I doubt he'd approve of what you're doing. Actually, I don't know if I approve, either.
Carth.nm22abzaal01026_.mp3: This planet is incredible! It's too bad Zaalbar isn't with us. It would be nice to have a guide who's familiar with this place.
Carth.nm23acworr01078_.mp3: Good thinking. Jaarak doesn't strike me as the type to murder for no reason.
Carth.nm23adchuu01143_.mp3: Are you going to second-guess everyone?
Carth.nm23adchuu01250_.mp3: I don't like leaving someone behind, but I guess we don't have a choice.
Carth.nm23adfrey02070_.mp3: Careful. He'll be impossible to reason with if you get him any madder.
Carth.nm23adfrey02087_.mp3: Now you've done it. There's no way you could convince him of that.
Carth.nm25aacomp01255_.mp3: You mean you'd just let all those people die? That's monstrous!
Carth.nm25aastar99000_.mp3: This doesn't make any sense. Why put a Star Map here in the Shadowlands? Who's ever going to see it?
Carth.nm25aastar99007_.mp3: I suppose it's possible the Star Map was built before these trees were ever here. It's just hard to imagine this world without these massive forests.
Carth.nm25aastar99028_.mp3: You know what? This place is making me uneasy. We've got the Star Map, let's just get out of here.
Carth.nm26aairim06025_.mp3: What then? What happened to the youths?
Carth.nm26aanilk09037_.mp3: I'm uncomfortable with spying on the Republic... but if we could assure the Selkath that they mean no harm, then perhaps it might be worth it.
Carth.nm26aanilk09041_.mp3: If the Republic did mean harm to the Selkath, then I want to know what the Selkath did to provoke it.
Carth.nm26aanilk09068_.mp3: The Hrakert Rift is the source of kolto? Why would the Republic risk so much to send troops there? I don't get it.
Carth.nm26aaselj17008_.mp3: Speaking of that injury, has it been taken into consideration, your honor?
Carth.nm26aaselj17010_.mp3: Well, speaking of that injury... does that not make it seem unlikely that he killed anyone?
Carth.nm26aaselj17064_.mp3: We'll do our best. You can count on that.
Carth.nm26aaselj18014_.mp3: The Republic believes in justice, as do you. We just want Sunry to be fairly treated, that's all.
Carth.nm26aaselj21034_.mp3: Hey! I thought you Selkath judges were supposed to follow the law! You can't already have decided that Sunry is guilty!
Carth.nm26aaselj21038_.mp3: That's a stupid law for any civilized world to have.
Carth.nm26aasunr26058_.mp3: You're talking about acts of war. We're just defending ourselves! You murdered your girlfriend in her sleep.
Carth.nm26aasunr26068_.mp3: I hate to say it, but he has a point. The Republic needs that kolto.
Carth.nm26aasunr26070_.mp3: If need be. We are talking about a Sith, remember? I don't approve of what he did any more than you --
Carth.nm26aasunr26072_.mp3: The Republic's principles aren't worth a hill of beans if it falls, Bastila. I'll do whatever I can to save it.
Carth.nm26aatria27515_.mp3: I... I don't believe this. Sunry should be remembered as a hero, not as a murderer. This isn't right.
Carth.nm26aatria27519_.mp3: I knew you wouldn't let the Republic down!
Carth.nm26acignu04081_.mp3: Are you sure this is a good idea? I mean, I want to help get Sunry acquitted, but what if the Selkath find out about this?
Carth.nm27aashas06030_.mp3: Well, great! It can't be that hard to find proof of the Sith's activities... can it?
Carth.nm27aashas06038_.mp3: [Persuade] Spoken like a true Sith. They wouldn't wait for proof either, I'm sure.
Carth.nm27aashas06106_.mp3: *whisper* How could you say something like that? What's gotten into you?
Carth.nm28aamerc03041_.mp3: Then how are we supposed to get you out of here?
Carth.nm33aacart04660_.mp3: I know. Don't worry about it. I just... must not be making much sense.
Carth.nm33aacart04661_.mp3: I know that. I'm not angry at you... don't think that. I must not be making much sense.
Carth.nm33aacart04662_.mp3: You probably mean well with your questions. I'm just not accustomed to talking about my past very much. At all, actually.
Carth.nm33aacart04663_.mp3: You're the one who wanted to know more about me. Well this is it, this is what I am.
Carth.nm33aacart04664_.mp3: I guess I did say you could ask me questions later, didn't I? Is this really necessary?
Carth.nm33aacart04666_.mp3: No. No, I don't have a problem with it, really. Go ahead and interrogate me.
Carth.nm33aacart04668_.mp3: Oh. Well, if it's an interrogation you wanted, why didn't you say so?
Carth.nm33aacart04670_.mp3: Oh no, how can I resist a challenge to my manly pride, huh? Ha ha! Fine, you've made your point. Interrogate at will.
Carth.nm33aacart04672_.mp3: No, I was just joking, though you do seem to be full of questions. It's rather refreshing, to be honest.
Carth.nm33aacart04674_.mp3: I don't get testy. I get angry. And if I was angry, you wouldn't have to ask me if I was, let me assure you.
Carth.nm33aacart04676_.mp3: All my secrets are purely of the mundane variety, unfortunately. Nothing worth extracting, though you're welcome to try.
Carth.nm33aacart04677_.mp3: Let me ask you something first, though. I've been going through the battle aboard the Endar Spire over and over in my head since we crashed.
Carth.nm33aacart04678_.mp3: Some things just don't add up for me. Maybe you could tell me what happened... from your perspective.
Carth.nm33aacart04680_.mp3: Look... it has nothing to do with you, personally. I don't trust anyone, and I have my reasons.
Carth.nm33aacart04681_.mp3: And, no, I'm not going to discuss them. So can we just keep our mind on more important things?
Carth.nm33aacart04684_.mp3: Alright, alright. You must be the most damned persistent woman I've ever met.
Carth.nm33aacart04685_.mp3: Alright, Alright. You're pretty damned tenacious, you know that?
Carth.nm33aacart04686_.mp3: We'll talk about it... but later. Right now I just want to get going.
Carth.nm33aacart04688_.mp3: Good. Like I said before, I prefer action to talk, anyway.
Carth.nm33aacart04690_.mp3: You're probably one of the most skilled women I've ever met. You've saved my butt more than once and I'm lucky you're here to help me, no question.
Carth.nm33aacart04692_.mp3: Is that your idea of an insult? Come on, sister, take your best shot.
Carth.nm33aacart04694_.mp3: Oh, ouch. I think you hurt my man-feelings with that one.
Carth.nm33aacart04696_.mp3: I guess I did. Feel better now?
Carth.nm33aacart04698_.mp3: Good. Then maybe we can talk reasonably about this.
Carth.nm33aacart04700_.mp3: *Sigh* Look... all I mean is that if you're smart, you won't trust anyone... not me, not Bastila and especially not yourself.
Carth.nm33aacart04711_.mp3: And I don't need all these questions. What I do need is to try and save the galaxy, if that's even possible.
Carth.nm33aacart04712_.mp3: Why is whether or not I trust you or anyone so damned important to you? Why... why do you even care?
Carth.nm33aacart04713_.mp3: We don't have time for this, so can we please just... drop it. For now? Can we pick it up later if you really must, I... want to get underway.
Carth.nm33aacart04715_.mp3: It's not what I want. I have a duty and I intend to see it through. The galaxy's in danger and I want to save it... that's what I want!
Carth.nm33aacart04717_.mp3: No, I don't want to talk about it. What I want is to save the galaxy... if that's even possible.
Carth.nm33aacart04720_.mp3: I don't need to be analyzed, thanks. Can we just get back to business?
Carth.nm33aacart04722_.mp3: Not all of us have the luxury of a choice. I'm conditioned this way, sorry.
Carth.nm33aacart04724_.mp3: I would be more than happy to, but she's as close-mouthed as the rest of the Council. I'm hoping you'll be the one to enlighten me.
Carth.nm33aacart04725_.mp3: I'm not trying to provoke you or imply that you're somehow responsible for the Jedi Council... but give me a hand, here! There has to be a reason!
Carth.nm33aacart04726_.mp3: No, I don't... I didn't mean that you weren't wanted, or that I want to go! It's just... damn it!
Carth.nm33aacart04727_.mp3: Look, I didn't mean it that way. I want to get to Saul, not... no... no, forget it. It seems all I can do is insult you, isn't it?
Carth.nm33aacart04728_.mp3: Just forget I said anything. Let's... let's... just get on with what we were doing.
Carth.nm33aalash11005_.mp3: Great, just what we needed. Some punks come to steal our lunch credits.
Carth.nm33aalash11014_.mp3: Ah, you don't think they're a bit pre-provoked to begin with?
Carth.nm33aalash11039_.mp3: Cute. Maybe you should try juggling next time.
Carth.nm33aalash11066_.mp3: Is this a raffle? How many guesses do we get?
Carth.nm33aalash11079_.mp3: Is this a raffle? How many guesses do we get?
Carth.nm33aapros17027_.mp3: Too bad that's exactly where we're headed.
Carth.nm33aapros18028_.mp3: Well, too bad that's exactly where we're headed.
Carth.nm33aasith20008_.mp3: Yeah, it does. Okay, you're off the hook. Let's go, guys.
Carth.nm33aasith20015_.mp3: Ahhh, alright. Let's go. Consider yourself lucky, stranger.
Carth.nm33aasith20022_.mp3: What?! You... you won't get away with this!!
Carth.nm33aasith20025_.mp3: That's pretty funny. Why should we be scared of you?
Carth.nm33aasith20033_.mp3: Yeah, okay. Just keep out of our way next time, you.
Carth.nm33abacad01008_.mp3: No more disruptive than our 'master' will be.
Carth.nm33abcart04782_.mp3: I just can't believe he's dead. I... you should have stopped him! You should have done something to prevent this!
Carth.nm33abcart04784_.mp3: Oh, don't give me that innocent look! You can talk a Hutt out of his credits, you could have found a way... you could have saved him!
Carth.nm33abcart04787_.mp3: I... I wish we hadn't come. I wish I'd never found him.
Carth.nm33abcart04789_.mp3: I'm sorry, too. And I'm sorry I ever met you.
Carth.nm33abcart04790_.mp3: I... no, I didn't mean that. Please... maybe it would be better if we continued with the mission. I want to... take my mind off this.
Carth.nm33abcart04791_.mp3: Saving the galaxy is what's important now. My son... I can mourn my son later. When we're done. So... let's just go.
Carth.nm33abcart04793_.mp3: No, I did fail him. And so did you. I wish I'd never met you.
Carth.nm33abcart04795_.mp3: No. If it did, I would never have met you.
Carth.nm33abcart04797_.mp3: Is it? You seem just fine at pulling off the near-impossible... when you want to.
Carth.nm33abcart04798_.mp3: I can't help but wonder if part of you didn't enjoy this. I thought we might be friends, but with you... heh, who can tell?
Carth.nm33abcart04800_.mp3: Is it? I find it hard to tell which side you're on, sometimes. Still... not all the blame is yours. Most of it is mine.
Carth.nm33abcart04802_.mp3: No, I see that. I don't know what I was expecting, telling you all I did. The blame is mostly mine for this, anyway.
Carth.nm33abcart04803_.mp3: Why didn't you want to? You knew how important finding Dustil was to me! You... you've helped others, why not him? Why not me?
Carth.nm33abcart04805_.mp3: You could have. But... you're only partly to blame. I'm to blame for all the rest.
Carth.nm33abcart04807_.mp3: All the blame? No. Part of the blame, though... part of the blame is yours. The rest is mine.
Carth.nm33abcart04811_.mp3: If I was, you wouldn't have to ask. So don't worry about it.
Carth.nm33abcart04814_.mp3: All business today, eh? Are these questions really necessary?
Carth.nm33abcart04817_.mp3: Which? The fact that I'm all ears or the beautiful part?
Carth.nm33abcart04819_.mp3: Not really. Just a habit. You have something you'd rather I call you by?
Carth.nm33abcart04822_.mp3: Maybe I'm just avoiding your questions. Is this really necessary?
Carth.nm33abcart04824_.mp3: Pretty snappy with the orders, are we? Okay, you got it... sir.
Carth.nm33abcart04826_.mp3: Well, that's too bad, then, because it's not going to change.
Carth.nm33abcart04828_.mp3: Heh heh. Well I might be willing to take you up on that challenge. But uh, you're just not going to let up, are you? Fine... you want to know why I don't trust anyone? Here goes.
Carth.nm33abcart04829_.mp3: Listen, sister... just because we're working together does not mean you get to badger me with constant questions!
Carth.nm33abcart04831_.mp3: Blast it if you aren't the most frustrating woman to talk to! Isn't there someone else you can harass for a little while?
Carth.nm33abcart04833_.mp3: What? Me? What did I do?
Carth.nm33abcart04838_.mp3: Oh no, I'm not falling for that one. I wasn't born yesterday, you know.
Carth.nm33abcart04840_.mp3: I... *sigh* Okay, I give up. You win.
Carth.nm33abcart04844_.mp3: Wait... *sigh* I didn't mean it that way. Don't go, damn it.
Carth.nm33abcart04845_.mp3: Look, I suppose I... could use someone to talk to. I'm just not used to it. And I don't know why you're so interested. But here goes.
Carth.nm33abcart04849_.mp3: Very cute. If you got any cuter, you'd pass for a Gamorrean's sister.
Carth.nm33abcart04852_.mp3: Look, I'm serious. No one seems to want to tell me anything, and it's starting to irritate me.
Carth.nm33abcart04854_.mp3: Well... yeah, true enough, I guess. But, damn it, I'm tired of nobody telling me anything!
Carth.nm33abcart04856_.mp3: Well, damn it, I want to know why that is! I want some questions answered!
Carth.nm33abcart04859_.mp3: Oh? I don't know if I like the sound of that...
Carth.nm33abcart04861_.mp3: I don't know. What am I going to have to do for it?
Carth.nm33abcart04863_.mp3: Oh, the usual. Well that's not so hard. Let's get to it, then, shall we?
Carth.nm33abcart04866_.mp3: I...heh, I really think that we should, ah... get going.
Carth.nm33abcart04869_.mp3: I'm sorry. I'm glad things are better between us, now. We should... we should go.
Carth.nm33abcart04871_.mp3: So... you do accept my apology. Huh. Good. Good. I'm glad.
Carth.nm33abcart04872_.mp3: You know you, uh... you aren't so bad to have around, you know that?
Carth.nm33abcart04874_.mp3: More than that. But... anyway... we should be off...
Carth.nm33abcart04878_.mp3: She had courage... and she was stubborn. Heh... a little bit like you in that respect. I could never talk her out of anything once she put her mind to it.
Carth.nm33abcart04880_.mp3: I had... had nothing left after that, really. I devoted myself to the fleet. Hunting Saul was my only purpose.
Carth.nm33abcart04881_.mp3: No, no, I didn't mean it that way.
Carth.nm33abcart04884_.mp3: Err... I'm not that bad, am I?
Carth.nm33abcart04887_.mp3: Damn it, woman, if you keep hounding me I'm going to put you over my knee and teach you a lesson!
Carth.nm33abcart04889_.mp3: Oh, no, I'm not even going there, sister.
Carth.nm33abcart04891_.mp3: You just wait, you'll get yours.
Carth.nm33abcart04892_.mp3: At any rate, I wasn't ogling you. I've just been admiring you.
Carth.nm33abcart04894_.mp3: Oh, you can tell, can you?
Carth.nm33abcart04898_.mp3: Oh, yeah? Well listen, beautiful, I don't need to take this abuse. I get enough female Jedi bashing from Bastila, thank you very much.
Carth.nm33abcart04900_.mp3: Wouldn't you like to know. Just you wait, sister.
Carth.nm33abcart04902_.mp3: And just what would you do if I wasn't? No, no, wait, don't answer that. I don't want to know.
Carth.nm33abcart04904_.mp3: Uh. *That* is one bet I'm not about to take. Not a chance.
Carth.nm33abcart04905_.mp3: Anyway... as fun, uh, as this is, I do have to talk to you about something serious. Really serious. Uh, is this a good time?
Carth.nm33abcart04907_.mp3: You think so? I could probably get the same kind of attention from a blaster rifle.
Carth.nm33abcart04910_.mp3: Now *that* I'd like to see. Or would I? You've got my damn head on backwards, you know that?
Carth.nm33abcart04912_.mp3: Ha! No, wait, wait, don't go. Not just yet.
Carth.nm33abcart04914_.mp3: What?! No! I mean... no! Don't be crazy!
Carth.nm33abcart04916_.mp3: Oh no you don't! I'd have to shoot you down first, and I'm not kidding.
Carth.nm33abcart04918_.mp3: What? You must be joking. I'd be lucky not to get my eyeballs seared out of their sockets.
Carth.nm33abmeke02009_.mp3: Well, you should know better than anyone what some people will do for power, Bastila.
Carth.nm33abmeke02011_.mp3: Well, just that the dark side is quite tempting... or so you always say. What did you think I meant?
Carth.nm33abmeke02014_.mp3: Oh, what a sweet guy. He should get the Sith congeniality medal.
Carth.nm33abmekf03015_.mp3: Somehow I think he'll get over it.
Carth.nm35aacart03000_.mp3: That datapad... take a look at it. I wonder if Dustil knows his friend was disposed of like that?
Carth.nm35aacart03002_.mp3: If not, it might convince Dustil that what we're saying about the Sith is true. It would be worth a shot.
Carth.nm35aacart04002_.mp3: Not right now. I think this datapad we found is the evidence we need. We have to bring it to Dustil right away.
Carth.nm35aacart04003_.mp3: No. What I want is to find something... anything... that will convince Dustil that we're telling the truth.
Carth.nm35aacart04004_.mp3: There must be *something* here in the academy we can bring to him, something that would show him what the Sith really are!
Carth.nm35aacart04007_.mp3: Talk about what? The only thing I want to do right now is find Dustil. If he's alive... well, there's just nothing else I want to think about.
Carth.nm35aacart04008_.mp3: I'll understand if we can't look for him right now, but if we could it would be a huge load off my mind.
Carth.nm35aacart04015_.mp3: Taris? The planet's all one big city... but it's golden years are long past, and things have gotten worse since the Sith occupied it.
Carth.nm35aacart04016_.mp3: From what I hear, the wealthy live on the tops of all the tall towers. And if you're poor, you live down in the shadows... and it gets worse the lower you go.
Carth.nm35aacart04017_.mp3: That's all I can think of, at any rate.
Carth.nm35aacart04018_.mp3: Dantooine's a boring place. It's all plains and herders and small settlements. Perfect for the Jedi to lose themselves in, I guess.
Carth.nm35aacart04019_.mp3: Manaan's a neutral world. They're the only source of kolto... the healing fluid... and they use that to remain free from both the Republic and the Sith.
Carth.nm35aacart04020_.mp3: Tatooine's just a desert planet. I hear the mining isn't going so well... I'd bet the colony gets abandoned before long.
Carth.nm35aacart04021_.mp3: Kashyyyk is covered by a giant forest, I hear. Trees kilometers high. The Wookiees live on the higher branches, I think.
Carth.nm35aacart04022_.mp3: Korriban's a desolate world, and a Sith planet. There's only one small colony here, I'm pretty sure.
Carth.nm35aacart04023_.mp3: I don't really know much about this place, sorry.
Carth.nm35aacart04025_.mp3: I think so. If he's anything like he used to be, Dustil hates to be tricked. There's no way he'll let the Sith trick him again.
Carth.nm35aacart04026_.mp3: As for whether or not he'll be my son again... I don't know. He's so full of anger and hate... I wasn't expecting him to be like this.
Carth.nm35aacart04027_.mp3: Maybe we can work it out. I hope so. I guess I'll have to wait and see. Thanks, by the way... for all your help.
Carth.nm35aacart04029_.mp3: There's nothing to talk about. I failed my son... just as I failed my wife. I thought that if I ever found him...
Carth.nm35aacart04032_.mp3: Me? Well, I've been a star-pilot for the Republic for years. I've seen more than my share of wars... I fought in the Mandalorian Wars before all this started.
Carth.nm35aacart04033_.mp3: But with all that, I've never experienced anything like the slaughter these Sith animals can unleash. Not even the Mandalorians were that senseless.
Carth.nm35aacart04034_.mp3: My home world was one of the first planets to fall to Malak's fleet. The Sith bombed it into submission, and there wasn't a damn thing our Republic forces could do to stop them!
Carth.nm35aacart04036_.mp3: It shouldn't be my fault. I did everything I could... I followed my orders and did my duty. That shouldn't mean I failed them! I didn't!
Carth.nm35aacart04038_.mp3: Yes. No... no, that's not what I mean. I mean... I'm sorry. I'm not making much sense, am I?
Carth.nm35aacart04039_.mp3: I'm more used to taking action... keeping my mind focused on the business at hand. So let's just do that. If you have more questions, ask them later.
Carth.nm35aacart04043_.mp3: I'm just a soldier; I go where the fleet Admirals tell me to. I follow my orders and I do my duty. It just... *sigh* doesn't seem right that doing that means I failed them! I didn't!
Carth.nm35aacart04048_.mp3: True. Bastila is as powerful as they say... she's the one who defeated Darth Revan, after all.
Carth.nm35aacart04049_.mp3: Hmm. I guess that no Jedi ability, no matter how powerful, makes up for being completely surprised and outmatched.
Carth.nm35aacart04050_.mp3: We didn't choose that battle, anyway. It got forced on us. Hell, I'm just surprised that any of us are alive to talk about it.
Carth.nm35aacart04051_.mp3: Come to think of it, it's more than a little surprising that you happen to be here, isn't it? Just what is your position with the Republic fleet, anyway?
Carth.nm35aacart04053_.mp3: Not at all. I just think it's a bit odd that someone who got added to the crew roster at the last minute just happens to be one of the survivors.
Carth.nm35aacart04055_.mp3: Don't be ridiculous. You've more than proved yourself since the crash... we wouldn't have made it this far without you. But still...
Carth.nm35aacart04057_.mp3: You were the only one. Not to mention that Bastila's party was the one who requested your transfer.
Carth.nm35aacart04059_.mp3: No. Well... maybe. Don't get me wrong, it just seems odd that someone Bastila's party specifically requested to transfer aboard happened to survive.
Carth.nm35aacart04062_.mp3: The Jedi requested numerous things when they came on board... hell, they practically took over the ship, as far as I could tell.
Carth.nm35aacart04063_.mp3: Considering your connection to Bastila and the Jedi... whether you know it or not... your presence here seems a little convenient.
Carth.nm35aacart04064_.mp3: I'm probably wrong and this is probably nothing, I know. I learned a long time ago not to take things at face value, however. And I *hate* surprises.
Carth.nm35aacart04066_.mp3: I mean I have to expect the unexpected. Just to be safe.
Carth.nm35aacart04068_.mp3: I expect you're right. I've got no real reason to suspect you of anything. Still... it's better to be safe than sorry, right?
Carth.nm35aacart04070_.mp3: I am working with you. I'd be a fool not to. I'd also be a fool not to expect the unexpected.
Carth.nm35aacart04079_.mp3: I'm not trying to be paranoid. It's just that I learned a long time ago that something which looks like a coincidence probably isn't. Especially when the Jedi are involved.
Carth.nm35aacart04081_.mp3: A smuggler? I should have guessed. Isn't it odd, however, that a smuggler who was added to the crew at the last minute just happens to be alive?
Carth.nm35aacart04083_.mp3: Well, that makes sense. Still... it seems a bit strange that someone who was a last-minute addition to the crew roster is one of the survivors.
Carth.nm35aacart04085_.mp3: Hell no... unless you consider that you were a last-minute addition to the crew roster and you just happen to be one of the survivors.
Carth.nm35aacart04087_.mp3: I'm just trying to figure it out. I saw enough men lose their lives needlessly during the Mandalorian Wars. It's... difficult to see that happening all over again.
Carth.nm35aacart04088_.mp3: We lost the ship and a lot of good people... and for what? On the hope that Jedi powers would save us, somehow. Not that Bastila had much of an opportunity to act.
Carth.nm35aacart04090_.mp3: Neither was I, to tell the truth. I was onboard as an advisor for the most part. The battle began so fast, it's anyone's guess as to what actually happened.
Carth.nm35aacart04092_.mp3: *Sigh* I knew you wouldn't understand where I was coming from. Let me try to explain.
Carth.nm35aacart04093_.mp3: You've got the skills of an elite commando, and you've saved my butt more than once. Between that and your facility with languages, I'm lucky you're here.
Carth.nm35aacart04094_.mp3: But that doesn't mean I'm going to stop watching you or being wary. I'm just not built that way. Period.
Carth.nm35aacart04096_.mp3: Maybe so. But I've been betrayed before by people I... well, it won't happen again, that's all.
Carth.nm35aacart04098_.mp3: I don't know that you'll betray me. But there are no guarantees... not for you, not for me. You don't have to take it personally.
Carth.nm35aacart04106_.mp3: Hairless Wookiee? Alright, sister, just... just... just calm down before your head explodes.
Carth.nm35aacart04112_.mp3: Well, you can stop wondering. I'm not.
Carth.nm35aacart04121_.mp3: You shouldn't. If you're smart, you won't trust anyone... not me, not Bastila, and especially not yourself.
Carth.nm35aacart04125_.mp3: I don't remember ever saying anything about "traitor". All I mean is that if you're smart, you won't trust anyone... not me, not Bastila and especially not yourself.
Carth.nm35aacart04127_.mp3: Yeah, well, you wouldn't be the first. Look... I don't expect you to be my friend. This is just the way I am, no need to take it personally.
Carth.nm35aacart04129_.mp3: Look... I'm not trying to insult you. This is just the way I am, no need to take it personally.
Carth.nm35aacart04131_.mp3: You, uh... haven't done anything *yet*. But there's no guarantee that you won't do anything in the future. I've been betrayed before by people and I... well, it won't happen again.
Carth.nm35aacart04133_.mp3: I don't know that, yet. Like I said before, it's probably nothing. But I've been betrayed before by people and I... well, it won't happen again, that's all.
Carth.nm35aacart04135_.mp3: Oh? You want to argue some more, is that it?
Carth.nm35aacart04137_.mp3: Ha! Can't say I've met a woman quite like you before. You're really something.
Carth.nm35aacart04138_.mp3: So I've seen. If I were Malak I'd be a bit nervous to have you on my tail.
Carth.nm35aacart04140_.mp3: What does it matter that much? Why can't you just leave it be?
Carth.nm35aacart04142_.mp3: And I don't really want to argue with you, either. You seem... sincere enough, I guess.
Carth.nm35aacart04143_.mp3: I just don't trust easily, and for good reasons... which are my own.
Carth.nm35aacart04147_.mp3: Ahhh, damn it. I suppose I won't get any rest until I talk, will I? You want to know why I don't trust anyone? Fine, here goes.
Carth.nm35aacart04148_.mp3: Five years ago the Jedi had just finished the war with the Mandalorians. Revan and Malak were heroes. I was damn proud to have served in their fleet.
Carth.nm35aacart04149_.mp3: It was completely unexpected when they turned on us, invading the Republic while we were still weak. Nobody knew what to think, least of all me.
Carth.nm35aacart04150_.mp3: Our heroes had become brutal, conquering Sith... and we were all but helpless before them. Think about it... if you can't even trust the best of the Jedi, who can you trust?
Carth.nm35aacart04152_.mp3: It... it's not that. It's... That's not what I mean. There were... there were others. Good, solid, trusted men who joined them.
Carth.nm35aacart04154_.mp3: I... of course the Jedi turned to the dark side. There were others, however, who weren't Jedi. Good men... trusted men who joined them.
Carth.nm35aacart04156_.mp3: I... it wasn't even that. There were others: good, solid men. Trusted men who turned on us, as well, and joined their cause.
Carth.nm35aacart04157_.mp3: Malak and Revan and the Sith deserve to die for what they've done... but the ones who fled the Republic and joined them are even worse.
Carth.nm35aacart04158_.mp3: The dark side has nothing to do with why they joined with the Sith. They deserve no mercy!
Carth.nm35aacart04161_.mp3: I know. I... should apologize to you. I've become so accustomed to expecting the worst in others, and you've done nothing to deserve that.
Carth.nm35aacart04162_.mp3: It's just... never mind. Let's just continue with what we were doing. I'd rather not talk about it.
Carth.nm35aacart04164_.mp3: I thought I said I didn't want to talk about it anymore.
Carth.nm35aacart04166_.mp3: Not particularly. I... guess it wouldn't hurt, exactly, either, though I don't know why you're so interested.
Carth.nm35aacart04168_.mp3: Cute. Nice to know that you're so full of concern. *Sigh* Well, I guess it wouldn't hurt, though I don't know why you're so interested.
Carth.nm35aacart04170_.mp3: I... suppose you're right. Fine, then. But I don't know why you're so interested, but here it goes.
Carth.nm35aacart04171_.mp3: When I think of all the men who have betrayed us, the one that stands out above them all is the one I respected the most. Saul.
Carth.nm35aacart04173_.mp3: You don't? I thought everyone did. Admiral Saul Karath is the commander of the entire Sith fleet. He's half the reason Malak has done so well in the war.
Carth.nm35aacart04174_.mp3: Saul was my commanding officer back when the Mandalorian Wars first began. He taught me everything about being a soldier... and I looked up to him.
Carth.nm35aacart04175_.mp3: Saul approached me before he left. He talked to me about how the Republic was on the losing side... and about how I should start thinking of my survival.
Carth.nm35aacart04176_.mp3: I know now that he was trying to recruit me into the Sith, but I couldn't have conceived of it back then. I argued with him and he got angry and he left. I never saw him again.
Carth.nm35aacart04178_.mp3: Saul was my mentor... he led us to so many victories against the Mandalorians, even when things looked to be at their worst.
Carth.nm35aacart04179_.mp3: I just... I couldn't conceive of it. He... he couldn't be serious. I was wrong, of course... he not only left us for the Sith, he... he gave them the codes to bypass our scanners.
Carth.nm35aacart04180_.mp3: I remember waking up as the first of the Sith bombers snuck past our defenses and began destroying half of our docked ships. I knew right away what had happened.
Carth.nm35aacart04181_.mp3: I... could have stopped him. I could have stopped it all.
Carth.nm35aacart04183_.mp3: I blame Saul, not myself. I was... I was stupid and I ignored the danger. He nearly destroyed us all.
Carth.nm35aacart04185_.mp3: I don't know. Maybe. He might have killed me if I'd tried, or I might have killed him. I was stupid, however, and I let him go.
Carth.nm35aacart04187_.mp3: Don't even start with that! I don't feel sorry for myself. I feel angry... at Saul and all those others. It's all I can think about sometimes!
Carth.nm35aacart04188_.mp3: I've fought Saul for years, now, and if I ever catch up to him... he will regret what he's done. He will regret it.
Carth.nm35aacart04191_.mp3: But I don't want to talk about it right now. Let's go.
Carth.nm35aacart04193_.mp3: Have I been quiet? I suppose I have. I guess I just don't like being left out of the loop.
Carth.nm35aacart04195_.mp3: Left out of the loop. You know. Not being told anything... strung along. It's really starting to irritate me.
Carth.nm35aacart04196_.mp3: For one thing, I want to know what the Jedi Council said to you. They pulled you in there and refused to tell me a thing about it.
Carth.nm35aacart04197_.mp3: *That* is none of your concern, Carth, and you would do well to leave the matter be.
Carth.nm35aacart04198_.mp3: I respect you, Bastila, but you've been as close-mouthed as the rest of the Council. If you won't talk to me, then maybe somebody else will.
Carth.nm35aacart04199_.mp3: I'm rather curious to know what went on... and why they didn't keep you on Dantooine for training. Isn't that strange?
Carth.nm35aacart04201_.mp3: I may not know much about the Jedi, but I do know they aren't famous for taking on old Padawans and sending them on dangerous assignments.
Carth.nm35aacart04203_.mp3: A bond? What kind of bond? You mean to say that they told you you were "tied" to Bastila in some way? Heh. I have trouble believing that.
Carth.nm35aacart04204_.mp3: You're a neophyte Padawan who's been saddled with the responsibility of tracking down these Star Maps. Why? That's not normal!
Carth.nm35aacart04206_.mp3: I'll tell you this much... I am *not* going to wait around until I'm betrayed again!
Carth.nm35aacart04208_.mp3: Well, we'll just see about that, won't we?
Carth.nm35aacart04210_.mp3: Nothing. Not yet. You just better hope I don't get a reason to.
Carth.nm35aacart04212_.mp3: Fine. You got it. Conversation over.
Carth.nm35aacart04217_.mp3: And what does that mean? Is this more of that destiny garbage that the Jedi keep talking about? Well, that can't be it!
Carth.nm35aacart04218_.mp3: I've been watching you... you can be cruel and impulsive. A Jedi without self-control or training, and yet the Council sends you on your way? Why?
Carth.nm35aacart04220_.mp3: That's completely beside the point. The Jedi encouraged you to stay with us, and I don't believe the reasons they gave.
Carth.nm35aacart04222_.mp3: None of my business? Uh, I'm sorry... aren't I a part of this mission? The Jedi may be in charge, but I'm risking all the same things you are!
Carth.nm35aacart04224_.mp3: Are we? Why, then, does it seem like the Jedi know everything and leave the rest of us out in the cold?
Carth.nm35aacart04226_.mp3: You can be sick of whatever you like. What I'm sick of is being kept in the dark!
Carth.nm35aacart04228_.mp3: And why is that? You were a great help on Taris, but why would they keep you with us? Don't they... don't they have to train you?
Carth.nm35aacart04230_.mp3: No? Well, you certainly aren't helping matters any, either, and it's really starting to irritate me.
Carth.nm35aacart04232_.mp3: Listen, sister, I don't remember reading anywhere that it's a requirement that you remain with us after we left Taris, yet here you are.
Carth.nm35aacart04233_.mp3: You want to be smart, do you? Fine. So long as I get some questions answered.
Carth.nm35aacart04235_.mp3: I, ahhh... I'm not very good at this. I... I know I owe you an apology. Uh, more than one, probably.
Carth.nm35aacart04236_.mp3: I was just so desperate to finally face Saul directly in the battle over Taris, and now the Jedi have us looking for these... these Star Maps.
Carth.nm35aacart04237_.mp3: I know this mission is important, it's just... I feel a bit useless. I can fight, sure, but I'm no Jedi... all this feels completely out of my league.
Carth.nm35aacart04239_.mp3: It doesn't, I know. It's... been a while since I even had to think about that sort of thing.
Carth.nm35aacart04240_.mp3: I just hate not knowing what's going on and feeling this... helpless. But I shouldn't have taken that out on you. I've been a royal pain in the backside, haven't I?
Carth.nm35aacart04242_.mp3: I guess there's no harm done then. Still I, uh... I should know better by now.
Carth.nm35aacart04243_.mp3: So... I'm sorry. Will you accept my apology?
Carth.nm35aacart04245_.mp3: Done! Let's get underway, then, shall we... partner?
Carth.nm35aacart04247_.mp3: Don't drown me in sentiment, already. *Sigh* Fair enough, let's move on.
Carth.nm35aacart04249_.mp3: Ha! Well... I guess I should be at least a little pleased that I haven't lost my touch.
Carth.nm35aacart04251_.mp3: No, I do worry about it. I've traveled the lanes more than once, I should know better than this.
Carth.nm35aacart04253_.mp3: Because this is more important. This may really, finally, make a difference... I suppose even if I can't figure out everything that's going on, I still want to help if I can.
Carth.nm35aacart04255_.mp3: You don't exactly pull any punches, do you? Not that I don't deserve it, I suppose.
Carth.nm35aacart04258_.mp3: I already told you. He betrayed us all.
Carth.nm35aacart04260_.mp3: Well, There... there is more to it. I'm... I'm sure you don't want to hear about it.
Carth.nm35aacart04262_.mp3: It's just that I... don't talk about it very much. Ok?
Carth.nm35aacart04263_.mp3: I told you about my homeworld. Telos. Four years ago, Saul led the Sith fleet there and demanded its surrender. The planet refused and Saul proceeded to devastate its entire surface. Millions died.
Carth.nm35aacart04264_.mp3: I had... a wife and son on Telos. I thought they would be safe there. But my task force arrived too late to be of much help.
Carth.nm35aacart04265_.mp3: We didn't have enough medical supplies. The colony was burning and the dying were everywhere. I remember holding my wife and screaming for the medics. They... didn't come in time.
Carth.nm35aacart04267_.mp3: Of course not. How could you? I... had nothing left after that, really. I devoted myself to the fleet. Hunting Saul was my only purpose.
Carth.nm35aacart04268_.mp3: I... miss them. I know killing Saul won't bring them back, and it won't make me happy again... but I have to do it.
Carth.nm35aacart04269_.mp3: I don't expect you to understand. I have to pay him back for what he's done... I have to. It's all I have left.
Carth.nm35aacart04271_.mp3: No, it's alright, I don't mind. You deserved some kind of... explanation.
Carth.nm35aacart04273_.mp3: I've... never talked about it before. To anyone. I suppose it's time I finally did.
Carth.nm35aacart04275_.mp3: His name was Dustil and I don't know what happened to him. The colony was a complete ruin, and we never found any trace of him.
Carth.nm35aacart04276_.mp3: I made inquiries and followed the reports from Telos for years, but... I stopped.
Carth.nm35aacart04277_.mp3: Anyway... I hope that answers your questions. Let's, uh... let's continue with what we were doing.
Carth.nm35aacart04278_.mp3: Anyway... that's the story. For what it's worth.
Carth.nm35aacart04281_.mp3: She had courage and ... and she was stubborn. I could never talk her out of anything once she put her mind to it.
Carth.nm35aacart04282_.mp3: And she hated it when I signed back onto the fleet at the start of the war. I had planned on... on leaving soon, to join her...
Carth.nm35aacart04284_.mp3: Yes. I can't forgive Saul for this. He took everything from me, even... even my trust. I hope you can understand that.
Carth.nm35aacart04286_.mp3: Gotten over it? Look - my family was everything to me. Once they were gone... I had nothing. Hunting Saul became my only purpose.
Carth.nm35aacart04289_.mp3: To think that I once looked up to those two as the best that humanity had to offer. Now I'd like nothing more than to put a blaster to both their heads.
Carth.nm35aacart04290_.mp3: Although I suppose only Malak is left, isn't he? Turned on his own master, not that Revan didn't have it coming. Heh. Typical for their kind, I guess.
Carth.nm35aacart04292_.mp3: No, not personally. They aided the Republic during the Mandalorian wars. They were heroes. Without them the Mandaloreans would have finished us for certain.
Carth.nm35aacart04293_.mp3: In the fleet, we didn't see much of the Jedi. I only met Malak once, but I was impressed by him. I guess that just shows how much the dark side can change someone.
Carth.nm35aacart04295_.mp3: I, uh... used to think that it was a fancy name for something that I see every day. Corruption is everywhere. People are greedy and stupid and do horrible things.
Carth.nm35aacart04296_.mp3: I'm starting to think it's different for the Jedi, however. That there's this evil watching them, waiting for its chance.
Carth.nm35aacart04297_.mp3: I've been watching you. You have this, uh... incredible darkness inside you. Some of the things you do disturb me.
Carth.nm35aacart04298_.mp3: It's not just you. It's Bastila, as well. She's so... intense. I don't pretend to know much about the Force... but I know evil.
Carth.nm35aacart04300_.mp3: No, of course not. All I'm saying is that when you have so much power, the stakes are higher. I can only imagine the kind of conflict that goes on inside you.
Carth.nm35aacart04301_.mp3: Neither you nor Bastila are fully trained on how to handle your power. I'm just concerned at what might come.
Carth.nm35aacart04303_.mp3: Well, that's not what I... I mean... I wouldn't want to see you hurt. Either of you.
Carth.nm35aacart04304_.mp3: I suppose finding the Star Maps is more important than your training... and your safety. I just hope there isn't a price for you to pay.
Carth.nm35aacart04306_.mp3: I know that, and Bastila says the same thing. You're both incredible women. I'm just... I'm just not sure this is the kind of thing you can defeat.
Carth.nm35aacart04308_.mp3: I didn't mean to... <Sigh> Fine, fine. I suppose I shouldn't stick my nose where it doesn't belong. I'll leave you be.
Carth.nm35aacart04310_.mp3: No? I know how people change. I remember how Malak looked and acted before his return... I bet the old Malak discounted the possibility that he would ever fall, as well.
Carth.nm35aacart04313_.mp3: That's a frightening thought. I hope you're right.
Carth.nm35aacart04314_.mp3: You have so much courage and strength in you... yet, somehow, I have no trouble imagining it differently. Like the flip side of a coin.
Carth.nm35aacart04316_.mp3: Nobody does. When they left after the Mandalorian wars ended, they were Jedi. When they returned... they were something else.
Carth.nm35aacart04318_.mp3: Well... when they returned from wherever they went, they had an entire fleet with them. Nobody knows where they got the ships.
Carth.nm35aacart04319_.mp3: They had a lot of them and as the years have passed there always seems to be more and more... while our forces dwindle.
Carth.nm35aacart04320_.mp3: Did they really get away with it, though? Revan was betrayed by Malak... and Malak hasn't won. In the end, the dark side won't help him.
Carth.nm35aacart04324_.mp3: I told you my wife died four years ago. I... I've just been trying to remember what she looked like.
Carth.nm35aacart04325_.mp3: It shouldn't be so difficult. I can remember things about her... things she did. The way she smiled, what her hair smelled like, our last fight... just not her face.
Carth.nm35aacart04326_.mp3: I try to hold it in my head but it's gone. Is... that strange? Maybe I shouldn't be talking to you about this.
Carth.nm35aacart04328_.mp3: Ahhh, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have mentioned it, even if you asked. I just find you, I don't know... easy to talk to.
Carth.nm35aacart04330_.mp3: But I *should* be able to remember her face. It's frustrating! I... feel like I'm losing her.
Carth.nm35aacart04331_.mp3: I, uh... it must look really strange for me to be obsessing like this, still. You must think I'm incredibly stupid.
Carth.nm35aacart04333_.mp3: I... suppose you're probably right. But I have to do it, anyway.
Carth.nm35aacart04334_.mp3: The only thing that's kept me going since she died has been the need to find Saul and kill him. It's better to think about that than... anything else.
Carth.nm35aacart04335_.mp3: If I can do that, then maybe I can let her go. Let it all go.
Carth.nm35aacart04336_.mp3: If we encounter Saul... if we ever have the chance, promise me that I will be the one to kill him. I have to settle this... I need to.
Carth.nm35aacart04339_.mp3: Thank you. I... guess there's really nothing else to say.
Carth.nm35aacart04341_.mp3: Whether it does or not, that's the way it has to be. I... guess there's no need to discuss it until then.
Carth.nm35aacart04343_.mp3: Maybe. It can't be worse than what I tell myself, sometimes.
Carth.nm35aacart04345_.mp3: She isn't a ghost to me. I still remember holding her as she died... and I doubt I'll forget until I've paid Saul back in kind.
Carth.nm35aacart04346_.mp3: That's all I have left: finding Saul and killing the scum. Don't worry... I won't waste any more time until then.
Carth.nm35aacart04348_.mp3: That's a damned mean thing to say. I wasn't ready for her to go, I can't accept it. Alright?
Carth.nm35aacart04350_.mp3: Moping? I'm not moping! I... okay, fine, maybe I'm moping a little, but you're very pushy, you know that?
Carth.nm35aacart04352_.mp3: You mean if I kill him?
Carth.nm35aacart04354_.mp3: I... never thought about it. I suppose I always assumed that I would be dead once Saul was.
Carth.nm35aacart04356_.mp3: Understand that whenever I envisioned taking on Saul in the past, it was always as the captain of my own ship... or alone. In those cases I would risk everything.
Carth.nm35aacart04357_.mp3: I'm not in the same situation, now. I wouldn't risk hurting you... or the others.
Carth.nm35aacart04359_.mp3: You don't think I would throw away everything we're doing here, do you?
Carth.nm35aacart04361_.mp3: I would like to think that I wouldn't put you in danger. That I wouldn't forget that there's more behind Saul that needs to be stopped.
Carth.nm35aacart04362_.mp3: If I saw Saul, however... if I had the chance... I don't know what I would do. I really don't. I mean his death has been my entire focus for so long.
Carth.nm35aacart04364_.mp3: Well, that's easier said than done, but I know you mean well. I promise you I'll see this through. No matter what.
Carth.nm35aacart04365_.mp3: As for what comes afterward... well, let's wait until I know that I'm around to see it.
Carth.nm35aacart04367_.mp3: I know. I'll... see this through. I promise you that. No matter what.
Carth.nm35aacart04369_.mp3: But, uh... maybe it's best I did. I have to see this through... and I will, to the end. I promise you that. No matter what.
Carth.nm35aacart04371_.mp3: Of course it means something to me! The Sith have to be stopped! You think it doesn't matter to me that everyone on Taris is dead? That the Republic is in danger?
Carth.nm35aacart04374_.mp3: That's never occurred to me. I've always been the captain of my own ship, after all... or thought about going after Saul on my own.
Carth.nm35aacart04376_.mp3: Oh. I hadn't thought you'd noticed...
Carth.nm35aacart04378_.mp3: Well, I ah... I've just been admiring you. Not, uhh, not anything like that, though...
Carth.nm35aacart04382_.mp3: I've been watching you in action. Your, your skills... you have a natural talent that is incredible.
Carth.nm35aacart04383_.mp3: Not that, ah, all I do is watch you or anything. I don't mean anything by it.
Carth.nm35aacart04385_.mp3: Ha! Why didn't you tell me that sooner? You would have saved me a lot of trouble.
Carth.nm35aacart04386_.mp3: I will say one thing, however. We've come a long way with your help. Whether it's the Force or fate or just dumb luck... I'm glad you're here.
Carth.nm35aacart04387_.mp3: We probably would have never made it this far without you. I... should have said this long before, instead of doubting you. I, ah, hope you can forgive me.
Carth.nm35aacart04389_.mp3: I guess I'm a proud man. I... don't admit things like this easily.
Carth.nm35aacart04391_.mp3: Because you're an impressive and beautiful woman. In some ways... good ways... you remind me of my wife and I'd like to make things right between us.
Carth.nm35aacart04393_.mp3: Thank you. Let's, ah... let's get back to what we were doing.
Carth.nm35aacart04396_.mp3: And you accepted it... but that doesn't mean I'm forgiven. I'd like to be.
Carth.nm35aacart04400_.mp3: What am I supposed to say? I was wrong. I was a stubborn fool. I... Look, I have trouble admitting it when a beautiful woman has my number...ok?
Carth.nm35aacart04402_.mp3: I'll, ah, take that as a yes. I'm glad that's settled. Shall we... shall we get back to what we were doing?
Carth.nm35aacart04405_.mp3: Sorry. Didn't mean to... embarass you. I'll stop.
Carth.nm35aacart04407_.mp3: Well... maybe a few. I hope you won't mind if I keep those to myself.
Carth.nm35aacart04409_.mp3: Oh. Right. I'll, ah, I'll just pay attention to what I'm doing...
Carth.nm35aacart04411_.mp3: I do. It's serious, though... I need your attention. Is this a good time?
Carth.nm35aacart04413_.mp3: Alright. I'm, uh... I'm concerned about you. I've been keeping these thoughts to myself, mostly, but I think it's time I say something.
Carth.nm35aacart04415_.mp3: It's about you. I'm worried about what you're doing to yourself... how much you've succumbed to violence and anger.
Carth.nm35aacart04416_.mp3: I knew it was possible for this to happen to you... and it just pains me to see it. I've been down this path. And I don't recommend it.
Carth.nm35aacart04417_.mp3: It's about you. I'm worried about what might happen to you. You have a lot of courage, and the fact you've remained strong is amazing, but there is even greater danger ahead.
Carth.nm35aacart04418_.mp3: I think you might be setting yourself up for a fall. Maybe at the urging of the Jedi, I don't know... but you're definitely going to become a target.
Carth.nm35aacart04419_.mp3: If, uh... if I'm going to find some purpose beyond taking revenge on Saul, then it's going to have to be in protecting you.
Carth.nm35aacart04420_.mp3: I don't know why, but I think some terrible fate is waiting for you. I think the Jedi Council knows it, too. And I don't want that to come to pass.
Carth.nm35aacart04422_.mp3: That's where I think you're wrong. You can't do this on your own. Nobody could.
Carth.nm35aacart04424_.mp3: I *sigh* I... don't know. I'm not the best of men, and I'm not the strongest fighter there is... but I'll find a way.
Carth.nm35aacart04426_.mp3: I know that there's going to come a day when you'll look in the mirror and wonder how you ever got to become what you are... and by then it will be too late.
Carth.nm35aacart04428_.mp3: Don't chalk it up to my paranoia just yet. Something isn't right. I blamed it on you, before, but I... I think the Jedi didn't tell us everything.
Carth.nm35aacart04429_.mp3: If I'm going to live past Saul, I need you to, as well. Let me protect you... from yourself, from the Sith... you have to let me try.
Carth.nm35aacart04431_.mp3: Because... because I never got the chance to save my wife and son. Because I didn't stop Saul when I had the chance.
Carth.nm35aacart04432_.mp3: Because I finally have the chance to do it right. You are an extraordinary woman... you make me think that maybe I might have some purpose beyond revenge.
Carth.nm35aacart04433_.mp3: I don't know whether it means anything to you... but it does to me.
Carth.nm35aacart04437_.mp3: I'm glad to hear that. I'll do my best.
Carth.nm35aacart04439_.mp3: I, uh... I guess I have no other choice. I will still help you, if I can... but I guess you're on your own.
Carth.nm35aacart04440_.mp3: If that's the way you want it, I hope things go well. Let's, uh... let's get back to what we were doing.
Carth.nm35aacart04444_.mp3: If you're ready to talk, then yes... so am I.
Carth.nm35aacart04446_.mp3: I can't hate you. I tried... I wanted to hold you responsible for all the things you've done. For my... for my wife, for Telos... for Dustil. But I can't.
Carth.nm35aacart04448_.mp3: I got the revenge I always wanted when Saul died, but it hasn't brought me the peace that I thought it would.
Carth.nm35aacart04449_.mp3: All I can think of now is the promise I made to protect you from what's going to come. It's given me a reason to look past simple revenge.
Carth.nm35aacart04450_.mp3: You have a darkness inside you that must be Revan. But there's more to you, as well. I see it, I know it's there.
Carth.nm35aacart04451_.mp3: Despite whatever part of Revan is inside you, the... the darkness that must surely be there, it isn't who you are.
Carth.nm35aacart04452_.mp3: That's why I can't hate you, why I don't want any more revenge. You don't have to be Revan, you can be so much more. Whatever the Jedi did to you, they gave you that chance.
Carth.nm35aacart04453_.mp3: You have this huge destiny waiting for you, and I just fear that if you're alone it could swallow you whole. I mean, is there room in there for me? Will you let me help you?
Carth.nm35aacart04455_.mp3: Whatever's happened up until this point, there's going to come a time very soon where you're going to have to make a choice. And there won't be any turning back.
Carth.nm35aacart04456_.mp3: I want you to make the right choice. I want to give you a reason to.
Carth.nm35aacart04458_.mp3: Well then I hope I can save you. From yourself.
Carth.nm35aacart04460_.mp3: You gave me a future. I want to give you a future, too... with me. I think I could love you, if you give me the chance.
Carth.nm35aacart04462_.mp3: Well then I'm... I'm glad. Let's... let's face the future together, then... there's still a lot to do.
Carth.nm35aacart04464_.mp3: Neither do I. But does that really matter if we love each other?
Carth.nm35aacart04470_.mp3: I think I would be hurt worse if I didn't try.
Carth.nm35aacart04473_.mp3: Oh. I had... hoped that there might be. I don't blame you. Uh. You're not the same woman I met on Taris anymore, are you?
Carth.nm35aacart04474_.mp3: Well, thank you for your honesty. I still intend to see this through to the end, whatever happens. Malak needs to be stopped.
Carth.nm35aacart04475_.mp3: And uh, you... you'll make the decision you have to. And we'll have to deal with that day when it comes.
Carth.nm35aacart04478_.mp3: Maybe you shouldn't. I would hope that my standing by you would mean something to you, but maybe it doesn't. Maybe it just can't.
Carth.nm35aacart04481_.mp3: I'm not really sure. You can figure it out on your own, can't you?
Carth.nm35aacart04482_.mp3: Sorry. I can't be of much help with that.
Carth.nm35aacart04729_.mp3: All I've been trying to say is that this isn't personal. If you were smart, you wouldn't trust anyone, either... not me, not Bastila and especially not yourself.
Carth.nm35aacart04731_.mp3: Wouldn't think of it. Feel better now?
Carth.nm35aacart04734_.mp3: Well... there's more to the story, I guess.
Carth.nm35aacart04737_.mp3: I didn't want to, maybe. Are you so sure you would have?
Carth.nm35aacart04739_.mp3: With good reason. Admiral Saul Karath is the commander of the entire Sith fleet. He's half the reason Malak has done so well in the war.
Carth.nm35aacart04747_.mp3: Is there something else you'd prefer I called you?
Carth.nm35aacart04749_.mp3: Heh heh. A little bit touchy, are we? Is there something else you'd prefer I called you?
Carth.nm35aacart04751_.mp3: Don't get yourself in a twist over it, gorgeous. I didn't mean anything by it.
Carth.nm35aacart04753_.mp3: Oh, for crying out -- fine. If it'll make you feel better, you call me something. Go ahead, come on, I can take it.
Carth.nm35aacart04755_.mp3: What? Are you afraid you'll hurt my feelings? Come on, spit it out. You can do it.
Carth.nm35aacart04757_.mp3: Is that it? You can do better than that!
Carth.nm35aacart04759_.mp3: Ouch. Heh heh heh. That *is* better. Well, I bet "beautiful" doesn't sound so bad in comparison now, does it?
Carth.nm35aacart04761_.mp3: Stubborn as ever. Okay, you got me. I bet you have your heart set on those questions. Are they really necessary?
Carth.nm35aacart04763_.mp3: Guilty as charged. I'll bet you still have those questions in mind, though. Are they really necessary?
Carth.nm35aacart04770_.mp3: I might consider it. What are you going to call me, in exchange?
Carth.nm35aacart04772_.mp3: I like the first part of that. I'm a bit more partial to "the most handsome pilot in the galaxy". What do you think?
Carth.nm35aacart04774_.mp3: Well, then, I guess "gorgeous" will have to do until then, won't it?
Carth.nm35aacart04775_.mp3: Kidding aside, I bet you're not about to give up on those questions of yours. Are they really necessary?
Carth.nm35aacart04778_.mp3: You do? Fair enough. What do you want to discuss?
Carth.nm35aacarth2002_.mp3: I'm sorry, Dustil. I did all I could, and I... failed you.
Carth.nm35aadust01006_.mp3: I have a datapad I want you to look at. You knew someone named Selene?
Carth.nm35aadust01010_.mp3: Look at it. It belongs to Master Uthar, doesn't it?
Carth.nm35aadust01014_.mp3: Killed her because she was hindering your progress. Superiority at any cost, Dustil. There's your evil. Or can you live with that?
Carth.nm35aadust01018_.mp3: Well, there's the son I remember. Now will you leave here?
Carth.nm35aadust01024_.mp3: I... don't suppose there's any way I could talk you out of that, is there? I mean, you're not going to do anything half way. Sounds familiar.
Carth.nm35aadust01030_.mp3: I don't have anything. Yet. But I haven't given up on you, Dustil.
Carth.nm35aadust01066_.mp3: Dustil... what? What are you talking about? I... I thought you were dead!
Carth.nm35aadust01072_.mp3: No, I didn't abandon you! The task force just arrived too late. Telos was in ruins, and your mother... I held her while...
Carth.nm35aadust01074_.mp3: But I looked for you. I swear I looked everywhere --
Carth.nm35aadust01078_.mp3: I didn't have a choice! I was needed...
Carth.nm35aadust01084_.mp3: The Sith? You can't mean that! No, the Sith killed your mother! The Sith destroyed Telos!
Carth.nm35aadust01088_.mp3: No, you've been brainwashed. The son I knew would never --
Carth.nm35aadust01092_.mp3: I don't know what's been done to you, but you're coming with me out of here. Now.
Carth.nm35aadust01098_.mp3: You can't mean that! The Sith are... they're evil. They're the dark side. They... they took me away from you and your mother. They're... they're what took you from me!
Carth.nm35aadust01102_.mp3: The Sith war to conquer, to rule the helpless. I went to war for *you*, Dustil. For your freedom, your future!
Carth.nm35aadust01106_.mp3: If I failed you, son, then it's... it's *my* failure. Please don't add to it by becoming part of something evil.
Carth.nm35aadust01119_.mp3: I... got it, Dustil. I'll be back. I swear it.
Carth.nm35aadust01122_.mp3: I... wish I could help you, son. I truly do.
Carth.nm35aadust01126_.mp3: You're going to have to fight your own battles, Dustil. I've...I've fought all I can for you.
Carth.nm35aadust01130_.mp3: Shut up! Stay out of this!
Carth.nm35aadust01138_.mp3: No! I won't accept that! I won't give up on him!!
Carth.nm35aadust01142_.mp3: Stop it, Dustil! Stop it! I won't let you go on like this! What have they done to you?!
Carth.nm35aadust01146_.mp3: No... no, that's not true! I was there when you were younger, but I had to leave to fight! I fought for *you*, for your freedom!
Carth.nm35aadust01163_.mp3: I'm proud of you, Dustil. You aren't hanging onto a lie after you see it for what it is. Not everyone could do that.
Carth.nm35aajord10012_.mp3: So, what are you doing here, Jordo? The last time I saw you was on, um... well, Telos, actually.
Carth.nm35aajord10018_.mp3: No! Jordo, Dustil has been missing since the attack on Telos! Are you... are you absolutely certain it was him?!
Carth.nm35aajord10020_.mp3: What do you mean he's joined the Sith?
Carth.nm35aajord10022_.mp3: No... no, I... I didn't. Well, thanks for telling me, Jordo.
Carth.nm35aajord10024_.mp3: Dustil... Dustil is alive! We have to go to the Korriban academy and find him!
Carth.nm35aajord10026_.mp3: You think I don't know that? I just... if there's a chance we can try to find him... I don't want to wait to track him down, if possible.
Carth.nm35aajord10028_.mp3: Thank you. I... I just have to see him. I have to know what happened to him.
Carth.nm35aajord10030_.mp3: I don't know. I don't know why Dustil would be with the Sith... but I... I have to find out. There's simply no choice.
Carth.nm35aajord10031_.mp3: All this time I've thought he was... he must be a man by now...
Carth.nm35aalash07037_.mp3: Keep it up and I'll gag you. Are you forgetting where we are? Now be quiet.
Carth.nm35aautha22069_.mp3: So it's a popularity contest, basically? Wonderful.
Carth.nm35aautha22088_.mp3: I'd love to know what's going on in that tricky mind of yours.
Carth.nm35aautha22159_.mp3: We should have kept that. It could have made a --
Carth.nm35aayuth24015_.mp3: Darth Malak went there? Very interesting... isn't it, master?
Carth.nm37aafree04106_.mp3: I suppose that's the nature of the dark side. Power, but no longevity. Eventually it just consumes itself.
Carth.nm37aashaa05004_.mp3: You wouldn't have considered, oh, I don't know... getting it yourself?
Carth.nm38aaassa01109_.mp3: I knew there would be a catch. There's always a catch.
Carth.nm38abmeke03041_.mp3: I don't suppose the fact that he's weak as a newborn kith pup has anything to do with his decision?
Carth.nm39aastar99004_.mp3: Why am I not surprised to find one of the Star Maps in a place like this?
Carth.nm39aastar99005_.mp3: I guess we can get out of here now. I won't be missing this place, that's for sure.
Carth.nm40aabast01001_.mp3: They tortured all of us, though you got the worst of it by far. Saul wanted them to make us suffer. He's become some sort of sadistic monster.
Carth.nm40aabast01010_.mp3: None of this will matter if we don't get out of this prison before Saul gets back!
Carth.nm40aabast01012_.mp3: Saul mentioned that Lord Malak was on his way. I think the Admiral left to prepare for his arrival... and to report the results of our interrogation.
Carth.nm40aabast01020_.mp3: Stop it, both of you! Bastila, you... you can't honestly say how you would have reacted in that situation - nobody can! Besides, Saul already had all the information. I could tell.
Carth.nm40aabast01022_.mp3: Don't be so hard on yourself. I've known the Admiral a long time. I could see that he already knew the answers to the questions he was asking.
Carth.nm40aabast01026_.mp3: I've known Admiral Karath a long time and I think you're right.
Carth.nm40aabast01027_.mp3: The interrogation was a sham. Saul was toying with us. He didn't care what we told him. I think it was just an excuse to torture us before Malak arrived.
Carth.nm40aabast01029_.mp3: Well, then we better hope Mission busts us out of here before he arrives.
Carth.nm40aabast01030_.mp3: Well, then we better hope T3-M4 busts us out of here before he arrives.
Carth.nm40aabast01031_.mp3: Well, then we better hope Jolee busts us out of here before he arrives.
Carth.nm40aabast01032_.mp3: Well, then we better hope Canderous busts us out of here before he arrives.
Carth.nm40aabast01033_.mp3: Well, then we better hope Juhani busts us out of here before he arrives.
Carth.nm40aabast01034_.mp3: Well, then we better hope HK-47 busts us out of here before he arrives.
Carth.nm40aabast01037_.mp3: Forget about it, Bastila. It doesn't matter anyway. I've known the Admiral a long time. I could see that he already knew the answers to the questions he was asking.
Carth.nm40aabast01047_.mp3: I, uh... I have to confess something. There was a... there was a moment - just a moment - when part of me was hoping that you would tell him what he wanted to know. Just to make the horrible pain stop.
Carth.nm40aabast01049_.mp3: No, I know you wouldn't ever do anything to intentionally cause me pain. But you had no other choice. You couldn't betray our cause.
Carth.nm40aabast01050_.mp3: I... I don't honestly know if I could have been as strong in your position. To watch you suffer like that I... I might have cracked.
