Male_89.nm26acrept15010_.mp3: The encryption system is composed of 6 'matrices'. Each is based on a mathematical method. The holes we're missing are the final number in each of the strings.
Male_89.nm26acrept15012_.mp3: Most are simple, but the final two matrices seem to be much more difficult.
Male_89.nm26acrept15014_.mp3: The second-last matrix has a pattern looping back on itself, or something, and the last is divided into smaller subparts. Maybe the pattern for that is within each part...
Male_89.nm26acrept15016_.mp3: But I have to admit, all this is a bit over my head. I haven't even been able to slice past the first matrix and I've been at this for hours.
Male_89.nm26acrept15018_.mp3: I've ruined a dozen cards already... But the good thing is we have a whole box of them, so you don't have to worry about running out any time soon.
Male_89.nm26acrept15020_.mp3: Since Roland said you were cleared, you can use the computer freely. I'll be here if you have any questions.
Male_89.nm26acrept15023_.mp3: Oh, OK. Well I'll just explain the encryption method anyway, you might need it if your passcode doesn't live up to expectations.
Male_89.nm26acrept15025_.mp3: Hey, great! You sliced the encryption on those cards! They change the codes regularly, so you'll have to use it pretty soon or not at all.
Male_89.nm26acrept15027_.mp3: Did you do something to the computer? The operating layer seems a little sketchy... Maybe it's just another bug in the system.
Male_89.nm26acrept15029_.mp3: Can I help you with anything?
Male_89.nm26acrept15031_.mp3: The Sith encryption scheme on these cards is based on a sequence of simple mathematical principles.
Male_89.nm26acrept15033_.mp3: We have managed to decode the majority of the encryption algorithm, by the final segments of the terminal sequences elude us.
Male_89.nm26acrept15035_.mp3: If you think you are able, you can try to break the code on the card. Don't worry if you happen to ruin the card, the box we captured has a whole bunch of them.
Male_89.nm26acrept15037_.mp3: Can I help you with anything else?
Male_89.nm26acrept15039_.mp3: That recording? I have no idea what it is. Its probably classified... and I don't have clearance for that sort of thing.
Male_89.nm26acrept15041_.mp3: It might be something one of our intelligence agents picked up.
Male_89.nm26acrept15043_.mp3: Can I help you with anything else?
Male_89.nm26acrept15045_.mp3: I actually don't know much about it at all. It's some sort of facility the Republic built here wasn't it?
Male_89.nm26acrept15047_.mp3: I'm not really cleared for that sort of information...
Male_89.nm26acrept15049_.mp3: Can I help you with anything else?
Male_89.nm26acrept15051_.mp3: Ok, sure. Come back if you need anything.

Male_91.nm33aacust05000_.mp3: Just having a drink, friend, minding my own business.
Male_91.nm33aacust05002_.mp3: If you see one of them Sith wandering around outside of the monastery, just look away. They rule this planet and they do as they like.
Male_91.nm33aacust05004_.mp3: There are folk who come from all over Sith space looking to get into the monastery here to be trained. Only a few of them ever get chosen, however.
Male_91.nm33aacust05006_.mp3: Ah, wish they had a band, here. Place is dull as an asteroid.
Male_91.nm33aacust05008_.mp3: I hear the Sith are digging up old artifacts in some valley up on the surface. I wonder what that's all about?

Male_92.nm03aahidb14000_.mp3: You Sith don't scare me. Down here the swoop gang's are in charge and you don't have enough troops on Taris to do anything about it!
Male_92.nm03aahidb14002_.mp3: Hey - I recognize you! You're the one who won the swoop race!
Male_92.nm03aahidb14004_.mp3: You were racing for those damn Vulkars! You'll pay for that!
Male_92.nm03aahidb14006_.mp3: You better be careful out here. Those damn Vulkars will be looking to get even with you for winning that race and killing Brejik.
Male_92.nm03aahidb14008_.mp3: Brejik is nothing but a punk! I don't know why those Vulkars follow him - Gadon's ten times the man he is!
Male_92.nm03aahidb14010_.mp3: The swoop race coming up will show those Vulkars who's in charge here! When we win half the people following Brejik will desert him!
Male_92.nm03aahidb14012_.mp3: You need to get inside - the Black Vulkars are gunning down everyone they find on the streets! You should go to Javyar's cantina, you'll be safe there.
Male_92.nm03aahidb14014_.mp3: Or if you have nowhere else to go head for the Hidden Bek base. Gadon doesn't mind non-members dropping in, and you'll be safe from the Vulkars there.
Male_92.nm03aahidb14016_.mp3: You should get off the streets - those Black Vulkars will take a shot at anybody!

Male_93.nm22aaxcze12000_.mp3: I do my job and keep my mouth shut. Maybe I can do some good if I stay out of people's way.
Male_93.nm22aaxcze12001_.mp3: There is so much to learn about this planet, but they keep us cooped up in here.
Male_93.nm22aaxcze12002_.mp3: The payoff from research is too much of a risk for Czerka to spend much money on it. Slaves are proven commodities.
Male_93.nm22aaxcze12003_.mp3: I think Czerka is missing an opportunity here. The forest could teach us so much.
Male_93.nm22aaxcze12004_.mp3: Local fauna is amazing. If I could isolate why the trees grow so big, it would be worth more than a thousand Wookiee slaves.
Male_93.nm22aaxcze12005_.mp3: Our work here could be very important if any effort was put into it.
Male_93.nm22abczgu04000_.mp3: You want to talk, do it with Patrol Captain Dehno. He's the ranking officer in this unit.
Male_93.nm33aaczer06008_.mp3: Please avoid the Sith academy... unless you are a hopeful, naturally.

Male_94.nm08aahudr11000_.mp3: Thank you! You have no idea what it was like in that torture cage. I don't know how much more I could take before going mad.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11002_.mp3: I don't have anything to give you as a reward for freeing me. Nothing tangible, anyway. But I've got information that could be worth a fortune.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11005_.mp3: I used to be the pilot of the Ebon Hawk - Davik's flagship. I know the codes to disable the security system protecting it. I'll load them into your datapad now.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11007_.mp3: You can use those codes to steal the Ebon Hawk right out of its hangar. Sell it to the highest bidder, ransom it back to Davik - whatever you do you'll make thousands!
Male_94.nm08aahudr11009_.mp3: It won't be long until Davik figures out I'm free. I have to get out of this base before that happens.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11016_.mp3: Questions? Please - I've already told you the only useful thing I know. Just let me go before Davik figures out I'm missing.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11018_.mp3: What? But... I don't have anything else! Those Ebon Hawk codes are worth a fortune! Isn't that enough? Please, just let me go.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11025_.mp3: You core-slime! I didn't survive through all that torture just to let you kill me!
Male_94.nm08aahudr11028_.mp3: Please don't hurt me! I'll tell you everything I know - information worth a fortune! So just stay calm, okay? I'll tell you what I know.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11030_.mp3: Please... the pain. I can't take it anymore! Please help me. Please... just release me from this torture cage.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11032_.mp3: My name is Hudrow. I used to be Davik's personal pilot until he caught me smuggling spice on the side. He threw me in here to be tortured to death! Please... I can't take much more of this!
Male_94.nm08aahudr11034_.mp3: I've got information... the security codes for the Ebon Hawk. The ship is worth a fortune! I'll give them to you if you release me! Please... I'm begging you!
Male_94.nm08aahudr11036_.mp3: Thank you! The button in the corner - just press it and I'll be free. Hurry!
Male_94.nm08aahudr11039_.mp3: No way. I can't afford to trust anyone. Those codes are my only leverage - without them I'll never get out of here! Set me free, then I'll give you the codes.
Male_94.nm08aahudr11041_.mp3: No! What kind of a monster are you? Please - they'll torture me until I'm dead! Don't leave me here!
Male_94.nm08aahudr11048_.mp3: The button over there in the corner. Please - just press the button and set me free from this torture cage!

Male_95.nm17af07of07000_.mp3: Get lost, spacer. I've had enough of you.
Male_95.nm17af07of07001_.mp3: Something you want, spacer? Go talk to the office if you want to complain about conditions here. I don't want to hear it.
Male_95.nm17af07of07003_.mp3: You swoop racers, do you even know what it takes to run an outpost like this? As long as there's flat ground, what do you care?
Male_95.nm17af07of07008_.mp3: Like I said before, I don't much care what you think. I'll be on the street if business keeps dropping, and it will.
Male_95.nm17af07of07009_.mp3: Well, you don't look like much of a customer, and neither does anyone else here. I sell to companies, not people loitering in bars.
Male_95.nm17af07of07013_.mp3: You're pet is growling. Maybe he needs to be brushed. Look, you're just like everyone else, angry about not getting enough work.
Male_95.nm17af07of07022_.mp3: Nobody we've brought, that's for sure. Our experts said this rock was supposed to have mining potential to last for years.
Male_95.nm17af07of07024_.mp3: Nothing but garbage ore, good for nothing. You ever try to sell someone garbage? My name is mud in three systems now.
Male_95.nm17af07of07026_.mp3: Good. I've a lack of business to attend to.
Male_95.nm17af07of07028_.mp3: Trouble? Why would I want to make trouble with you? This planet has more than enough as it is.
Male_95.nm17af07of07032_.mp3: What, are you a beggar? Fine, if it will get you to leave, take a few cred's, but don't expect another handout.
Male_95.nm17af07of07035_.mp3: What are you doing, coming in here like you're Sand People or something? That's no way to do business. I don't need this.
Male_95.nm17af07of07037_.mp3: Here, take some cred's, if that's what you want. Go drown in a drink, like every other failure in here.
Male_95.nm17af07of07039_.mp3: Just hot air blowing, eh? Well take it somewhere else. I don't have the patience right now. Not with my workload.
Male_95.nm17af07of07041_.mp3: Go on, leave me alone. I don't want to have anything more to do with you.
Male_95.nm17af07of07042_.mp3: Well, imagine you coming back. Something you want?

Male_96.nm35aameke08008_.mp3: It's a bad year to try and become a Sith, you know... I've got it all wrapped up.
Male_96.nm35aameke08014_.mp3: You think I would tell you? Have my brains started dribbling out of my nose, or something?

Male_97.nm28aamerc03078_.mp3: If you're going to go into the rest of the station, don't expect me to help you... the Selkath will rip you all apart!
Male_97.nm35aasith12000_.mp3: *sigh* Politics are afoot at the academy once again. You'd best be careful... a lot of people 'disappear' at a time like this.
Male_97.nm35aasith12002_.mp3: Congratulations on joining the academy proper. I imagine you'll be taking your final test soon?
Male_97.nm35aasith12004_.mp3: How do you do? Excuse me... I must return to my studies.
Male_97.nm35aasith12006_.mp3: Hmm. Is that the sword of Ajunta Pall you have there? Fascinating. If it truly is, you might want to hand that over to Master Uthar, no?
Male_97.nm35aasith12008_.mp3: Greetings. You're one of the new hopefuls, aren't you? I imagine you're eager to garner some prestige for Master Uthar.
Male_97.nm35aasith12010_.mp3: My name is Tamlen. I'm assigned here to the library... mostly keeping it up to date with new discoveries and such.
Male_97.nm35aasith12013_.mp3: Hmm. That depends. Do you know anything about Ajunta Pall?
Male_97.nm35aasith12015_.mp3: I am adding new entries into our library's database based on the excavations in the valley. Currently I'm working on Ajunta Pall... quite a fascinating subject.
Male_97.nm35aasith12017_.mp3: Ajunta Pall was one of the first of the great Sith Lords... at least, according to the ruins here on Korriban. One of the tombs out in the Valley of the Dark Lords belongs to him.
Male_97.nm35aasith12019_.mp3: He wielded a powerful sword, by all accounts. Some of us believe it might be in that tomb, which is quite exciting.
Male_97.nm35aasith12021_.mp3: According to legend, Ajunta Pall forged a sword imbued with the essence of the dark side. Someone who found it could gain considerable prestige.
Male_97.nm35aasith12025_.mp3: A little. Some of us believe it may be found in his tomb in the Valley of the Dark Lords. Whoever found the sword could gain great prestige.
Male_97.nm35aasith12027_.mp3: Some unsuccessful attempts have been made. I truly don't know why a more concerted effort isn't made, however.
Male_97.nm35aasith12029_.mp3: You simply need to follow the east passage... there's an exit there which will lead you up to the surface. Look for Tariga... she is in that area and can probably help you.
Male_97.nm35aasith12033_.mp3: Well... the legends say the sword had dark power, but that may only be a story. We will never know unless we can examine it more closely.
Male_97.nm35aasith12035_.mp3: I imagine you've got a lot to do.
Male_97.nm35aasith15006_.mp3: Did you hear? Yuthura is dead. Master Uthar said so. I bet she got too impatient and failed to assassinate him. Idiot.

Male_98.nm26aatrav26000_.mp3: The Selkath have clamped down on kolto exports all of a sudden. No one knows why. If someone did something to offend them, there's going to be trouble I think.
Male_98.nm26aatrav26001_.mp3: Manaan may not seem very hospitable, but a surprising amount of trade runs through it because of the kolto trade.
Male_98.nm26aatrav26002_.mp3: I heard the Sith are trying to work on a synthetic version of kolto. I wouldn't be surprised if the Republic was, too.
Male_98.nm26aatrav26003_.mp3: I heard someone attack and killed a lot of the Sith leadership on one of their worlds. Maybe the Republic would actually have a chance... if it weren't for Malak.
Male_98.nm26aatrav26004_.mp3: The fighting between the Republic and the Sith is spreading farther. I wonder how long before Manaan becomes a battleground...
Male_98.nm26aatrav26005_.mp3: There's a lot of credits to be made in the Republic in times like these. If we survive of course...
Male_98.nm26aatrav26006_.mp3: I hear the Czerka Corp. got kicked off Kashyyyk by the locals... Good for them! At least someone's getting something back from them.
Male_98.nm26aatrav26007_.mp3: I hear there's going to be a heavy meteor shower in the Coruscant system this year. Last time this sort of thing happened, they lost one of the orbital stations.
Male_98.nm26aatrav26008_.mp3: Did I tell you I'm a fan? I saw recordings of some of your races and you're great! Maybe when they get the circuit back up we can really see what you can do!
Male_98.nm26aatrav26009_.mp3: The whole swoop racing circuit for this sector has been falling apart since the Sith bombed Taris.
Male_98.nm26aatrav26010_.mp3: Wow! Hey, you're the sector swoop champ, right? Too bad about the circuit being so small this year, but still!
Male_98.nm26aatrav26011_.mp3: A friend of mine recently got into Pazaak - you know, the card game. Now he can't stop! It's so addictive!
Male_98.nm26aatrav26012_.mp3: I don't know how much longer I can stay on this world... The Selkath don't make it easy for us off-worlders.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26000_.mp3: The Selkath have clamped down on kolto exports all of a sudden. No one knows why. If someone did something to offend them, there's going to be trouble I think.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26001_.mp3: Manaan may not seem very hospitable, but a surprising amount of trade runs through it because of the kolto trade.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26002_.mp3: I heard the Sith are trying to work on a synthetic version of kolto. I wouldn't be surprised if the Republic was, too.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26003_.mp3: I heard there's been some sort of revolt on one of the Sith worlds. Maybe the Republic would actually have a chance... if it weren't for Malak.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26004_.mp3: The fighting between the Republic and the Sith is spreading farther. I wonder how long before Manaan becomes a battleground...
Male_98.nm26abtrav26005_.mp3: There's a lot of credits to be made in the Republic in times like these. If we survive of course...
Male_98.nm26abtrav26006_.mp3: I hear the Czerka Corp. got kicked off Kashyyyk by the locals... Good for them! At least someone's getting something back from them.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26007_.mp3: I hear there's going to be a heavy meteor shower in the Coruscant system this year. Last time this sort of thing happened, they lost one of the orbital stations.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26008_.mp3: Did I tell you I'm a fan? I saw recordings of some of your races and you're great! Maybe when they get the circuit back up we can really see what you can do!
Male_98.nm26abtrav26009_.mp3: The whole swoop racing circuit for this sector has been falling apart since the Sith bombed Taris.
Male_98.nm26abtrav26010_.mp3: Wow! Hey, you're the sector swoop champ, right? Too bad about the circuit being so small this year, but still!
Male_98.nm26abtrav26011_.mp3: A friend of mine recently got into Pazaak - you know, the card game. Now he can't stop! It's so addictive!
Male_98.nm26abtrav26012_.mp3: I don't know how much longer I can stay on this world... The Selkath don't make it easy for us off-worlders.

Male_99.nm02aedead06000_.mp3: I heard you challenged Bendak Starkiller. I'll probably watch the fight... but forgive me if I don't go to your funeral.
Male_99.nm02aedead06002_.mp3: This is great! You beat Bendak - you're a legend! Whenever anyone asks I can say I was the first duelist the Mysterious Stranger ever beat in the ring! I'm going to be famous!
Male_99.nm02aedead06004_.mp3: Wow - you're the new champ. Congratulations, I guess. You know, when you started out I actually thought I'd be able to crawl up from my last place ranking for a while.
Male_99.nm02aedead06006_.mp3: Shows what I know. Enjoy your time at the top, Stranger. Sooner or later someone will come along to knock you down here with the rest of us grinders!
Male_99.nm02aedead06008_.mp3: You beat Ice! I've been trying to beat her for years, and you do it just like that! Heh. I can't believe how lucky you are!
Male_99.nm02aedead06010_.mp3: That's right - I said lucky! Lucky to be born with the kind of talent I've spent a life time trying to build. It isn't fair, I tell you!
Male_99.nm02aedead06012_.mp3: What do you want? Oh, let me guess - you beat me in the dueling ring and now you're here to rub it in my face! Yeah well, I'm used to it. So pardon me if I ignore your gloating.
Male_99.nm02aedead06014_.mp3: Questions? I don't have to answer your questions just because you beat me in the ring!
Male_99.nm02aedead06016_.mp3: Look, I admit it - you're better than me. Everyone is better than me! A blindfolded, one-legged tach with a rusty knife could probably beat me, okay?
Male_99.nm02aedead06018_.mp3: Is that what you wanted to hear? You satisfied yet? Are you happy now that you've taken the last shred of dignity I have?
Male_99.nm02aedead06023_.mp3: Gee, I wonder why? Couldn't have anything to do with being the WORST duelist on Taris, could it? Even a rookie like you got the better of me!
Male_99.nm02aedead06028_.mp3: Back for more, eh? I thought you would have learned your lesson by now: don't step into the dueling ring with Deadeye Duncan!
Male_99.nm02aedead06030_.mp3: I may have lost 54 consecutive matches before I beat you, but I figure I've got your number! You want to step into the ring again, just tell the duel organizer to set it up!
Male_99.nm02aedead06032_.mp3: Questions? Ha! I don't think so, Stranger! You don't get to ask me questions; I beat you in the ring - I OWN you!
Male_99.nm02aedead06034_.mp3: Yeah yeah, off you go. Run away like the coward you are!
Male_99.nm02aedead06036_.mp3: What are you looking at, fresh meat? You want a piece of me? You want to step into the dueling chambers with me?
Male_99.nm02aedead06038_.mp3: I'm Deadeye Duncan, the number five ranked duelist in this cantina. You must have seen me in the dueling chambers, right?
Male_99.nm02aedead06040_.mp3: Uh... five. But it's an elite group, okay? It's not like just anyone can step into the dueling chamber! Well, actually anyone can... but not many do!
Male_99.nm02aedead06042_.mp3: You know - the dueling chambers: two people in combat, loser gets carried out unconscious on a stretcher. It's the only reason people come into this part of the cantina.
Male_99.nm02aedead06044_.mp3: Look, I'm the number five ranked duelist around here; I don't have time to explain all this. Go talk to the Duel Organizer if you're interested. He's that Hutt over there in the corner.
Male_99.nm02aedead06046_.mp3: Big talk. Go speak with the Hutt in the corner to back it up - he's the Duel Organizer. I'll look forward to our match. Fresh meat is just what I need to end my losing streak!
Male_99.nm02aedead06049_.mp3: Yeah, that's right - back off! You know better than to challenge Deadeye Duncan. I will mess you up!

Male_Child_01.nm02abithb10002_.mp3: Get out of here you goggle-eyed freak! You're too ugly for the Upper City!
Male_Child_01.nm02abithb10008_.mp3: Yeah - why would a human want to help you, freak?
Male_Child_01.nm02abithb10012_.mp3: You're a freak, too! Why don't you get outta here, ya freaks!!
Male_Child_01.nm02abithb10031_.mp3: Yeah - he isn't even supposed to be in the Upper City!
Male_Child_01.nm02abithb10038_.mp3: Come on - let's go. I don't want to listen to this alien lover anymore!

Male_Child_02.nm02acchil01000_.mp3: You're one of them Sith, ain't you? My mommy says I'm not supposed to talk to you.
Male_Child_02.nm02acchil01003_.mp3: Is you one of the Sith? My daddy says the Sith are nothing but bullies. You don't look like a bully.
Male_Child_02.nm02acchil01005_.mp3: My Momma says I have to stay out of the Lower City. That's where bad people live.
Male_Child_02.nm02acchil01007_.mp3: You ever seen a swoop bike? I seen them at the races sometimes. They go fast and make lots of noise!
Male_Child_02.nm04aaoutc13000_.mp3: You talked to old Rukil Wrinkle-Skin? My mommy says he's crazy! I have to stay away from him!
Male_Child_02.nm04aaoutc13002_.mp3: Mommy says all the up-worlders is selfish and mean. But you look nice to me.
Male_Child_02.nm04aaoutc13004_.mp3: Mommy said you're the one who made her sick friend better. She said you gave him medicine.
Male_Child_02.nm04aaoutc13006_.mp3: My mommy's friend got sick. She said he got the rakghoul disease. But we ain't got no medicine to make him better.
Male_Child_02.nm04aaoutc13008_.mp3: I'm not allowed to go out past the gate. My daddy went out there once and he never came back. Mommy said the rakghouls got him.

Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07000_.mp3: I saw you talking with Rukil. He told you his legends about the Promised Land, didn't he? He told you all about his missing apprentice and the other lost explorers, right?
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07002_.mp3: You know, most people don't believe his stories - they figure he's nothing but an old kook. But I think there might be some truth in what he's saying. That's why I want to stop him!
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07004_.mp3: For an Outcast, I've got things pretty good. The village relies on me to bring in food and supplies - I'm an important man. If it wasn't for Gendar I'd be running this place.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07006_.mp3: But if Rukil ever finds his Promised Land, I'm sunk. People won't need to rely on me anymore. I'll just be another nobody like all the rest of the villagers. I won't let that happen!
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07008_.mp3: Don't judge me! I learned a long time ago that if I want to survive down here I've got to look out for number one.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07011_.mp3: The two explorers who went searching for the Promised Land might have found something. They might have found clues or evidence - just like Rukil's apprentice!
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07013_.mp3: They would have recorded that information in their journals. I'll pay you if you bring all three journals to me - the two from the explorers and the one from Rukil's apprentice.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07015_.mp3: Then I can destroy the evidence and make sure nobody ever finds the Promised Land! I've saved up enough credits from my business here to make it worth your while if you help me.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07017_.mp3: Don't be a fool. I'm the only one here who can pay you for those journals. Rukil has nothing - he won't be able to come up with any kind of reward.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07020_.mp3: Once you have all three journals just bring them to me and I'll give you a decent reward. Now, was there something else you needed?
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07023_.mp3: I don't want you to kill Rukil - he's not the problem. It's those damn explorers that went before him. What if they actually found something?
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07027_.mp3: Oh, don't worry, I'll make this quick. I've got an offer that might be worth your while.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07029_.mp3: Hey, you ain't from the village! You're from the up-world, ain't you? Yes, you've got credits I bet.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07031_.mp3: My name's Igear. I run a little salvage shop here. You want to buy something from my store? I got some good deals.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07033_.mp3: If a villager comes across any useful salvage in the Undercity they bring it to me. Every so often members from the Lower City gangs come down to trade for the salvage.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07035_.mp3: They'll exchange food and medicine for engine parts, old blasters and the like. Sometimes they even give me credits if I have some really good stuff.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07037_.mp3: Oh, you better ask Gendar - he's the spokesman for the village. I just run the store. I don't want to make him mad by answering any questions. Gendar already doesn't like me.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07039_.mp3: Gendar seems to think I should share the profits of my store with the whole village. He figures we're all in this together so it should be share and share alike.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07041_.mp3: But I'm the one who runs the store! I'm the one who makes the deals! The others just bring me salvage to trade with the up-worlders - why should they get anything?
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07043_.mp3: Hey, you don't know what it's like down here! I have to claw and scrape to survive - nobody else will look out for me. But Gendar doesn't agree with my philosophy.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07046_.mp3: Exactly my point. But Gendar doesn't see it that way.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07049_.mp3: He caught me hoarding supplies a while back. I figured I'd wait until food was scarce and then I could offer it to people who'd follow me instead of Gendar. Then I'd be the leader!
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07051_.mp3: But Gendar made me share my hoard. Ever since then he hasn't trusted me. He keeps me around because of my store, though. Without it this village wouldn't stand a chance.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07053_.mp3: It ain't the best stuff - mostly salvage and such. But the prices are right.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07056_.mp3: Yeah, okay. You come back and see me if you want to deal.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07058_.mp3: Hey there, up-worlder. You want to see what I got for sale in my inventory? Or do you need something else?
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07060_.mp3: I knew Rukil's legends about the Promised Land were true! Quick - give me those journals so I can destroy them!
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07062_.mp3: Right - your reward. Here's 100 credits; that's a pretty hefty payment for some old notes and maps, eh?
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07064_.mp3: Excellent - now Rukil will never lead these people to the Promised Land! Now, is there something else you need? You want to look at my inventory?
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07066_.mp3: [Success] Well, I don't want Rukil to get his hands on them journals. I'll give you 200 credits - that's all I have.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07068_.mp3: [Failure] I don't think you understand how much 100 credits is worth down here in the Undercity. This is a small fortune!
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07070_.mp3: I want those journals, but I'm not rich like you up-worlders. 100 credits is all I can afford.
Male_Creepy_01.nm04aaigea07072_.mp3: Fine - go to Rukil! But he won't be able to pay you anything for those journals. Come back and see me when you're ready to stop acting crazy and you want to cut a deal.

Male_Drunk_01.nm02abdrun05012_.mp3: Yeah, like he said, these shtreets are for the Upper City citizens! You better get out of our way if you know what's good for you!
Male_Drunk_01.nm02abdrun05027_.mp3: You talk big, shlummie! Maybe you should show us a little more reshpect!
Male_Drunk_01.nm02abdrun05030_.mp3: Hey, this shlummie's got a mouth!

Male_Drunk_02.nm02abdrun05000_.mp3: Woo, hey, look at this... it's the Shith! [hic] Oh no, I'm sho shcared! Hoo hoo hoo.
Male_Drunk_02.nm02abdrun05004_.mp3: Uh... yeah. You're right. [hic] Shorry about this, Shithy. [hic] Come on fellas, let's go.
Male_Drunk_02.nm02abdrun05006_.mp3: What is thish planet coming to, huh? [hic] Shlummies walkin' around the Upper City!
Male_Drunk_02.nm02abdrun05014_.mp3: [Success] A drink? Hey - for a shlummie you ain't so bad! Come on boys - this shlummie's buying the next round!
Male_Drunk_02.nm02abdrun05018_.mp3: Uh... yeah. I guess you're right. Maybe next time, shlummie. [hic] Come on fellas, let's go.
Male_Drunk_02.nm02abdrun05020_.mp3: [Failure] We don't drink with your kind, shlummie! Go back to the lower city where you belong!

Male_Drunk_03.nm02abdrun05002_.mp3: Careful... don't do anything shtupid! [hic] We don't want no trouble with the Shith. [hic]
Male_Drunk_03.nm02abdrun05008_.mp3: Shouldn't you go back to the Lower Cities where you belong, shlummie?
Male_Drunk_03.nm02abdrun05016_.mp3: No way! Forget it! No more drinksh! We're late enough as it is.
Male_Drunk_03.nm02abdrun05022_.mp3: Time to teach you a lesson, shlummie! [hic] Maybe you'll think twice about coming up into our turf!
Male_Drunk_03.nm02abdrun05025_.mp3: [Success] Uh... c'mon, fellas. This shlummie ain't worth the bother.

Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28018_.mp3: [Success] I suppose one more wouldn't hurt. Barkeep, ring up another round!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28020_.mp3: Firaxian Tooth - almost as valuable as kolto, right? Ha ha ha! I gotta get this recipe someday. Wonder if I can brew it up right at home? What do you think is in this stuff, anyway?
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28022_.mp3: As long as it's not about Sith business, the answer is yes, sweetie! Yes to another round, yes to I think you're gorgeous and yes to anything you want to do together!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28025_.mp3: One more, barkeep! Hurry up, man - this stuff is powerful quick, but it wears off just as fast!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28028_.mp3: [Success] I suppose one more wouldn't hurt. Barkeep, ring up another round!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28030_.mp3: [Success] I suppose one more wouldn't hurt. Barkeep, ring up another round!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28032_.mp3: Sure - fire away. It's the least I can do after you bought me a drink and all.
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28036_.mp3: Aw, you want to talk business? I was hoping you wanted to ask something more... you know, personal. Look, I don't want to talk shop. I just want to relax with my drink... which is, unfortunately, empty now.
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28038_.mp3: I hope the Selkath fry that Sunry for what he did. Elassa was a real looker, and nobody kills a Sith and gets away with it!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28042_.mp3: Oh... I get it. I get a little too forward and you want to hold it against me.
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28043_.mp3: Hey, I just thought of something! If I said you had a great body, would you hold it against me? Ha ha ha!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28044_.mp3: Barkeep, I sense I've offended my lady friend. Bring me another round so I can drown my sorrows in the sweet nectar of the Selkath people.
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28045_.mp3: Well, mish... I fear I am good and truly drunk. But don't let my inebriashion fool you... you are shtill a gorgeush creature. (hic)
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28048_.mp3: Yesh! One more drink! Jus' what I wash thinking!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28050_.mp3: Dunno what yer talkin' about... Mmmm, but you don't need a map to get what I can give ya!
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28052_.mp3: Shunry... he's goin' away for a loooong time. We Shith made sure of that.
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28054_.mp3: Jus' rumors. Shtuff I heard about making sure them shtupid fish people find the evidence they need.
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28055_.mp3: I don't wanna talk about that shtuff no more. Why don't we shlip away together, darling?
Male_Drunk_04.nm26aavigl28057_.mp3: Who knows? Who cares? Bad enough them Selkath punks are running around our bashe, making it shtink like fish!.

Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04000_.mp3: No... that is not the one. My ancient sword is black as the night sky... I remember now.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04004_.mp3: Yes... that is the one. That is the blade that destroyed me.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04006_.mp3: Take it... take it and the other blades, even... take them and go. My darkness awaits me...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04008_.mp3: No... need? What choice have I?
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04010_.mp3: Return? But... I betrayed my old masters. They would never let me return to the light side. It is too late... too late...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04012_.mp3: [Success] If... if I could return. Oh, my Master... it has been... so long... and I regret so much...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04014_.mp3: [Failure] No... I... do not think so. I have the eternity... I deserved. I made my choice long ago.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04017_.mp3: [Success] If I... if I could return. Oh, my Master... it has been... so long... and I regret so much...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04019_.mp3: Then I have... the eternity I deserved. It has taken me... so long to realize that. I made my choice long ago.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04023_.mp3: No, I cannot. Here... here is where I rest. Here is where my eternity awaits.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04027_.mp3: Our... oldest secret is buried, but not here. I... remember nothing else. I cannot help you.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04030_.mp3: Do not... do not say such things! I... still have power! Go! Go from my... ancient tomb!
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04032_.mp3: Then feel my power! You shall... die here, with me!!
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04035_.mp3: I shall not tell you... our oldest secret! I shall not! Begone!
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04037_.mp3: Never! I shall... destroy you first! Die here... remain forever with me!
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04040_.mp3: Take the blades and leave me to my darkness...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04043_.mp3: Do not let the dark flame guide you, young one...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04047_.mp3: Too long... too long in the cold and the dark. I am disturbed again? A human...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04057_.mp3: Do... I know you? It... seems as if we have met before...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04059_.mp3: Are you certain? You... the Force is with you. So strong, so bright. You remind me of... someone I once knew, so long ago...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04061_.mp3: [Success] I do... and yet I do not. The Force is so strong with you, human... yet the face, the soul... it has been so very long...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04065_.mp3: A... Jedi? Here? Why have you come to this dark place, Jedi? Why... disturb my sleepless rest?
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04069_.mp3: I... had a name, once. Ajunta Pall. Yes, that was my name. I was one of many. We were servants of the dark side... Sith Lords, we called ourselves. So proud.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04071_.mp3: In the end we were not so proud. We hid... hid from those we had betrayed. We fell... and I knew it would be so...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04073_.mp3: Ancient? Has it been so long that you use the word 'ancient'? I have... been here so long, so lost, I cannot... cannot remember...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04075_.mp3: We were the first. The first to rebel, to betray... to surrender ourselves to the dark side. So strong, we thought... so wrong...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04077_.mp3: Our Jedi Masters. Those who had taught us to use the Force... who warned us against the dark side. Yet we embraced it in secret, reveled in its power.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04079_.mp3: We were... discovered? Or did we act? I can no longer remember. But here is where we came... to hide, to grow. And here we fell.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04081_.mp3: Our temple... our tomb. Built far from our enemies. We revered power and threw off the teachings of our old masters.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04083_.mp3: It... we were not the first to fall to the dark side. But we... had more power than those before us. It... came from elsewhere...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04085_.mp3: Our oldest secret. Only... only we would know, we lords. Only we would know where our power came from...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04087_.mp3: [Failure] I cannot, human. It is a secret of so long ago... I no longer remember. You who bristle with the Force... you must find this place...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04089_.mp3: Or... have you? Or did you? Or... will you? Oh, so... many images...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04091_.mp3: I... see your dark heart, human. Dark as mine was, proud as mine was. You... you will find the old place... and you will regret it.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04093_.mp3: So much power... it is blinding. I...I remember so little...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04094_.mp3: I... see your heart, human Jedi. I see your power, your pride. You... you will find the old place, the dark place... and you will regret it.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04097_.mp3: [Failure] The Force no longer touches my mind, human. And... even if it did I, I no longer remember our secret. The Force bristles in you... you must find this place with it...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04100_.mp3: We... hid from the Jedi, but it was not they who destroyed us. Is it not... obvious what we did?
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04102_.mp3: We destroyed each other. We desired the secrets of each other, to increase our power... we battled until finally our fortress rained down on top of us.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04110_.mp3: And so here our old secret is buried and none of us hold it any more... is that not right? Our power fled. Oh, what became of us? Do... do the Sith still thrive? Did they ever return?
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04115_.mp3: So much... so much time has passed. And yet we have learned nothing... nothing...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04117_.mp3: Remain? Do I... remain? I... have regretted for so long... all that I have done.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04119_.mp3: My sword... I filled it with my pride. And it is... buried with me, now. A corpse as I am a corpse.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04121_.mp3: I am dead, as my faith... is dead. And I shall remain here... surrounded by blackness in death as in life...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04123_.mp3: Most of my brethren would desire... only to take what power I have left. Even if it would destroy them.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04125_.mp3: I wish my sword to be... taken away from here. I do not wish it to rot away as I have. I command this of you.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04127_.mp3: There are... three blades within my sarcophagus. Only one is truly my sword, but it has been so long... I do not remember which.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04129_.mp3: Find the sword that is mine and... place it on the statue. If it is truly mine, then it is yours.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04131_.mp3: Then you must... die. This is how it... must be.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04133_.mp3: I do remember one thing of my sword... listen to me carefully...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04135_.mp3: "I am that which grips the heart in fright, hearkens night and silences the light." It was... written of my sword long... long ago.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04137_.mp3: Go, then... find my sword and place it on the statue...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04140_.mp3: If... if you are wise, you will not keep it. In the end, it is what destroyed me...
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04143_.mp3: Then you shall not leave this place. I... have power, still. I can... still command!
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04146_.mp3: Of course you do. You... seek my power. Will it destroy you... as it did me?
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04149_.mp3: I... cannot allow you to leave. Not until you have... done what I will ask of you.
Male_Ghost_01.nm37aafree04153_.mp3: I... I do not remember. A map? Perhaps it is a map. But it has not been buried with me. All I have now is my sword.

Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm02000_.mp3: You hiring for the Republic or the Sith?
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm02002_.mp3: Then why are you wasting my time? There's big money to be made here - I can't risk missing a job offer 'cause I'm yapping with you!
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03000_.mp3: What are you doing in my room?
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03002_.mp3: I am too tired to enter a discussion with you tonight. You can speak to me tomorrow at the mercenary enclave if you wish.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03004_.mp3: Don't be a fool. Since the murder, there are security cameras all over the place. If you do anything to me, the Selkath will lock you up for the rest of your life.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03007_.mp3: Good - leave me to my privacy.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03009_.mp3: I won't talk to you with that Mandalorian thug around!
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03013_.mp3: Brave words - but only a coward hides behind layers of armor, Mandalorian! A true Echani needs only his training and warrior spirit for protection!
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03017_.mp3: You are fortunate the Selkath neutrality laws stay my hand, else you would pay for those comments with your tongue, Mandalorian!
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03021_.mp3: As long as this brutish oaf is with you, we have nothing to talk about.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03023_.mp3: Allow me to express my thanks. Though there has been no official statement from the Republic, I have learned you were the one responsible for discovering the fate of my fellow Echani.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03025_.mp3: The knowledge of their deaths saddens me, but now that their fate is known I can perform the appropriate funeral rites to honor our fallen.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03027_.mp3: Unlike the Mandalorians and Iridorians, we Echani remember those who have done us a service. Is there some small favor I may now do for you?
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03028_.mp3: Have you come here seeking refuge from the senseless atrocities of war, as I have?
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03030_.mp3: The Sith have recently destroyed a Jedi enclave on Dantooine - did you know? I heard they bombed the planet from afar, just as they did Taris.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03032_.mp3: It seems in battle the Sith are as ruthless as the Iridorians and as craven as the Mandalorians.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03033_.mp3: My skills are not for hire right now. Perhaps the Mandalorian thug or the Iridorian savage on the other side of the bar are seeking employment - they are less discriminating than we Echani.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03035_.mp3: I suppose I see no harm in that. Ask away.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03037_.mp3: I cannot help you there. I have heard she was one of the Sith... perhaps the answers you seek are inside the Sith Embassy.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03039_.mp3: Is there anything else I can do for you?
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03042_.mp3: Ruins? On Manaan? There is nothing on Manaan but water, and the recently built Ahto City.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03045_.mp3: Who'd be interested in those fish? I have no clue. Maybe Gonto over by the bar knows.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03049_.mp3: The Mandalorians call themselves warriors - but they cower behind their heavy battle armor, and arm themselves with brutish weapons of mass destruction that require no skill or training to use!
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03051_.mp3: As for the Iridonians, they are blood-thirsty demons. They kill for pleasure, and leave a wake of savage violence and gruesome death. They have no nobility, no understanding of true honor. They are animals.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03053_.mp3: We Echani, however, are true warriors. We do not cower behind layers of armor and our chosen weapons are implements of precision and skill. We know honor and nobility.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03056_.mp3: We Echani do hire our skills out, but the word mercenary has an unpleasant connotation for my people. We Echani are guided as much by honor as credits.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03058_.mp3: When the Republic called for aid to push back the Mandalorian aggression, we came without thought of reward. Against the Mandalore hordes we proved our worth.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03060_.mp3: The Republic knows we Echani are not as greedy as the Mandalorians, nor as blood thristy as the Iridorians. But recently their need for mercenaries on Manaan is so great they have been forced to hire whomever they can.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03062_.mp3: I do not know. The Republic has become very secretive as of late. I think they have something to hide. They hire my people, but will not say why - and those they hire do not return.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aaechm03064_.mp3: Perhaps they have left the planet. Perhaps they are dead. I cannot say - and none of the Republic soldiers are talking.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aagont05028_.mp3: So why are you wasting my time? Look - I'll give you a break. Every player needs their own Pazaak deck, and I just happen to have an extra one on me.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aagont05061_.mp3: You think I'm some kind of space scum, to sell myself off for a measly 100 credits! You got a real attitude problem, and it's gonna cost you.
Male_Iritated_01.nm26aagont05064_.mp3: But I think you just might be crazy enought that you don't care. Okay, I don't need no trouble, so here's the scoop..

Male_Iritating_02.nm02aenobl28000_.mp3: What? Why are you speaking to me? Can't you tell from my clothing that I'm of the nobility!
Male_Iritating_02.nm02aenobl28002_.mp3: Get away from me - I can't be seen talking with the common rabble. It wouldn't be proper for a man of my standing.
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07000_.mp3: How dare you invade my chambers! How rude! I am a personal guest of Davik himself! I left specific instructions that you guards were not to disturb me until morning!
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07002_.mp3: How can Davik expect me to invest in his ventures with this kind of incompetence on display? I should summon the other guards and report you to your commanding officer!
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07004_.mp3: [Success] Well, I suppose I can forgive the intrusion in this case. Tell Davik I admire a host who has his underlings check up on the well-being and comfort of his guests.
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07006_.mp3: I don't require anything right now - you can tell Davik everything about my stay has been most pleasing so far. Here's a five credit chip for your trouble, sirrah.
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07008_.mp3: Now scurry on back to Davik. If I find I have need of anything I'll buzz for you. Until then I expect you to respect my privacy.
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07010_.mp3: [Failure] That is no excuse for incompetence! I gave very specific orders that were not followed. I'm going to summon the guards and report you to your superiors!
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07012_.mp3: Don't work for Davik? Then what are you... oh blast! Assassins! Guards, save me!
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07015_.mp3: What? How dare you speak to me like that! I could ask Davik to have you flayed alive for such insolence!
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07017_.mp3: What? But... help! Assassins! Guards - help!
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07019_.mp3: You again? My instructions were not complicated. Give me one good reason why I shouldn't call the other guards and have your incompetence reported to the commanding officer!
Male_Iritating_02.nm08aadavg07021_.mp3: [Success] Well, if you think I'm going to tip you again you're sadly mistaken. Now leave me be.
Male_Iritating_02.nm26aarepa11000_.mp3: The Republic respects the peace of Ahto City, your honor. But the Sith are a violent people who leave violence in their wake. I have three soldiers in the infirmary!
Male_Iritating_02.nm26aarepa11004_.mp3: I hardly call six against three a fair fight! The Sith are cowards who attack only when they have the advantage of numbers!
Male_Iritating_02.nm26aarepa11008_.mp3: They were provoked, your honor! The Sith goaded them into this fight!
Male_Iritating_02.nm26aarepa11018_.mp3: Why can't the Selkath see what the Sith are really like? They should ban them all from this planet.
Male_Iritating_02.nm26aarepa11020_.mp3: If it weren't for the Republic, Manaan would already be under Sith control. But we haven't had one word of thanks from the Selkath!
Male_Iritating_02.nm26aarepa11022_.mp3: I'm sick of hearing about Manaan's neutrality! It sounds like a coward's excuse not to fight, if you ask me!

Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01000_.mp3: Welcome to Anchorhead, potential customer. Czerka Corporation stands ready to serve, after some formalities, of course.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01002_.mp3: First, your ship is not on our list of planned arrivals for today. There is a docking fee of 100 credits because of this.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01004_.mp3: The immediate benefit is access to these very docking facilites. This is the only port in Anchorhead.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01006_.mp3: Once you've paid we will offer trade services as well. We're not unreasonable, we just want to cover expenses.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01008_.mp3: I thought you would. Without these fees, Czerka Corporation would have closed this port years ago.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01010_.mp3: This will cover any future landings as well. It's like a registration, so we can serve you better when you return.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01012_.mp3: Now, as a customs officer, I can provide information on services. Is this visit business or pleasure?
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01014_.mp3: There isn't much to tell. It's a very old planet, well past its prime. Czerka Corporation is the only company with any interest in it.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01016_.mp3: It's not a very pretty world, but there is opportunity here if you know where to look.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01018_.mp3: I can't really get into that. It hasn't been a very smooth operation. I shouldn't get into it.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01020_.mp3: [Success] Ah, it's common knowledge, so there's no harm in telling you. It's a tale of bad business.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01022_.mp3: You see, Czerka Corporation staked their claim to this planet based on some very promising geological surveys.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01024_.mp3: Unfortunately, that information was incorrect, and possibly even an attempt at sabotage by a rival company.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01026_.mp3: Not totally barren. There were a few years of good mining, and limited operations are still in place.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01028_.mp3: But the ore is flawed. It has peculiar properties. They've had to look at other forms of business.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01030_.mp3: Czerka Corporation has really tried to hide this, but it just seems that Tatooine metal is unfit for effective manufacturing.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01032_.mp3: I would imagine that this outpost will eventually be abandoned. Nobody is making any money here.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01034_.mp3: Of course, this rock may have been settled a few times, so look for some other company to get stuck with it.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01036_.mp3: Pursuits that appeal to the casual traveler. There are some fearsome native species that provide exciting hunting.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01038_.mp3: There are also lengthy barren wastes that serve as fine swoop tracks. Attracting business has been slow, however.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01039_.mp3: [Failure] I'm sorry. It's not really a big secret, but my superiors don't like people talking about it.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01041_.mp3: [Success] I... I can tell you more, I guess. It's not a big secret or anything. Just not good business.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01044_.mp3: Very little. There are hints that it might once have been a lush world, but I can't picture it as anything but a desert.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01046_.mp3: Native sentient species have no records going back that far. That was hundreds of years ago. Maybe thousands.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01048_.mp3: Of course, the native species are not very willing to tell anyone anything. They're barely more than animals.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01050_.mp3: The Sand People. They're vicious, and attack outsiders on sight. More animal than anything, really.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01052_.mp3: Maybe they know the history of Tatooine, maybe they don't. Impossible to tell. They won't cooperate.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01054_.mp3: Not personally, but they've given Czerka Corporation a rough time. It's hard enough mining this rock without suffering random attacks.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01056_.mp3: I think the company has even put a bounty on them, but I'm sure not going to try for it.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01058_.mp3: But it is getting better. I think someone went out on the dunes and laid down the law. Heh. I'm sure Czerka Corporation paid them well.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01060_.mp3: The Jawas are scavengers and a bit primitive. Hard to understand. They have an affinity for Droids.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01062_.mp3: Some of our scientists believe that they may not be native to the planet, but how they got here they may not even know. As I said, they're hard to understand.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01064_.mp3: They usually end up slaves to the Sand People. They aren't fighters. Good traders, though.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01066_.mp3: The site is quite old. From the look of it, it's been settled before. Czerka Corporation claimed it only a few decades ago.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01068_.mp3: Some other corporation that went under, probably. Not a lot of records are kept about backwater places like this.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01072_.mp3: It depends on what level of risk you want to take. You could ask at the Czerka office if any bounties need collecting. That's in central Anchorhead.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01074_.mp3: While you're at the office, ask for a hunting license so you can sell trophies to Fazza in his lodge just north of them.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01076_.mp3: I suppose you could also take up swoop racing. Talk to the Hutt at the registration office by the track. That's in west Anchorhead.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01078_.mp3: I can't say I know which of these jobs is the most dangerous. I stay away from all of them.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01080_.mp3: That's not much information. Could you tell me more?
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01082_.mp3: Then you're on your own. Ask around Anchorhead. Someone may be able to help you.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01084_.mp3: I will answer as best I can. What will you need while on Tatooine?
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01086_.mp3: You a digger? I've heard of ruins being found now and then, but they've always been stripped by Sand People soon after.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01088_.mp3: You're not going to get anywhere with them. I guess you could ask around, but I doubt you'll learn anything different.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01091_.mp3: A Star Map? That's old holo-tech, isn't it? Not much reason to outfit this dry rock with tech like that.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01093_.mp3: You could ask around, but for something like that you'll probably have to go digging. I wouldn't know where to begin.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01095_.mp3: You could always ask a Jawa. It's hard to tell what they know.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01097_.mp3: There is no need for that. I'm just doing my job. You are free to move as you wish.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01099_.mp3: As you wish. If you need anything else, I'll be here.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01102_.mp3: I assure you that the fee is non-negotiable. We have a very thin margin of profit on this world.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01104_.mp3: [Success] That does make sense. I suppose I could let it go this time. We need the business.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01106_.mp3: [Failure] No, no, no. I'm sorry but we have to charge something. Maintenance is expensive out here.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01108_.mp3: [Success] You know... I don't think you need to pay the fee. We'll let it go, this time.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01111_.mp3: As you wish. Let's wrap this up as soon as possible.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01113_.mp3: I'm sorry. While Czerka Corporation would like to encourage interest in Tatooine, we must first deal with the docking fees.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01115_.mp3: Our operations here are very expensive. We must recoup basic costs somehow.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01117_.mp3: Then I'm afraid you won't be visiting Anchorhead. Czerka Corporation hopes you will be a customer in the future.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01119_.mp3: Guards! This ship is refused access. See that they don't disembark.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01122_.mp3: That would be unfortunate. Czerka Corporation can't afford to extend credit. Everyone pays. That's the rule.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01124_.mp3: We won't expell you, but you won't be allowed to leave this bay. You must pay if you wish to visit Anchorhead.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01126_.mp3: Czerka Corporation maintains this docking station at great expense. It is within our rights to refuse landing permission.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01128_.mp3: And I warn you, we've had troublemakers before. The bay is lined with autoguns. Violence is not a survivable option.
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01129_.mp3: Welcome back. Is there something I can do for you?
Male_Old_01.nm17ab01cu01130_.mp3: Hello again. Czerka Corporation remains willing to serve, but there is still the matter of the 100 credit docking fee...

Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02000_.mp3: You again? Oh no, you can just keep walking. I'm not dealing with you again.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02001_.mp3: Something you want? I don't have a lot of time for talk, so please make it quick.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02003_.mp3: Of course, I always have time for a pretty face... any face, really. What do you need?
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02005_.mp3: I repair the sandcrawlers when they return from the mines. They get pretty banged up, even without the attacks.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02007_.mp3: The Sand People attack them pretty regularly. Czerka Corporation is getting pretty sick of it, I hear.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02009_.mp3: They have offered bounties on Sand People for a while now, but few hunters take them up on it. Too dangerous.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02011_.mp3: Try at the Czerka offices right here. They'd know.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02014_.mp3: Oh, the big crawlers head out at dawn. That's so they avoid the bigger predators. The wraid, I mean.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02016_.mp3: Doesn't help avoid the Sand People though. They attack pretty regular, no matter what Czerka Corporation tries.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02018_.mp3: Have you? Not many hunters have tried in the past. Good luck to you, is all I can say. The Sand People are vicious.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02020_.mp3: I see the damage on the crawlers when they come back... if they come back.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02022_.mp3: I have no idea. I don't go out on the desert if I can help it. I'm sure the Sand People will find you if you walk far enough.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02024_.mp3: I guess they have been happening a lot less frequently lately. If you did have anything to do with that, thanks.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02026_.mp3: I hope Czerka paid you well for it. Whatever it was, it wouldn't have been enough for me.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02028_.mp3: Well, it's a hole in the galaxy, as far as I'm concerned. I doubt this outpost will last much longer.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02030_.mp3: But, that's happened before and will happen again. Anchorhead has been resettled a few times now.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02032_.mp3: Well, Tatooine fools people. It looks like it might have a good supply of resources, but it doesn't.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02034_.mp3: Before a company learns this, they've already set up communities to support operations they now can't afford.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02036_.mp3: Company pulls out, cities dry up, and after a few years, someone that doesn't know why it failed tries again.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02038_.mp3: No one is. I guess it looked like a promising mining planet, but the metal... I tell you, it just isn't right.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02040_.mp3: I've been a mechanic my whole life, and I've never seen anything corrode as fast as Tatooine metal.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02042_.mp3: It's why whoever was here before left, and why Czerka will leave, and why whoever comes next will leave.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02043_.mp3: Hey... aren't you a swoop-jock? I can't help with bike problems. I work with the heavy stuff.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02044_.mp3: Hmm? All right, but I'm not sure what I could say to interest you. I just work on the crawlers.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02046_.mp3: Uh, is there some kind of a problem? I'm just doing my job, I don't want any trouble from you.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02048_.mp3: Hey... why are you threatening me? I just repair the crawlers. It's not like I'm packing away the credits.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02052_.mp3: I don't need this. What are you trying to prove?
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02054_.mp3: [Success] What, is this a mugging or are you begging? Look, here's a few creds, now leave me alone.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02056_.mp3: [Failure] Look, you can just get lost, all right? I have to get the crawlers ready for the morning.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02058_.mp3: Don't need some crazy surge-slime threatening me. Got Sand People for that. Hmph!
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02060_.mp3: [Success] I suppose I do like you. Here's a few creds. Was there something else?
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02062_.mp3: What do you want? Credits? Here, take some! Just leave me alone. I've got work to do.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02065_.mp3: All right then. Back to work, I guess.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa05me02066_.mp3: Hello again? Is there something else you wanted? I really have to get back to work.
Male_Old_02.nm17aa11iz05130_.mp3: His small stature has nothing to do with it, droid.
Male_Old_02.nm17aaiziz99148_.mp3: That's the way - squeeze that little guy for every credit he's got!

Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03000_.mp3: Go on, take a walk. My mood is sour enough without you here.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03001_.mp3: Well now, what can Gandroff do for you? It's been a while since I've had anyone bother talking to me.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03003_.mp3: I saw you down by the track, didn't I? Or was that someone else? I've been distracted by what happened on Taris.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03004_.mp3: Usually it's some kid wondering what my old racing days were like... but that was back on Taris. Seems like a long time ago.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03006_.mp3: I'm not sure what I have that you would be interested in. I... I'm... I'm just an old swoop-jock that doesn't have the head for it anymore. Heh.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03008_.mp3: I... I am not used to such attention. Uh, what do you want me to repeat?
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03009_.mp3: Ahh, something I know. Well... well, something I used to know. Um, my racing days are behind me. Gandroff is the name.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03011_.mp3: Best place to race is wherever the track treats you sweet and your times are golden. It's that simple.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03013_.mp3: You get hung up on any one track and... and you'll end up like me. Heh heh. My favorite stop was Taris... Taris, yes... always looked forward to going back.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03015_.mp3: Now I don't want to touch my bike at all. Maybe I wasn't in the winner's circle lately, but I still raced for sport, you know? Vroom vroom.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03017_.mp3: Oh, I... I don't want to get into that, miss. Let's just say that there was always someone trackside rooting for me. Heh heh.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03019_.mp3: A woman. I never won on Taris, but it was always my first stop on the circuit, and the last if I could help it. Heh.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03021_.mp3: That doesn't matter now. You can't ask for more certain closure than the whole planet being gone. Poof. Boom. Heh. Gone.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03023_.mp3: Oh, well past my prime, by any measure. I started late, too. Not like the kids out there now. Some of them are too young. Hm.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03025_.mp3: It's a cutthroat business. I... I've seen some of them burn out after a year. They get dangerous, and don't live long.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03027_.mp3: That's not everyone, of course, but... but it happens. I'm a has-been, I'll admit, but... but dying while you're on top is still dying. I'll pass.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03029_.mp3: I don't really talk to any of them. I know Zoriis from the circuit and you couldn't ask for a tougher lady. Smart too.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03031_.mp3: I don't know the younger guys, but... but I've been watching Nico. Uh, good to see someone doing it for the love of the race.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03033_.mp3: I don't know, but some people just have something that lets the bike take them. It's like the air stops pushing back.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03035_.mp3: I think you know what I mean; when the wind decides to stop fighting? Hmm. You've felt it. I can tell by your times.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03036_.mp3: That's an old track tale, you know; when the wind decides to stop fighting? I used to have that. Heh... not any more.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03037_.mp3: I don't know the younger guys, but I suppose they're in good hands. What you did for Nico was good to see.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03038_.mp3: I don't know the younger guys, but after you pushed that deal on Nico, I doubt they'd trust me or anyone.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03043_.mp3: Ask me again in a few years and it will be me. Heh heh. I'm probably not going back out on the circuit... if there is one.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03045_.mp3: But, for now, I don't know any more than the next guy. You should try the locals. Jawas maybe. Funny little guys. Li'l jawa, li'l jawa.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03047_.mp3: Uh, keep safe. Yup. Yup. Seems like tough times are coming.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03048_.mp3: Sure, not a problem. Might as well try to pass along some of what I know. Heh heh. My racing days are pretty much done.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03050_.mp3: Uh, well, I wouldn't worry about that, not with your attitude. Go on then, ask away. I'm ready.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03052_.mp3: No need to get all confrontational. What are... what are we, Sand People? You wouldn't find much fight left in me, anyway.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03054_.mp3: Then race for it! By the Force, what do you think an old man like me would have? Bah, take it all.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03057_.mp3: Why bother? I mean, will this pay for ship maintenance or whatever? You're just looking for coward credits.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03059_.mp3: Bah, if it will get you to leave, just take what credits I have. Take em. Take em. Now leave me. I don't want anything to do with you.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03061_.mp3: Doesn't seem like it. I've seen your kind before. Does it make you feel big, pushing old men around? You're all the same. Heh.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03063_.mp3: Now, leave me to my drinking. I don't think we'd have much to talk about. Not if I can help it.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03064_.mp3: I hear you're pretty good on the track. Yeah. I remember my first paycheck for racing. Heh heh. So small you couldn't see it, but I remember.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03065_.mp3: Hello again. I hear you're pretty fast out on the track. Remember these days. Yes sir. Once they're gone, whoo, they're gone.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03066_.mp3: I heard about you setting a track record. Wish I'd seen it. Ah, it would've just made me want to be out there myself.
Male_Old_03.nm17af07ga03067_.mp3: Well, imagine you coming back. Heh heh. Something you want?

Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10000_.mp3: Carth! Carth Onasi, is that you?
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10002_.mp3: It *is* you, isn't it? I knew it when I laid eyes on you! You old spacedog, how have you been? I thought for sure you'd be fighting on some ship out there.
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10004_.mp3: Ha ha ha! That's pretty rich. I can't imagine what it would take to keep you on the ground.
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10005_.mp3: Must have something to do with your friend, here, hey? How's it going?
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10006_.mp3: Must have something to do with your pretty friend, here, hey? How do you do, miss?
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10008_.mp3: Oh, I apologize. You folks are probably busy, aren't you? I just wanted to catch up with Carth, that's all.
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10010_.mp3: Sure am. We joined the militia together back on Telos. That was a lot of years ago, of course.
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10013_.mp3: Yeah... it's a shame about home. Telos still hasn't recovered. The family and I moved on, and I'm working for Czerka now.
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10014_.mp3: I didn't see you after... er, what I mean is, my condolences on your wife. I heard what happened. At least your boy made it through alright.
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10016_.mp3: Yes, of course. I saw him not long ago here on Korriban, though he didn't recognize me. You... didn't know he was here?
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10017_.mp3: Yes, of course. I saw him at my last stop, on Korriban, though he didn't recognize me. You... didn't know he was there?
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10019_.mp3: Yeah. I'd recognize Dustil anywhere. Positive. He's, uh... he's joined the Sith, Carth...
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10021_.mp3: There's an academy for the Sith on Korriban. He's a student there. I saw him suited up in their outfit and everything. Sorry... I thought you knew.
Male_Old_04.nm35aajord10023_.mp3: Sure, no problem. Good to see you again, Carth. Hope everything works out with Dustil.

Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25000_.mp3: False prophet! Deceiver! You have betrayed me! You have sold the hope of the entire village to the selfish and damnable Igear!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25002_.mp3: All I have worked for is destroyed! All the hopes and dreams of my father and grandfather before him turned to dust! Begone, up-worlder - I have only curses to speak at you!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25004_.mp3: You return, up-worlder. Are you ready to learn what you must learn? Are you ready to learn of the Promised Land?
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25006_.mp3: You return, up-worlder. Are you ready now to learn what you must learn? Are you ready to hear the history of my people?
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25007_.mp3: Welcome back, up-worlder. How goes your quest? Have you found the journals of my father and grandfather?
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25009_.mp3: Can it be true? Is it possible that at long last the dream of my father and grandfather before him will be fulfilled? I... I can hardly bear to look.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25011_.mp3: Hmmm... yes. Yes! Of course! Now I understand - it all makes sense! Now I see why the Promised Land has been so hard to find! It is so obvious!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25013_.mp3: You have done a great thing, up-worlder - a selfless act that will bring great joy to all the people of this village! I must take this to Gendar right away!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25017_.mp3: You may not think these are fables after you see what I have brought you, Gendar! Look at these journals!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25021_.mp3: I swear to you everything in these journals is true, Gendar. The Promised Land - I told you I would find it!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25025_.mp3: I do not deny the journey will be hard, Gendar. But surely it is better than the miserable life we have here!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25029_.mp3: Thank you once again, up-worlder. I will say a final goodbye, for where we are going I fear you cannot come. The journey to the Promised Land is long and arduous.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25031_.mp3: We must part ways here, up-worlder. I sense your destiny is yet to be chosen, but the destiny of my people is at the end of the long journey ahead of us.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25034_.mp3: No, up-worlder, I cannot ask that. The journey will take many, many weeks. And those who make the journey cannot return - that was the final secret of the Promised Land.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25036_.mp3: When the colony was created it was designed so that people could enter willingly, but they could never leave again. This was to ensure secrecy on the project.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25040_.mp3: Yes, up-worlder... well done. However, I see that this journal alone does not have enough clues for me to solve this mystery. Too many pieces are still missing.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25042_.mp3: I'm afraid that only with all three journals - my grandfather's, my father's and my apprentice's - will I be able to discover the location of the Promised Land.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25044_.mp3: I will leave this journal with you for safe keeping for now. Perhaps it will aid you in your search for the others. I wish you luck, up-worlder - for the sake of the entire village.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25047_.mp3: You - you come from the world above! Is this the time of destiny, then? Is this a portent of the salvation of my people? Or merely another false sign to mislead us from the path?
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25049_.mp3: Are you the herald of prophecy? The beacon to guide us through the darkness? Or are you merely another harbinger of shattered dreams and unfulfilled promises?
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25057_.mp3: Speak to me, up-worlder! Tell me what fate you unleash upon us - salvation or damnation! Speak, up-worlder - I beg you!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25059_.mp3: A question. You are uncertain. Bewildered. Perplexed. Understandable, I suppose. Even after a hundred years of life I myself still become confused at times.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25063_.mp3: Old, yes. But not insane. Oh no, not insane at all! I am as rational as any man can be after a hundred years in the filth and darkness of the Undercity!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25065_.mp3: Perhaps I can make things more clear. Some things, at least. My name is Rukil, the oldest Outcast here in the village. Rukil Wrinkle-Skin, the children call me sometimes.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25067_.mp3: Once I was honored for my wisdom, but over time the villagers fell away from the true path. Eventually there was only a single apprentice who followed me - and now she is gone, too.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25069_.mp3: No, no, no. Not yet. I must be wary. Careful. You may be a false savior. Dare I share my secrets with you? No... not until you prove yourself.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25072_.mp3: My apprentice is... lost. I sent her out into the Undercity to find... well, I cannot tell you. Not yet. Sadly, my apprentice has not returned.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25074_.mp3: Please, up-worlder - will you help an old man? Will you seek out my apprentice in the Undercity? Her name is Malya. I must know of her fate, whatever it may be. I must know what she... found.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25076_.mp3: Finding her may be difficult; Malya could be anywhere in the Undercity... but if you find her I will know you to be our true savior! Only then can I reveal my secret knowledge to you.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25078_.mp3: I wish you luck, up-worlder. Come speak to me again once you have discovered the fate of my apprentice.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25081_.mp3: Then... perhaps you are not the one I have been waiting for. Should you change your mind, up-worlder, speak with me again. Come to me if you learn the fate of my apprentice.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25086_.mp3: Please, a moment up-worlder. I must know if you are the one I have been waiting for. Please, I beg for your help.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25089_.mp3: Greetings once more, up-worlder. Do you bring news of my apprentice? Have you discovered her fate, and proved yourself to be a true savior of my people?
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25091_.mp3: It is as I feared, then. She joins the list of those who have given their lives in the service of our cause. But though I am saddened by this news, there is yet hope.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25093_.mp3: By finding my apprentice you have proved yourself worthy, up-worlder. You are to be the beacon on our path to salvation. You will guide us to the Promised Land!
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25097_.mp3: You are marked, up-worlder - even my dim old eyes can see the mantle of destiny that cloaks you. Perhaps old Rukil knows you better than you know yourself.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25099_.mp3: I am old - I have lived a hundred years in the Undercity, cast down into the darkness. I know the legends and history of our people - and now you must learn it, too.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25101_.mp3: The great city of Taris covers the entire surface of this planet. There is no land to grow food. Kelp harvests and the creatures of the sea are our only food source.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25103_.mp3: A century ago rising levels of toxic pollution poisoned the oceans and famine swept the planet. The rich hoarded food for their own use, and the poor were left to starve and die.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25105_.mp3: But the poor rose up against this tyranny and civil war engulfed the planet. Millions died in the fighting and huge sections of Taris were destroyed or abandoned.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25107_.mp3: The rebellion was crushed in the end, thousands were taken prisoner. The jails could not hold them all, and so the practice of banishing all prisoners to the Undercity was born.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25109_.mp3: Many brave men and women were banished here to the Undercity for their part in the rebellion. People like my father and grandfather were cast down, along with their families.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25113_.mp3: Now we live a dark existence beneath the streets of Taris, a life devoid of all hope but one: the Promised Land. And you will be the one to show us the way to get there.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25115_.mp3: Legends tell of a self-sufficient colony founded just before the famine and lost during the civil war; a paradise beneath the Undercity where droid servants tend to every need.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25117_.mp3: For many years I searched for the Promised Land, just as my grandfather and father did before me. When I became old and gray my apprentice continued the search on my behalf.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25119_.mp3: I have collected many clues hinting at its location; the journal of my apprentice provides yet more information. But still there are too many pieces missing from this puzzle.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25121_.mp3: But I know my father and grandfather each had journals where they recorded their own discoveries. Perhaps with their journals I could at last uncover its hidden location.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25124_.mp3: I have nothing to offer if you help me in this. I hope the knowledge that you are helping the entire village escape a life of darkness and suffering is reward enough.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25126_.mp3: It is many decades since my father set out on his journey, but I remember he was eager to explore the sewers. You might want to begin your search there.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25128_.mp3: I wish you luck in your quest, up-worlder. The future survival of this village - of my people - depends on you.
Male_Old_05.nm04aaruki25132_.mp3: Please, up-worlder - I am too old to search for the missing journals myself, and the other villagers think the Promised Land is nothing but a myth.
