Mission.nglobelena12012_.mp3: You liar! Griff told me you didn't want his little sister tagging along - that's why he had to leave me behind!
Mission.nglobelena12018_.mp3: No - you're the one who's lying! Griff wouldn't... he wouldn't try to leave me behind!
Mission.nglobelena12032_.mp3: Griff's better off without you anyway, you table-dancing, brother-stealing home wrecker!
Mission.nglobelena12040_.mp3: But Griff is my brother! I can't just pretend he doesn't exist! If he was here to defend himself Lena wouldn't be saying all this bad stuff about him!
Mission.nglobemiss13000_.mp3: Huh? Oh... sorry. I was thinking about Taris. I still can't believe it's gone! I mean, I grew up there and now it's... it's... it's just gone!
Mission.nglobemiss13002_.mp3: Yeah... I know. The Jedi got rid of Revan, so I figure Malak's days are numbered, too. But that doesn't make the pain go away, you know?
Mission.nglobemiss13004_.mp3: I don't really think there's anything you can say. I just have to find some way to deal with it, I guess. It'll take some time.
Mission.nglobemiss13006_.mp3: What? How can you be so cruel! Millions of people dead and you all you can say is 'get over it'?
Mission.nglobemiss13007_.mp3: Look, I'm not saying I can't go on or anything like that. It's just... it's a shock, you know? I mean, I knew the Sith were evil and all, but the reality of it kind of slaps you in the face.
Mission.nglobemiss13008_.mp3: But I suppose that's why we need to stop Malak, right? The more time I spend dwelling on Taris the more chance some other planet will get wiped out. I guess that's what it comes down to.
Mission.nglobemiss13009_.mp3: So don't worry about me; I'll be okay. And if you need my help against Malak or the Sith, I'll be there for you!
Mission.nglobemiss13010_.mp3: Hey, there. What can I do for you?
Mission.nglobemiss13012_.mp3: Taris is a pretty good place to grow up, all things considered. Just stick to the area you belong in and stay out of Davik's business and you'll be fine.
Mission.nglobemiss13014_.mp3: The Upper City's got some nice shops and all, but it's boring! The only time I go up there is if I need free healing from Zelka at his medical facility.
Mission.nglobemiss13016_.mp3: What can I say? The Lower City was a great place to hang out until the Vulkars started that gang war. Now you can't even walk the streets without getting shot at!
Mission.nglobemiss13018_.mp3: It can be pretty nasty down there: you've got rakghouls crawling around looking for their next meal, and the Gamorrean slavers like to set up their bases in the sewers.
Mission.nglobemiss13019_.mp3: And then there's the Outcast village - a collection of people banished to the Undercity for their crimes. I mostly avoid the village, though; it's pretty depressing seeing how they live.
Mission.nglobemiss13021_.mp3: I tend to keep my nose out of an intergalactic crime lord's business, you know? I can't tell you much that isn't common knowledge.
Mission.nglobemiss13022_.mp3: Extortion, slavery, smuggling: Davik's got a piece of all the action here on Taris. Even the swoop gangs know better than to get in his way.
Mission.nglobemiss13024_.mp3: Hey, no problem. I'm here to help, right?
Mission.nglobemiss13025_.mp3: I'm not the one you should ask about Dantooine. I didn't even know there was a Jedi Academy here; I always thought it was just a bunch of settlers and farmers!
Mission.nglobemiss13026_.mp3: Sorry I can't be more help, you know? Is there anything else I can do for you?
Mission.nglobemiss13027_.mp3: Well, I know Zaalbar's from Kashyyyk, but he never liked to talk about it. He wouldn't even tell me why he left. I don't think the Wookiees like outsiders much.
Mission.nglobemiss13028_.mp3: I don't know anything about Korriban, but I get a bad feeling in this place. If there's such a thing as an 'evil' planet, this is it!
Mission.nglobemiss13029_.mp3: I always heard Tatooine was nothing but a rock covered by a bunch of worthless sand. I can't even figure out why Czerka Corp. set up their mining operations here.
Mission.nglobemiss13030_.mp3: Manaan's the source for all the kolto in the galaxy; that's why those fish-faced Selkath can stay neutral in this whole Sith-Republic war. But I don't know much else about this place.
Mission.nglobemiss13031_.mp3: How am I supposed to know anything about this planet? It's an uncharted world in an unexplored quadrant! I didn't even know this planet was here!
Mission.nglobemiss13032_.mp3: Didn't you come here back when you were the Dark Lord? If you don't remember anything about this place then I guess we're just stumbling in the dark.
Mission.nglobemiss13034_.mp3: Want to practice your skills, eh? Sure - I'll play you a few hands. Just for practice, though. I don't want to bet with you.
Mission.nglobemiss13036_.mp3: No problem. Just so happens I've got one here I've been working on. Here you go... I'll just add it to our inventory.
Mission.nglobemiss13038_.mp3: Sorry, I don't have one handy right now. Besides, we've got plenty of security spikes already. Not much point in overloading on them, is there?
Mission.nglobemiss13040_.mp3: Really? You want to know about me? Nobody's ever really been interested in me before. What did you want to know?
Mission.nglobemiss13043_.mp3: Big Z's my family, you know? My parents... well, I guess they're dead. It was just me on my own until the day I saw Zaalbar in the Lower City. I could tell right away he was in trouble.
Mission.nglobemiss13044_.mp3: This was before the gang wars were out of hand, but even then the Vulkars were scum. A few of them were hassling Big Z, trying to pick a fight - but he wasn't looking for trouble.
Mission.nglobemiss13046_.mp3: Hey, nobody said the Vulkars was smart. But there were three of them, so maybe they figured they could handle him. I don't know.
Mission.nglobemiss13048_.mp3: Anyway, I don't like Vulkars at the best of times. And when I saw them picking on this poor Wookiee - all alone on a strange planet, overwhelmed by the big city - I just lost it.
Mission.nglobemiss13049_.mp3: I screamed out 'Leave him alone, you core-slimes!' and charged right at them. One of them saw me coming and slapped me so hard he just about knocked me cold.
Mission.nglobemiss13051_.mp3: Hey, I don't need a lecture from you. You ain't my mother! I knew what I was doing.
Mission.nglobemiss13053_.mp3: Hey - don't treat me like I'm a little girl! I ain't no kid - I'm fourteen years old!
Mission.nglobemiss13054_.mp3: Those Vulkars didn't scare me. They're nothing but cowards. I knew how to deal with them. Of course, I never got the chance.
Mission.nglobemiss13055_.mp3: I guess Zaalbar didn't like seeing me get smacked around. He let out this howl and yanked that Vulkar a meter up off the ground and held him there by his throat.
Mission.nglobemiss13057_.mp3: The other two screamed and ran off. Can't say I blame them. The first time you see an angry Wookiee up close it isn't a pretty sight.
Mission.nglobemiss13058_.mp3: I thought Zaalbar was going to rip that punk's arms off and beat him to death with his own fists. The Vulkar was so scared he fainted. Or maybe Big Z's breath just knocked him out.
Mission.nglobemiss13060_.mp3: Sorry Zaalbar, but I keep telling you to brush those choppers once in a while. Why do you think I won't stand downwind when you're talking?
Mission.nglobemiss13061_.mp3: I keep telling Zaalbar to brush those choppers of his, but he never listens. Just stay upwind when he's speaking and you'll be fine.
Mission.nglobemiss13062_.mp3: Anyway, I knew those Vulkars would be back with friends, so I grabbed Zaalbar and we took off. Ever since then we've been a team. We look out for each other, you know?
Mission.nglobemiss13064_.mp3: He was fleeing some kind of trouble back on Kashyyyk. That's all I know, really. Big Z doesn't like to talk about it. In case you didn't notice he's the strong, silent type.
Mission.nglobemiss13065_.mp3: Doesn't much matter to me, though. I accept him for what he is, not what he was. Me and Zaalbar like to live in the present.
Mission.nglobemiss13067_.mp3: What's that supposed to mean? You think I can't take care of myself? I've got street smarts! I know how to get by on my own!
Mission.nglobemiss13068_.mp3: In fact, I look out for Zaalbar more than he looks out for me, you know? Big Z's a little bit too gullible to make it alone on the mean streets of the Lower City.
Mission.nglobemiss13070_.mp3: Yeah, I suppose you're right. Like I used to tell my brother, fast talk and slick words don't get the job done.
Mission.nglobemiss13072_.mp3: Are you kidding? Big Z ain't like that! He's just a big old softie inside. Of course, the Vulkars didn't know that.
Mission.nglobemiss13075_.mp3: Fine - I won't tell how Zaalbar and I hooked up. Sheesh! First you ask about it, then you say you don't want to hear it! You're as bad as my brother used to be!
Mission.nglobemiss13077_.mp3: My brother's a touchy subject, you know? It just so happens I don't really feel like talking about him right now. Nothing personal. Let's just get back to the business at hand, okay?
Mission.nglobemiss13080_.mp3: Shouldn't we be more worried about getting Zaalbar back from those Wookiees? I don't trust that Chuundar character.
Mission.nglobemiss13081_.mp3: I... I was a little snappish when we last talked. I'm sorry about that. I get a little touchy when it comes to Griff. It's kind of embarassing telling people about him.
Mission.nglobemiss13083_.mp3: It's complicated. Griff wasn't the most popular guy, he had his faults. But I still loved him, you know? Sometimes people don't understand.
Mission.nglobemiss13084_.mp3: I never knew my parents, my brother always looked out for me. He's the one who brought me to Taris. I was just a kid, only five. But I remember the trip - if you could call it that.
Mission.nglobemiss13085_.mp3: We were stuffed inside a packing crate in a star freighter's cargo hold with just enough food and water to make the trip. Not exactly first class, you know?
Mission.nglobemiss13087_.mp3: I don't know the whole story - I was pretty young. But my brother owed a lot of money. Might even have been a few arrest warrants out for him, I don't know.
Mission.nglobemiss13088_.mp3: The only way to get off the planet was to smuggle ourselves out. I mean, I don't want to make it sound like we were criminals... well, maybe my brother was.
Mission.nglobemiss13089_.mp3: See, this is why I don't like to talk about it. It makes Griff sound worse than he really was. My brother had his problems, but he always looked out for me.
Mission.nglobemiss13091_.mp3: Yeah - that's what I'm trying to say! Without my brother I don't know where I'd be.
Mission.nglobemiss13093_.mp3: He gambled. And drank. And he was always borrowing money for his latest get rich quick scheme. But he had a good heart, you know? He taught me how to survive.
Mission.nglobemiss13094_.mp3: He showed me how to slice into a computer's security system; how to get inside a locked building without the entrance codes, and how to spot a wealthy mark for a quick shell game.
Mission.nglobemiss13096_.mp3: Hey, you don't know what it's like! You need those skills here in the Lower City. Griff did right by me.
Mission.nglobemiss13097_.mp3: I really miss him since he left. I keep hoping he'll come back some day. He promised me he would.
Mission.nglobemiss13099_.mp3: He fell in with a bad crowd. It's all Lena's fault. She's the one who took him from me! Just batted those long lashes at him and off he went!
Mission.nglobemiss13101_.mp3: I don't want to talk about Griff and Lena - just the thought of that space tramp makes my blood boil! Subject's closed as far as I'm concerned!
Mission.nglobemiss13102_.mp3: If I'm going to be any help to you I can't be worrying about my brother running off with some intergalactic skank! So, is there something else you need?
Mission.nglobemiss13105_.mp3: Mission - mission: is that supposed to be a joke? Like I've only heard that about a million times in my life! Okay, I can take a hint. You don't want to hear anymore. That's just fine.
Mission.nglobemiss13107_.mp3: Why do you got to go putting my brother down like that? That's just mean! Besides, it wasn't his idea to leave!
Mission.nglobemiss13109_.mp3: Yeah, Griff did right by me.
Mission.nglobemiss13112_.mp3: Oh... yeah. I understand. We've got bigger bantha to hunt, right? I just miss Griff, is all. I keep thinking things might have been different, you know?
Mission.nglobemiss13114_.mp3: No, I want to tell you. Zaalbar's a great listener but it might be nice to talk about this with someone who doesn't reply in growls and grunts.
Mission.nglobemiss13116_.mp3: Right, sure. I understand. We've got all this other stuff going on what with the Sith and all. You're busy. No problem. Maybe later we can talk. When you have more time, you know?
Mission.nglobemiss13117_.mp3: I'm not really in the mood to talk about my brother right now. Maybe we should just stay focused on the job at hand, you know?
Mission.nglobemiss13118_.mp3: So, is there anything else you need?
Mission.nglobemiss13119_.mp3: I'm sorry for the way I acted before. It's just that when it comes to Lena I tend to get a little worked up.
Mission.nglobemiss13121_.mp3: My brother and me had a good thing going. Sure, Griff had his run-ins with the law on Taris. But we got by okay. Until Lena came and ruined everything.
Mission.nglobemiss13122_.mp3: She was a dancer at the cantina where my brother used to go to play Pazaak. Griff could be a real smooth talker, and it wasn't long before the two of them were dating.
Mission.nglobemiss13123_.mp3: But Lena was used to dating rich Tarisian nobles - guys with mountains of credits. Griff could never give her the kind of lifestyle she was used to, no matter how hard he worked.
Mission.nglobemiss13125_.mp3: I'm not going to pretend Griff wasn't a hustler and a con-artist, but that doesn't mean you can just insult him! He did what he did to look out for me!
Mission.nglobemiss13126_.mp3: I thought Lena would brush Griff off when she saw how poor he was, but for some reason she stuck around. I guess she saw the potential for a big payday down the road.
Mission.nglobemiss13128_.mp3: I saw Lena for what she really was - a busty, credit-grubbing cantina rat! She used Griff and took away the only family I had!
Mission.nglobemiss13129_.mp3: After they'd been together for a few months, Griff told me he was leaving Taris. He and Lena were going to try and make their fortune off-world.
Mission.nglobemiss13130_.mp3: He promised as soon as he made enough credits he'd come back and get me and we'd all live like royalty. That was two years ago - I haven't seen him since! I don't even know where he went!
Mission.nglobemiss13133_.mp3: Oh, I know what happened! As soon as she got him off Taris Lena sunk her claws into Griff but good! She twisted him around her little finger and made him forget all about me!
Mission.nglobemiss13134_.mp3: I know I'll probably never see Griff again. But part of the reason I came with you was the hope that I could find out what happened to my brother.
Mission.nglobemiss13135_.mp3: Don't worry - I won't let my search for Griff get in the way of what we're doing. Let's just get back to the task at hand. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Mission.nglobemiss13142_.mp3: Don't tell me you believe Lena's lies? Griff might be working as a miner on Tatooine, but the rest of her story is bantha poo-doo! You can't trust someone like her.
Mission.nglobemiss13143_.mp3: At least Griff's free of her clutches. I'd like to go speak to the Czerka Corp rep on Tatooine, if we have time. Maybe I can arrange to see my brother again.
Mission.nglobemiss13145_.mp3: I just hope he's not in any kind of trouble when we do.
Mission.nglobemiss13147_.mp3: Sure, I understand. Saving the galaxy and all. All I'm saying is if we get time to make a quick sidetrip to Tatooine... look, just think about it, okay?
Mission.nglobemiss13148_.mp3: I've been thinking about Lena and what she said about Griff. You know, how he was always blaming other people for his problems. There might be something to what she said.
Mission.nglobemiss13150_.mp3: No, of course not. Not really. But what if... what if it was his idea to leave me behind? I'm not saying Griff would just abandon me.
Mission.nglobemiss13151_.mp3: But maybe... maybe he did want to leave me behind. Just temporarily, you know? He might have done that, if he planned on coming back later.
Mission.nglobemiss13152_.mp3: But things didn't usually work out for Griff the way he planned, you know? And that's when he'd get in trouble. He was always borrowing money he could never pay back.
Mission.nglobemiss13153_.mp3: He might have been trying to skip out on his debts when he left Taris. He would have had to leave his little sister behind so it would look like he was coming back.
Mission.nglobemiss13155_.mp3: Yeah... well, no. Not exactly. Look, all I'm trying to say is that the more I think back the more I realize I might be idolizing my brother a bit. Not seeing all his faults.
Mission.nglobemiss13156_.mp3: I still want to find him. I need to see him again. It's just that I'm not sure how I'll react when I do.
Mission.nglobemiss13158_.mp3: Maybe. We'll see. I don't... I don't want to judge him yet. Maybe Lena was lying. Or maybe... maybe she wasn't.
Mission.nglobemiss13159_.mp3: All I know is I'd like to speak to Griff myself. If we have time, I'd like to go talk to the Czerka Corp rep on Tatooine and see what he has to say about where my brother is now.
Mission.nglobemiss13163_.mp3: Talk? What is there to talk about? Those sandpeople took my brother prisoner!
Mission.nglobemiss13164_.mp3: Griff may be a slime but we have to go rescue him! We can't just leave him with those... those... those monsters!
Mission.nglobemiss13166_.mp3: I knew I could count on you! There's definite fringe benefits to being friends with a Jedi!
Mission.nglobemiss13168_.mp3: You heard the Czerka rep: the sandpeople sometimes take prisoners. Say what you want about Griff, but he's a survivor. I know he's still alive.
Mission.nglobemiss13170_.mp3: I know you're out to save the galaxy and all. But you can't just turn your back on someone who needs your help - you're a Jedi, not a Sith!
Mission.nglobemiss13171_.mp3: I can't make you go after my brother, but you're the only one who can save him. Just think about it, that's all I ask. In the end I know you'll do the right thing.
Mission.nglobemiss13172_.mp3: Look, I'm happy Griff's alive but I'm mad at him right now. And I don't know what kind of job he's got for you, but I don't trust him. It's probably just another scam!
Mission.nglobemiss13173_.mp3: I'm worried about Griff and his latest plan. I've got a bad feeling about it. He doesn't know anything about brewing Tarisian ale.
Mission.nglobemiss13174_.mp3: And now he's gotten himself mixed up with the Exchange. Sometimes Griff can be so stupid! Part of me just wants to let him get what's coming to him.
Mission.nglobemiss13176_.mp3: Why not? He turned his back on me! He abandoned me on Taris, so maybe I should just leave him high and dry now!
Mission.nglobemiss13178_.mp3: Maybe a couple broken knee-caps will do him some good! Maybe that's the kind of jolt he needs to turn his life around! Only... what if they do something worse?
Mission.nglobemiss13179_.mp3: They might kill him! I don't want him to die; he doesn't deserve that. But I can't just keep supporting his crazy schemes. Someone has to teach him a lesson!
Mission.nglobemiss13181_.mp3: Yeah, I guess you're right. I'm not going to change him. Griff is going to keep on being Griff.
Mission.nglobemiss13182_.mp3: Maybe if we get these tach glands for him things will work out. Or maybe he'll finally see the light and turn over a new leaf. I know it's not likely, but it's all I have to hope for.
Mission.nglobemiss13185_.mp3: You're right! Griff may be my brother, but he deserted me on Taris. As far as I'm concerned that pretty much breaks any bond we had!
Mission.nglobemiss13186_.mp3: I'm not going to worry about Griff anymore. Like you said, he brought this on himself! Besides, he's always treated me like garbage. Now it's payback time!
Mission.nglobemiss13188_.mp3: Hey, if you want to help him with this Tarisian ale scheme that's your business. I'm washing my hands of the whole thing.
Mission.nglobemiss13189_.mp3: I appreciate everything you've done for Griff. You know that, right? I just hope things work out for him this time around.
Mission.nglobemiss13190_.mp3: I guess we'll find out when he meets up with us at the Czerka Corp shop. If he's got those credtis he promised you then maybe there's hope for him yet.
Mission.nglobemiss13191_.mp3: I want to thank you for helping me with Griff. You... you did everything you could for my brother. More than most people would have.
Mission.nglobemiss13192_.mp3: I know it might look like it didn't make any difference in the end... Griff's in debt and on the run like usual. But at least I know we tried to help him.
Mission.nglobemiss13194_.mp3: I know people can change no matter how bad they were. But I'm not holding my breath. None of us is perfect, but I've come to realize that Griff is a little less perfect than most.
Mission.nglobemiss13196_.mp3: Don't worry, I see all Griff's faults plainly now. None of us is perfect, but I realize he's a little less perfect than most.
Mission.nglobemiss13199_.mp3: I can't say I blame you. But I'll be honest... I doubt you'll ever see Griff again. I don't even know if I'll ever see him again. Like all good con men he knows how to disappear.
Mission.nglobemiss13200_.mp3: My brother is what he is, but I've learned to deal with that. I'll never forget that he looked after me when I was just a kid, but I don't feel like I owe him anything anymore.
Mission.nglobemiss13202_.mp3: I've made my peace with Griff and what he means to me. If he ever shows up again I'll deal with him, but I'm not going to dwell on my brother anymore. It's time to move forward!
Mission.nglobemiss13208_.mp3: Umm... are you sure you want to ask me about that?
Mission.nglobemiss13300_.mp3: *whisper* Well, that was easy. I sure wish I had special mind-affecting Force powers.
Mission.nglobemiss13301_.mp3: *whisper* I can be pretty convincing when I have to be, but that mind trick is something else![R1]
Mission.nglobemiss13302_.mp3: Hey, why'd you have to do that? That was just mean!
Mission.nglobemiss13303_.mp3: You know what? Sometimes you're nothing but a bully!
Mission.nglobemiss13304_.mp3: I know you're supposed to save the galaxy and all, but could you try being less of a scummy core slime while you're doing it?
Mission.nm02abgort09015_.mp3: Yeah! You tell him, Big Z!
Mission.nm02abgort09024_.mp3: Do we have to stand here and listen to this space-slug? He's starting to get on my nerves, you know?
Mission.nm02abgort09049_.mp3: What a rail-slug! Give Big Z five minutes alone with that guy and he'd straighten him out... or maybe twist him like a Tarisian Zella nut.
Mission.nm02abgort09056_.mp3: Hmph! You may think it's okay to joke about killing aliens to string Gorton along, but I don't think that kind of thing is funny at all!
Mission.nm02abithb10010_.mp3: Hey! You aren't going to just let them keep hurting him, are ya?
Mission.nm02abithb10016_.mp3: You want me to come over their and kick your little butts?! That's it... now you're in for it!!
Mission.nm02aenikl28040_.mp3: Geez, what sore loser! I haven't seen this much whining since I gave Zaalbar that bath!
Mission.nm03aakand01024_.mp3: Brejik stole that engine from Gadon! It was never yours to begin with!
Mission.nm03aakand01031_.mp3: What? You can't betray Gadon! I won't let you!
Mission.nm03aakand01033_.mp3: No, that's not true! You're lying!
Mission.nm03aakand01035_.mp3: They... they said I was too young!
Mission.nm03aakand01037_.mp3: Well, yeah. Some of them were. But you Vulkars have tried to kill me more than once!
Mission.nm03aakand01041_.mp3: You're right! I don't need anyone but Zaalbar! If Gadon dies, he's only getting what's coming to him!
Mission.nm03aehold13002_.mp3: Ugh - what a pig! He even makes Gamorreans look classy.
Mission.nm03aehold13018_.mp3: Yeah, sure. You were as innocent as a Jawa in a droid chop shop!
Mission.nm03aemiss14000_.mp3: I told you to leave me alone - so give me some space, Bug-eye! Your breath smells like bantha poodoo!
Mission.nm03aemiss14004_.mp3: Who you calling a little girl, Chuba-face?
Mission.nm03aemiss14008_.mp3: Just a sec, boys. Zaalbar... a little help here? I need you to rip the legs off some insects.
Mission.nm03aemiss14012_.mp3: Quit complaining... you can finish eating later. Besides, you need the exercise so get over here.
Mission.nm03aemiss14016_.mp3: You got a problem with me, then you got a problem with Big Z. So unless you want to take on my furry friend, I suggest you greenies hop on out of here.
Mission.nm03aemiss14020_.mp3: Say, I don't recognize you and I know pretty much everyone in the Lower City. You must be new down here. I guess that makes me and Big Z your official welcoming committee!
Mission.nm03aemiss14022_.mp3: It's not that strange. Most aliens can speak Basic, they just prefer to use their own language. But I grew up here on Taris so I just sort of got used to speaking the native tongue.
Mission.nm03aemiss14024_.mp3: My name's Mission Vao and this big Wookiee is my best friend, Zaalbar. I'd offer to give you a tour, but the streets down here aren't safe. But if there's anything else you need...
Mission.nm03aemiss14026_.mp3: The Black Vulkar base? You'll never get in there - they attack on sight. But if you got a problem with the Vulkars, you should go speak to the Hidden Beks.
Mission.nm03aemiss14028_.mp3: Their base is open to anyone - I hang out there all the time. Gadon, the leader of the Hidden Beks, is a pretty good guy. He'll probably be able to help you out.
Mission.nm03aemiss14030_.mp3: Yeah, we should be going now, too. Come on, Zaalber. This dive is boring. Maybe we can find some action in the Undercity.
Mission.nm03aemiss14033_.mp3: Well, you came to the right person! If you want info on Lower Taris I'm the one to talk to! Davik, the Lower City gangs... I've even got the scoop on that bounty hunter Calo Nord!
Mission.nm03aemiss14035_.mp3: We just kind of fell in together. It ain't easy on your own here in the Lower City - everyone's always looking to push you around.
Mission.nm03aemiss14039_.mp3: When I met up with Zaalbar it seemed like a good match. I knew we could look out for each other. With my street smarts and his muscle, we make a great team.
Mission.nm03aemiss14041_.mp3: Davik's part of the intergalactic crime syndicate, but I guess everyone knows that. But I hear he's got a new ship for his smuggling operations - the Ebon Hawk.
Mission.nm03aemiss14043_.mp3: I don't know much about space travel, but I hear that ship's fast enough to break the Sith blockade. Of course, this is all just second hand rumor.
Mission.nm03aemiss14045_.mp3: Where would he keep it? Do you know?
Mission.nm03aemiss14047_.mp3: If Davik does have a ship, he's got it locked up in his estate. Nobody gets in there, except the people working for Davik and the Exchange.
Mission.nm03aemiss14049_.mp3: There's only two gangs worth worrying about here in the Lower City: the Black Vulkars and the Hidden Beks. Sometimes Zaalbar and I hang out at the Bek base.
Mission.nm03aemiss14051_.mp3: The Beks are led by Gadon Thek - he's a good guy. Lost his sight in a swoop bike accident a few years ago, but even blind he's a great leader.
Mission.nm03aemiss14053_.mp3: Not like that traitor Brejik! Before he took over the Vulkars he was a Hidden Bek. Gadon considered that ungrateful space slug his adopted son.
Mission.nm03aemiss14055_.mp3: When Gadon went blind everyone figured he'd step down and appoint Brejik in his place. But Gadon figured Brejik wasn't ready yet. He wanted him to wait a few years.
Mission.nm03aemiss14057_.mp3: But Brejik was too impatient. He left to join the Vulkars, and ever since he's been waging a war to wipe Gadon and his Beks from the face of Taris!
Mission.nm03aemiss14059_.mp3: This gang war in the Lower City is totally the Vulkar's fault. They're the ones killing everything that moves out on the street. It's like they've gone insane.
Mission.nm03aemiss14061_.mp3: Calo Nord's one of the most famous bounty hunters in the galaxy. He's killed more people than the Iridian Plague! I've seen him kill people just for trying to talk to him!
Mission.nm03aemiss14063_.mp3: He hangs around Zax's bounty office, but I don't think he's looking for work there. All the postings there are small time - way beneath a bounty hunter of his caliber.
Mission.nm03aemiss14065_.mp3: I figure Calo's been hired by Davik to do a special job for the Exchange. I'd wager a thousand credits that as soon as the quarantine ends, he'll be getting off this rock.
Mission.nm03aemiss14067_.mp3: You're going? Yeah, this dive is pretty boring. No action around here. Come on, Big Z, let's go.
Mission.nm03aemiss14071_.mp3: Can't you think about something besides your stomach for five minutes? Come on - we'll go see if there's anything good to eat at the Bek base.
Mission.nm03aezaal18002_.mp3: Hey, relax Big Z. No need to be rude. Sorry about that, but Wookiees ain't much for conversation, you know?
Mission.nm04aamiss10000_.mp3: Please, you have to help me! Nobody else is going to help me. Even the Beks won't help me. But I can't just leave him there - he's my friend! You'll help me, won't you?
Mission.nm04aamiss10002_.mp3: It's Zaalbar. He's in trouble - big trouble! We have to help him. If we don't they'll sell him into slavery!
Mission.nm04aamiss10004_.mp3: Me... me and Zaalbar were just wandering around here in the Undercity. You know, looking for stuff we could find, just kind of exploring. We do it all the time.
Mission.nm04aamiss10006_.mp3: Only this time they were waiting for us. Gamorrean slave hunters. We didn't even have a chance to run. Big Z threw himself at them, and he roared for me to run!
Mission.nm04aamiss10008_.mp3: I... I took off; I figured Zaalbar would be right behind me. But there were too many of them - he couldn't get away. They're going to sell him to a slaver - I just know it!
Mission.nm04aamiss10010_.mp3: I don't know for sure, but those Gamorreans like to hang out in the sewers. The stink reminds them of home, I guess. That's probably where they took Big Z.
Mission.nm04aamiss10012_.mp3: I didn't mean to leave him! I thought he was right behind me - I'd never abandon Big Z on purpose! Please - help me get him back.
Mission.nm04aamiss10014_.mp3: No way. I'm the one that got Zaalbar into this mess, so I'm coming with you. I'm not going to abandon him again!
Mission.nm04aamiss10018_.mp3: Listen, my friend Zaalbar is in serious trouble, so you can forget about me helping with anything else until I get him back!
Mission.nm04aamiss10021_.mp3: Gadon? What? I... I don't know what you're talking about. Please - Zaalbar's in trouble. He needs help or they're going to sell him into slavery!
Mission.nm04aamiss10022_.mp3: You're back - does this mean you're going to help me now? Does this mean you're going to help me get Zaalbar back?
Mission.nm04aamiss10024_.mp3: It's a deal - as soon as we get Big Z back, I'll show you a way into that Vulkar base! Now, come on - We have to find Zaalbar before they sell him to slavers - or worse!
Mission.nm04aamiss10028_.mp3: The Gamorreans make their camps in the sewers. I bet that's where we'll find Zaalbar - and that's where I'll show you the secret entrance into the Vulkar compound.
Mission.nm04aamiss10031_.mp3: I can't ask Gadon - he's always telling me not to go into the Undercity. He says it's too dangerous with the rakghouls and Gamorreans and all. He'll never send his Beks down there.
Mission.nm04aamiss10034_.mp3: Pleeeze! There's nobody else who can help me! Listen - if you help me get Zaalbar back, I'll help you get inside the Vulkar base. Come on, what do you say?
Mission.nm04aamiss10036_.mp3: How can you be so stubborn? When you're ready to help me with Zaalbar come on back - because you'll never get into that Vulkar base without my help!
Mission.nm04aaoutw22034_.mp3: He WILL make it! Run, Hendar! Run!
Mission.nm04aaruki25051_.mp3: Watch yourself: this guy's star chart is missing a few galaxies, if you know what I mean.
Mission.nm04aaruki25111_.mp3: What did you expect? If they could get away with it the Tarisian nobles would stuff their own mothers down here to make more room in the Upper City.
Mission.nm05aaff0299000_.mp3: You won't be able to get that computer to lower the energy field unless you know the proper codes. Lucky for you, I've got them.
Mission.nm05aaff0299001_.mp3: I picked them off the pocket of a Black Vulkar who had a little too much to drink in the cantina one night. Here, let me get that energy field down for you.
Mission.nm05aaff0299002_.mp3: That energy shield leads to another section of the sewers. The entrance to the Vulkar base is somewhere past there.
Mission.nm05aaff0299003_.mp3: I've got the codes to lower the shield, but we have to rescue Zaalbar from those Gamorrean slavers. Don't worry - we can come back after we find Big Z.
Mission.nm05aaffxx01002_.mp3: You won't be able to get that computer to lower the energy field unless you know the proper codes. Lucky for you, I've got them.
Mission.nm05aaffxx01003_.mp3: I picked them off the pocket of a Black Vulkar who had a little too much to drink in the cantina one night. Here, let me get that energy field down for you.
Mission.nm05aamiss01000_.mp3: Hmmm... look at this. This is one of those old style manual locks. No computer codes or nothing. The sewers is the only place you'll see one of these on Taris.
Mission.nm05aamiss01001_.mp3: You can't use conventional security spikes on these old locks, but don't worry. I've come across them before. I've rigged up a little device that should do the trick.
Mission.nm05aazaal03001_.mp3: I'm glad to see you too, Big Z! You didn't think I'd forget about you - Mission and Zaalbar, together forever!
Mission.nm05aazaal03003_.mp3: These are my new friends, Big Z. Without them I never could have got you out.
Mission.nm05aazaal03006_.mp3: A lifedebt? Are you sure about that, Big Z? Think about it carefully. You better be sure about this.
Mission.nm05aazaal03010_.mp3: Big Z swearing a Wookiee lifedebt to you. Wow - this is major. Do you realize what this means?
Mission.nm05aazaal03013_.mp3: A lifedebt is the most solemn vow a Wookiee can make. It means he'll stay by your side for the rest of your life - wherever you go, whatever you do, Zaalbar will be with you.
Mission.nm05aazaal03016_.mp3: I guess this means you're stuck with me too. Wherever Big Z goes, I'm going. I almost lost him once - it's not going to happen again.
Mission.nm05aazaal03018_.mp3: So... I guess I still owe you one secret path into the Vulkar base. That was the deal, wasn't it? Don't worry, I know a backdoor into that scum den!
Mission.nm05aazaal03020_.mp3: I better come with you - the Vulkars put up a force shield to keep the sewer dwellers out. I'm one of the only non-Vulkars on Taris who can get you past it.
Mission.nm05aazaal03021_.mp3: I can't remember exactly how to get there, but I know it was somewhere here in the sewers. Over to the northeast, if I remember right. I just hope the rancor monster isn't still there.
Mission.nm05aazaal03023_.mp3: There used to be a rancor monster that made its nest in that part of the sewers. Pretty much eats anything it can get its claws on. That thing is huge!
Mission.nm05aazaal03024_.mp3: Luckily rancors aren't too bright. I was able to sneak past it before, so I'm sure we'll figure something out. That is, unless you want to change your mind.
Mission.nm05aazaal03026_.mp3: Okay then, off we go. Like I said, somewhere to the south-east. Just look for the force shield and we'll know we're there.
Mission.nm05aazaal03031_.mp3: You did a good job mopping up those Gamorreans, but I don't think you want to take on a rancor! Those things are huge!
Mission.nm05aazaal03034_.mp3: Hey - don't underestimate me! I may be young, but I'm quick and plenty smart. You just give me a chance and you'll be surprised at how useful I can be.
Mission.nm05aazaal03037_.mp3: Sorry, but there's not much you can do about it. Zaalbar's already sworn the lifedebt and it's not something they can just take back. This is a sacred, irreversible vow.
Mission.nm05aazaal03040_.mp3: Hey - don't make fun of the lifedebt! This is serious business, you know?
Mission.nm05aazaal03042_.mp3: Hey - Zaalbar's not your slave! He just swore a lifedebt to you. It's not the same thing.
Mission.nm10ackand01036_.mp3: Brejik stole that engine from Gadon! It was never yours to begin with!
Mission.nm10ackand01048_.mp3: What? You can't betray Gadon! I won't let you!
Mission.nm10ackand01052_.mp3: No, that's not true! You're lying!
Mission.nm10ackand01056_.mp3: They... they said I was too young!
Mission.nm10ackand01060_.mp3: Well, yeah. Some of them were. But you Vulkars have tried to kill me more than once!
Mission.nm10ackand01068_.mp3: You're right! I don't need anyone but Zaalbar! If Gadon dies, he's only getting what's coming to him!
Mission.nm11aazaer09026_.mp3: Gadon always was too soft on Brejik. I just wish I'd been there when that scum got what was coming to him!
Mission.nm11aazaer09039_.mp3: Gadon always was too soft on Brejik. I just wish I'd been there when that scum got what was coming to him!
Mission.nm13aacrat07087_.mp3: He makes a good case. It's not like you'd be stealing or killing anyone or anything.
Mission.nm13aajuha11025_.mp3: Hey, I'm glad to see you're not getting hung up on all this. The past is in the past, you know?
Mission.nm13aavand17311_.mp3: *whisper* Anyone can see that he doesn't believe you. He must have some reason for letting this slide. Probably trying to teach you some Jedi lesson or something.
Mission.nm14aajon006023_.mp3: Wow, talk about an ego trip! You Jedi aren't perfect; remember Revan and Malak? Maybe these Mandalorians are worth looking into.
Mission.nm14abahla01048_.mp3: This guy's a real pain! It wouldn't surprise me if Shen ran off just to get away from his father!
Mission.nm14abmdro03026_.mp3: Figures. We get his son back for him, and now the stuck-up estate owner won't have anything to do with us!
Mission.nm17aa03sh01166_.mp3: Wow, sometimes helping people feels pretty good, you know?
Mission.nm17aaiziz99150_.mp3: Hey, why are you being so mean to this little guy? What did he ever do to you?
Mission.nm17abgrif04002_.mp3: I... I have to ask you something, Griff. It's important. I ran into Lena. She said... she said it was your idea to leave me on Taris. It's not true, is it?
Mission.nm17abgrif04008_.mp3: You... you're hitting me up for credits? I don't believe this! Lena was right about you, Griff! We should have just left you to the Sand People! Don't talk to me anymore - ever!
Mission.nm17abgrif04035_.mp3: You mean it's true? It was your idea to leave me there? I'm your sister - how could you abandon me like that?
Mission.nm17abgrif04037_.mp3: That's it? That's all you have to say to me after all these years after deserting me on Taris?
Mission.nm17ac08yu02073_.mp3: Gee, that doesn't sound suspicious at all. Warehouse workers have a bad habit of paying off their debts with other people's property, you know.
Mission.nm17ad03gu03078_.mp3: Aw, geez! I hope this doesn't take too long; Gamorreans like to throw insults around, but they just don't have the smarts for it.
Mission.nm17ae04ce02010_.mp3: Nobody here can compare with the racers you rode against on Taris. You'll wipe every record from the books on this backwater track!
Mission.nm17ae04ce02030_.mp3: That isn't fair! On Taris you had to give a cut to the swoop gang sponsoring you, but at least the rider got the higher share of the winnings.
Mission.nm17ae04ni04037_.mp3: That promoter's going to bleed that poor kid dry... but I guess he's got to learn the only way to get by in this life is to look out for yourself!
Mission.nm17ag01gr02001_.mp3: I don't like the sound of this.
Mission.nm17ag01gr02012_.mp3: Damn it, Griff - won't you ever learn? How can my own flesh and blood be so stupid!
Mission.nm17aggrif03002_.mp3: Hmph! Save it Griff - I'm still not talking to you! I want no part of whatever you're involved in!
Mission.nm17aggrif03016_.mp3: Griff, are you blind? Can't you see you're talking to a Jedi? We're out here trying to save the galaxy! We can't waste time on this!
Mission.nm17aggrif03027_.mp3: Forget it, Griff, I'm not falling for that line again. You'll have to find your own way out of this mess!
Mission.nm17aggrif03048_.mp3: This wasn't my idea, Griff. If it was up to me I'd let the Exchange deal with you!
Mission.nm17aggrif03052_.mp3: Forget it, Griff. Don't you understand? It's too late - you're dead to me now. I don't want anything more to do with you. Ever.
Mission.nm17aggrif03056_.mp3: Please, Griff. Let this be the last time. No more cons. No more scams. No more schemes. That's all I ask.
Mission.nm18ackoma99130_.mp3: You're going to turn on this guy now? This is low, even for you.
Mission.nm18acstar99010_.mp3: Hey - it's one of those Star Maps, ain't it? Kind of weird finding it in the back of a krayt dragon's lair, don't you think?
Mission.nm18acstar99011_.mp3: Say, now that we've got the Star Map do you think we can leave this planet soon? I've got sand *everywhere*!
Mission.nm20aagrif05001_.mp3: Griff, don't you recognize me? It's Mission!
Mission.nm20aagrif05003_.mp3: I... I have to ask you something, Griff. It's important. I ran into Lena. She said... she said it was your idea to leave me on Taris. It's not true, is it?
Mission.nm20aagrif05005_.mp3: You mean it's true? It was your idea to leave me there? I'm your sister - how could you abandon me like that?
Mission.nm20aagrif05009_.mp3: You... you're hitting me up for credits? I don't believe this! Lena was right about you, Griff! We should have just left you to the Sand People! Don't talk to me anymore - ever!
Mission.nm20aagrif05034_.mp3: Yeah, you can find your way from there, right? Can you manage that? What? Is there something else?
Mission.nm20aagrif05036_.mp3: We'd be risking everything just to get you out! That doesn't bother you?
Mission.nm20aagrif05045_.mp3: Yeah, you can just stay here!
Mission.nm20aagrif05052_.mp3: Hey now, I don't want him dead. Well, maybe I do, but couldn't we just let him sit here and think about things for a while?
Mission.nm20aagrif05061_.mp3: You can just keep waiting, Griff. We'll get you out of there when it suits us.
Mission.nm22aaczer03011_.mp3: That's horrible! You wouldn't talk like that if Big Z was here!
Mission.nm22aaelix08041_.mp3: You mean they don't tolerate cheats!
Mission.nm22aaelix08052_.mp3: Something about this whole situation stinks worse than an overcrowded ronto stable! What kind of friends would just abandon a crew mate?
Mission.nm22aazaal01029_.mp3: Zaalbar should be here. He shouldn't miss this. He needs to know he can come back here.
Mission.nm22aazaal01031_.mp3: I can't talk for Big Z, but believe me, he should be with us. He's got... unfinished business here.
Mission.nm22aazaal01033_.mp3: I'm not saying that I know better than you, but this is Zaalbar's home. Don't you think he'd know some things?
Mission.nm22aazaal01035_.mp3: Besides, he's got things here he needs to take care of.
Mission.nm22abchor02050_.mp3: Big Z once told me he had seen paradise destroyed by the greed of outsiders. I never understood what he meant until now.
Mission.nm22abdehn06110_.mp3: I'm glad Big Z isn't here to see this. I don't know if he could handle it.
Mission.nm22abzaal01023_.mp3: I never thought I'd see the big trees. Zaalbar's stories didn't do it justice. This is incredible.
Mission.nm22abzaal01025_.mp3: I wish he was here to see this. He'd want to see this, you know?
Mission.nm23abjaar01013_.mp3: It isn't an easy language to learn, what with all the growls and howls. Big Z told me the whole point was to make it difficult for outsiders to understand.
Mission.nm23abjaar01052_.mp3: Yours? Why would we find your casing beside... no, it couldn't be. Could it?
Mission.nm23acworr01036_.mp3: Big Z says honor was everything to his people. I... guess he's right.
Mission.nm23acworr01056_.mp3: How awful. Big Z always said how important honor was to his people. It's everything.
Mission.nm23adchuu01047_.mp3: You're not fooling anyone, ya know.
Mission.nm23adchuu01051_.mp3: If you say so, Big Z.
Mission.nm23adchuu01070_.mp3: Whoa, Big Z! Settle down! I've never seen him this angry before!
Mission.nm23adchuu01139_.mp3: I... guess he *did* toss you out on your ear, Big Z. What kind of father is that?
Mission.nm23adchuu01161_.mp3: Alright! Way to go, Big Z!
Mission.nm23adchuu01172_.mp3: Woo-hoo! Way to go, Big Z!
Mission.nm23adchuu01220_.mp3: You can't do that! He can't do that, can he? He can't hold Zaalbar prisoner just because he's Chieftain, can he?
Mission.nm23adchuu01246_.mp3: Don't worry, buddy, we'll get you out of here. You can count on us!
Mission.nm23adchuu01299_.mp3: Big Z! What are you doing here? What's going on?
Mission.nm23adfrey02031_.mp3: Look, Big Z may owe you a life-debt but you've got to cut him some slack!
Mission.nm23adfrey02064_.mp3: Careful, I've seen Zaalbar get this mad too. There's no persuading him when it happens.
Mission.nm23adfrey02083_.mp3: Oh boy, now you've done it. No way he'd say okay to that.
Mission.nm24aajole06203_.mp3: It's kind of nice to meet a Jedi who isn't all hung up on this light side, dark side stuff. It gets pretty tiring, you know?
Mission.nm25aacomp01256_.mp3: I can't believe you'd just let all those people die!
Mission.nm25aacomp01257_.mp3: Come on, you know you could trust Big Z! He'd never turn on you.
Mission.nm25aafrey02015_.mp3: Hold on a second: Zaalbar and Chuundar are brothers? And you're their father? Wait a minute... does this mean Big Z is some kind of prince or something?
Mission.nm25aafrey02026_.mp3: Exiled? Big Z never told me that! Of course he never said he was royalty, either.
Mission.nm25aafrey02167_.mp3: Doesn't seem like much of a father anyway. Hmph! Zaalbar was hurt bad by whatever happened here.
Mission.nm25aafrey02168_.mp3: Doesn't seem like much of a father anyway, kicking his son out like that.
Mission.nm25aastar99010_.mp3: Why would anyone hide a Star Map here in the Shadowlands?  No one's ever going to see it, so what's the point?
Mission.nm25aastar99011_.mp3: I guess it's possible the Star Map could have been built before these trees popped up. It's just hard to imagine Kashyyyk with no forests, you know?
Mission.nm25aastar99030_.mp3: Hey, this place is starting to give me the creeps. We've got the Star Map, let's just get out of here, okay?
Mission.nm26aairim06065_.mp3: I bet they're twisting the minds of those Selkath youth, trying to trick them into joining the Sith!
Mission.nm26aanilk09114_.mp3: I don't know if I like this. Aren't the Republic supposed to be the good guys?
Mission.nm26acignu04080_.mp3: Looks like Manaan isn't much different than Taris: justice is up for grabs to the highest bidder.
Mission.nm28aamerc03051_.mp3: You got a better idea for us getting you out of here, huh?
Mission.nm33aaczer07005_.mp3: Yeah, I sure bet the Wookiees would hate to see ya go.
Mission.nm33aaczer07044_.mp3: That would explain why this place is so creepy. This whole planet makes my head-tails twitch!
Mission.nm33aasith20001_.mp3: Ever notice how the Sith always act tough when they're in groups? Nothing but scum if you ask me!
Mission.nm39aastar99002_.mp3: Wow - I never figured to see a Star Map in one of these moldy old tombs.
Mission.nm39aastar99003_.mp3: Look, we've got what we came for. Can we go now? This place gives me the creeps.
Mission.nm40aacart05022_.mp3: Maybe I can goad the guards into making a mistake! If I get them mad enough, they might put me in a separate cell to punish me.
Mission.nm40aacart05024_.mp3: With them focusing so much on you three I might be able to sneak out of my cell and come rescue the rest of you.
Mission.nm40aacart05028_.mp3: It's a risk we have to take, Big Z. I can slice my way free from any security cell. Don't worry, I can pull this off!
Mission.nm40aacart05030_.mp3: The decision is yours - you're in charge. But I know I can do this if you give me a chance.
Mission.nm40aacart05033_.mp3: I won't let you down! You'll see!
Mission.nm40aamiss08002_.mp3: Quit crowding me! Sheesh, I've met Gamorreans who didn't smell as bad as you Sith.
Mission.nm40aamiss08006_.mp3: How come every time you open your mouth to talk the scent of rancor dung comes out?
Mission.nm40aamiss08010_.mp3: Who designed those Sith uniforms anyway? A blind Rodian with a sick sense of humor?
Mission.nm40aamiss08014_.mp3: What? You're... you're going to torture me?
Mission.nm40aamiss08020_.mp3: Or I could use the keycard I lifted from your pocket to slice into the security panel and get myself out of this cell.
Mission.nm40aamiss08022_.mp3: Piece of cake! I wonder when people will stop underestimating me?
Mission.nm40adcart01011_.mp3: Revan? What... what are you talking about? Is this some kind of joke?
Mission.nm40adcart01013_.mp3: You're Darth Revan? This is... this is big. Do you... do you remember anything about being the Dark Lord?
Mission.nm40adcart01015_.mp3: Just a few flashes? That's it? Nothing more? Then I don't think there's a problem.
Mission.nm40adcart01016_.mp3: It seems to me that if you don't really remember anything about being Revan, then it doesn't really matter anymore. You are who you are now, right?
Mission.nm40adcart01031_.mp3: Well, I trust you! I know you... and you're not Revan anymore. Whatever you used to be, you're one of us now!
Mission.nm40adcart01044_.mp3: Hey - you've got nothing to be sorry about! You didn't ask for this. Besides, I know you... you're not Revan anymore. Whatever you used to be, you're one of us now!
Mission.nm40adcart01046_.mp3: I don't see the Sith Lord standing here, I see a friend who's been with us through thick and thin! Remember - Malak's the one who tried to destroy Taris!
Mission.nm40adcart01050_.mp3: Big Z and I will stick by you. We owe you our lives; we won't desert you now!
Mission.nm40adcart01084_.mp3: Wow. What are the chances of that happening?
Mission.nm40adcart01092_.mp3: I knew the little guy would come through for you - droids don't hold grudges.
Mission.nm40adcart01125_.mp3: Hey, where's Bastila? What happened on the ship?
Mission.nm41aablac01020_.mp3: Whoa. Can you actually understand what these guys are saying? I guess you must have come here back when you were Revan, huh?
Mission.nm41aacart03030_.mp3: Hey! Sheesh... get a room, will ya?
Mission.nm41aacart03032_.mp3: Oh, sure. Even a good omen can get itself a room, though, don't ya think?
Mission.nm41aacart03035_.mp3: You make that sound so easy. Just fly over and boom, one less Star Forge in the universe, huh?
Mission.nm41aacart03086_.mp3: I saw what the Sith did to Taris - anyone who serves the dark side is evil! Big Z and I are with Carth on this one!
Mission.nm41aacart03088_.mp3: Zaalbar - Revan's a Sith! Just like Malak! It's not a betrayal if you break your life debt now!
Mission.nm41aacart03090_.mp3: No, Zaalbar. I don't care! I won't help the Sith against the Republic! Not for anything! Not even for you!
Mission.nm41aacart03111_.mp3: Whew! Talk about your rough landings, Carth! What's the matter? You're flying like you've been on an all night Tarisian ale drinking binge!
Mission.nm41aacart03121_.mp3: T3's picking up massive power fluctuations on the ship's sensors. They seem to be coming from some type of large stone structure to the east... it looks like some kind of ancient temple.
Mission.nm41aacart03133_.mp3: I hope everything works out as smooth as you make it sound, Carth.
Mission.nm41aacart03140_.mp3: Hey, don't forget about Bastila, guys! We still have to rescue her, too.
Mission.nm41aacart03143_.mp3: There's massive power fluctuations on the ship's sensors. They seem to be coming from some type of large stone structure to the east... it looks like some kind of ancient temple.
Mission.nm41aacart04086_.mp3: I saw what the Sith did to Taris - anyone who serves the dark side is evil! Big Z and I are with Carth on this one!
Mission.nm41aacart04088_.mp3: Zaalbar - Revan's a Sith! Just like Malak! It's not a betrayal if you break your life debt now!
Mission.nm41aacart04090_.mp3: No, Zaalbar. I don't care! I won't help the Sith against the Republic! Not for anything! Not even for you!
Mission.nm41aamiss04000_.mp3: No - this isn't happening! It can't be happening!
Mission.nm41aamiss04003_.mp3: No! I'm not going to just stand aside and do nothing! You'll... you'll just have to kill me. But I don't think you will.
Mission.nm41aamiss04007_.mp3: I don't believe you've gone over to the dark side. Not totally. I don't think you'll kill me. Not if I don't attack you, first.
Mission.nm41aamiss04009_.mp3: NO! I won't let this happen!
Mission.nm41aamiss04014_.mp3: Looks like you'll have to do your own dirty work, Revan - if you've got the guts!
Mission.nm41aamiss04019_.mp3: Zaalbar, what are you saying? Revan can't force you to do anything you don't want to! It's me, Big Z - Mission!
Mission.nm41aamiss04023_.mp3: Please, Zaalbar - don't do this! Please! NO!!!

MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04000_.mp3: Mission? Is it really you? I heard Taris was destroyed! I thought you were dead! Ah, joy of joys, my little sister is alive!
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04004_.mp3: Ah, well... there's the truth and then there's the *truth*, you know? I always meant to go back to Taris, sis. Just as soon as I had the credits to pay off my debts. But credits have been hard to come by.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04006_.mp3: That and... uh you look good, sis. Like you're doing well. Financially, I mean. Say... you think you could spare me a few credits to get back on my feet, do you? Um...
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04010_.mp3: Huh... that didn't go well. Sis always was a little too fiery for her own good. She'll cool down in time.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04012_.mp3: Ah, she'll be okay. We've had our fights before. Too bad, though. I really could have used a helping hand right now.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04015_.mp3: You may have saved my life, but I don't have a single credit to my name. Say, you wouldn't be able to spare me some credits? Just till I get back on my feet, you know?
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04017_.mp3: That's it, huh? Oh, figured you would be able to spare a bit more than that, but, you know, I'll take whatever I can get. Don't worry about me... I've already got a job waiting for me.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04019_.mp3: Greeta, the manager over at the Czerka supply shop, said I could come work for him if I ever get tired of the mines. I think I'll go take him up on his offer.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04021_.mp3: You know, maybe there's something else you can help me with. I need to talk to a guy first and set up the details, but if you're interested in a job come see me in Greeta's shop.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04023_.mp3: Goodbye, Mission. Uh... I'm glad you're not dead.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04030_.mp3: Huh - I...uh...guess you've been talking to Lena, too. That's okay - I'll figure out a way to get by without your credits. I always do. Besides, I've already got a job lined up for me.
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04033_.mp3: Ha! You're kidding, right? Look at me... do I look like I've got any reward for you?
MissionBrother.nm17abgrif04036_.mp3: Come on, sis. You didn't need me to look after you anymore. You may have been young, but you knew how to take care of yourself. Besides, you're here now - I mean everything worked out fine.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01000_.mp3: I heard what you did out on the dunes. I am impressed. I'd never have thought a tenderfoot like you could bring down a dragon.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01001_.mp3: Get lost, tenderfoot. I hunt desert wraid, I don't babysit.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01003_.mp3: You swoop types don't usually listen to what anyone says. Why bother me?
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01004_.mp3: Well, you sure know how to get on my good side. You're just trotting out bantha pats, but thanks all the same.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01006_.mp3: My name is Dorak Quinn. I'm a hunter. I hunt. Is that enough, or should I start listing my family birthdays?
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01008_.mp3: Again? Well, if you want to waste your day, that's your business, I guess.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01010_.mp3: Why don't *you* tell me? You've killed a dragon. Me, I just make do hunting desert wraid. And there's not many of those even left.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01011_.mp3: If I knew the best place, why would I tell anyone? It would be worth too much to me to let it get out.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01012_.mp3: It doesn't matter, anyway. This season has been dry for me, as it has for almost everyone.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01013_.mp3: Perhaps someone else is holding out, but there are simply fewer wraid out there.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01015_.mp3: It used to be a one-on-one test, hunter against hunted. Now, people just want the credits.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01016_.mp3: I could stomach maybe a pair, or a team of hunters, but some now use battle droids! Where is the sport in that?
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01018_.mp3: Nobody now. A cruel end, but a necessary one. I will speak no more of it.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01019_.mp3: Nobody, now that Tanis quit. You had something to do with that, didn't you? Good for you.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01020_.mp3: That's not for me to say. I won't be a troublemaker in so small a community. You will see. Hunt, and you will see.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01022_.mp3: I've tracked wild beasts my whole life, but I've only been hunting here for five years. I've much to learn yet.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01024_.mp3: I want to learn how hunters like you find the big kills. Not that I'd survive hunting a dragon, but it would be a fine battle.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01025_.mp3: I suppose I just need time and experience. I'll get better. That's my challenge.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01026_.mp3: There are hunters that go after the big kills, the krayt dragons. I don't know how they do it. I never even see the things.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01027_.mp3: Komad is the one I respect, but I also trust that the only difference between us is experience. I will learn.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01029_.mp3: I don't go telling stories about other people. You want to know what they think, you go talk to them.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01030_.mp3: Although I don't hold out much hope for you surviving. I heard how you gave in to the Gamorreans.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01031_.mp3: You won't last long on this planet. You just aren't cut out for it.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01032_.mp3: You seem pretty prepared to hold your own with most of them. I heard what happened with the Gamorreans.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01033_.mp3: Good work with them. I think you'll do just fine around here.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01034_.mp3: Ah, one word though. Watch yourself around the Gamorreans. Gurke and his buddies aren't to be trusted.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01035_.mp3: Everyone else I respect because they have skill. Those guys... they go for easier prey.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01037_.mp3: Just watch your back when you hunt. The dragons aren't the only dangers out there.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01039_.mp3: If that's what you want. I'm not sure what you hope to get out of me, though.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01041_.mp3: You'll have to ask around. Komad Fortuna is a much more experienced hunter than I am... he hunts far from Anchorhead.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01042_.mp3: The local Jawas are a good source of information, even if it is hard to understand them. It may cost you, though.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01044_.mp3: If he's not here in Fazza's, he's probably out wandering the desert. I don't know how you'd find him out there.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01045_.mp3: Seems like he knows the desert as well as Jawas and Sand People. He doesn't say much about it though.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01050_.mp3: Hoping to goad me into talking a bit? All right, what do you want?
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01052_.mp3: Easy now, I'm not looking for a fight. This is a friendly place to gather. You... you're kidding, right?
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01054_.mp3: What? Fine, fine, take some cred's. It just isn't worth fighting over. Happy now? Better be.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01056_.mp3: Easy now, come on! Look, I don't want any trouble. I'll just leave, all right? Don't worry about me.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01058_.mp3: This really isn't worth the headache. How about I just leave. Here, take my seat.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01059_.mp3: Every ship that lands brings a new hotshot. I don't have the time.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01060_.mp3: Why are you here, swoop-head? Hunting doesn't give your kind the instant thrills you need, does it?
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01061_.mp3: Hmm? You know, I don't have that much to tell you. You really have to get out on the dunes for yourself.
MissionBrother.nm17ad03do01062_.mp3: I'm done with you. Go bother someone else.

Ordo.nglobebant00043_.mp3: Carth, you fought in the Mandalorian Wars, didn't you? We may have faced each other in combat. What battles were you in?
Ordo.nglobebant00045_.mp3: The horrors of war? My people know only the glory of battle. I'm disappointed in you, Carth. I thought a warrior like you would understand.
Ordo.nglobebant00049_.mp3: Nice speech. I bet you tell yourself that every night so you can sleep. But I accept who and what I am. I don't have to justify it with words - victory in battle is my justification!
Ordo.nglobebant00051_.mp3: You had us outnumbered five to one. You had more ships, more troops, more supplies and the Jedi on your side. And we still made the Republic tremble before we fell!
Ordo.nglobebant00054_.mp3: So, Bastila, I heard a rumor that the Vulkars captured you without much of a struggle. It must be embarrassing to be bested by a handful of street thugs.
Ordo.nglobebant00057_.mp3: Whatever you say. All I know is that if we had more Jedi like Bastila fighting against us in the Mandalorian Wars, my side might not have lost.
Ordo.nglobebant00059_.mp3: Insults? Maybe if your Master had trained your lightsaber to be as quick as your tongue you could have escaped those Vulkars, you spoiled little Jedi princess!
Ordo.nglobebant00061_.mp3: That's the problem with you Jedi. Always chanting about peace and control, never up for a good fight. Well, except for Revan, I guess.
Ordo.nglobecalo02002_.mp3: I see you brought some back up, Calo. Realized we were a bit much to handle on your own, eh?
Ordo.nglobecand03473_.mp3: Hmph. That trick would never work on a Mandalorian. Our minds are not so weak and easily twisted.
Ordo.nglobecand03474_.mp3: *whisper* I'm amazed at how many people that works on. The entire galaxy must be filled with weak-minded fools.
Ordo.nglobecand03475_.mp3: I like the way you handled that. Are you sure you don't have some Mandalorian blood in you?
Ordo.nglobecand03477_.mp3: Mighty generous of you. A little too generous, if you ask me.
Ordo.nm02abboun01000_.mp3: Davik says you missed your last payment.
Ordo.nm02abboun01006_.mp3: Sorry, you're out of time. Now it's all or nothing. Davik can't have people not paying his debts!
Ordo.nm02abboun01014_.mp3: Hold on a second. Looks like we got ourselves a witness here!
Ordo.nm02abboun01016_.mp3: What's the matter, you forget the arrangement? You Sith don't bother us on Davik's business and we don't bother you!
Ordo.nm02abboun01018_.mp3: We take our orders from Davik, not you!
Ordo.nm02abboun01025_.mp3: Come on. We don't want to keep Davik waiting - that's only going to make things worse.
Ordo.nm02aecand30000_.mp3: I saw you in the swoop race. Very impressive. You seem like you know how to get results. That's just the kind of person I'm looking for.
Ordo.nm02aecand30002_.mp3: My name's Canderous Ordo. I work for Davik Kang and the Exchange; the hours aren't great, but they promised me a fortune to work for them and I have nothing better to do. Mandalorian mercs like me are in high demand.
Ordo.nm02aecand30004_.mp3: But lately Davik hasn't been paying me what he promised. I don't like getting cheated, so I figure it's time for me to break the Sith quarantine and get off this backwater planet.
Ordo.nm02aecand30006_.mp3: I've got a plan to escape Taris, but I can't do it alone. I need someone I know can get the job done to help me. That's where you come in.
Ordo.nm02aecand30010_.mp3: I ain't talking to you. I'm talking to your friend, aren't I?
Ordo.nm02aecand30014_.mp3: I saw you win that swoop race, and I started thinking. Anyone crazy enough to race like that is probably crazy enough to break into the Sith military base.
Ordo.nm02aecand30016_.mp3: See, I put two and two together and I figured out you're the person who stole those Sith departure codes for Taris. So you're exactly the person I'm looking for.
Ordo.nm02aecand30018_.mp3: I've got a plan to get inside Davik's base and steal his ship, the Ebon Hawk. If any ship is fast enough to break the Sith quarantine, it's that one.
Ordo.nm02aecand30020_.mp3: But the ship alone won't get me off this rock. Without the proper launch codes the automated defense guns of the Sith fleet will disintegrate me as soon as I leave the atmosphere.
Ordo.nm02aecand30022_.mp3: So here's the deal: we join up together. You've got the codes, and I'll get us to Davik's ship. What do you say? Do we have a deal? We can go right now.
Ordo.nm02aecand30024_.mp3: Fair enough. But don't take too long. As soon as you're ready to get inside Davik's estate, come speak to me. The sooner we get off this rock the better.
Ordo.nm02aecand30027_.mp3: Davik's always looking to recruit new talent. I'll tell him how you won that swoop race and mention that you're interested in working for the Exchange.
Ordo.nm02aecand30029_.mp3: I'll say I brought you in so he could check you out. He'll have you stay at his estate for a couple days while he runs some background checks on you - that's standard procedure.
Ordo.nm02aecand30033_.mp3: You got another plan, sister? Or are you just objecting 'cause you didn't think of it?
Ordo.nm02aecand30037_.mp3: I can say the same about you. That makes us even. Fortunately we both want to get off this rock, right?
Ordo.nm02aecand30041_.mp3: While Davik's checking you out, we steal the Ebon Hawk and escape Taris. Come on - I've got an air speeder nearby to take us to Davik's estate. The sooner we're off Taris the better!
Ordo.nm02aecand30044_.mp3: I need someone to steal the Sith launch codes from the base. Without those codes any ship leaving the atmosphere will be disintegrated by the Sith fleet's automated defense guns.
Ordo.nm02aecand30046_.mp3: Here's the deal: you bring me those launch codes and I can provide the vehicle to get off the planet - Davik's flagship, the Ebon Hawk!
Ordo.nm02aecand30048_.mp3: Uh-uh. Not yet. First, you bring me the launch codes. Then I'll tell you the rest of my plan.
Ordo.nm02aecand30050_.mp3: Getting in won't be easy: the Sith base is protected by an encrypted security system. It would take a top of the line astromech droid to slice through it.
Ordo.nm02aecand30052_.mp3: But that little T3 unit you got from Janice should be good enough to get the job done.
Ordo.nm02aecand30053_.mp3: Lucky for you I know just the place to get a droid like that. Davik was having one custom built by Janice Nall.
Ordo.nm02aecand30056_.mp3: Look, I don't like working with strangers either but we don't have much choice. I can provide the ship, you can get me those codes. We need each other.
Ordo.nm02aecand30062_.mp3: I'm going to wait in Javyar's cantina. You come find me when you've got those launch codes and I'll make sure we both get off this rock.
Ordo.nm02aecand30065_.mp3: Good luck - you're going to need it. The entrance to the base is sealed up tight.
Ordo.nm02aecand30068_.mp3: Damn, you're stubborn! We both want off the planet, but neither one of us can pull it off alone! Bring me the launch codes and we'll both get what we want.
Ordo.nm02aecand30073_.mp3: Hold on just a second. Believe me, you'll want to hear this.
Ordo.nm02aecand30075_.mp3: I figured you'd be back. Neither one of us is getting off this planet unless we work together.
Ordo.nm02aecand30077_.mp3: Now, I know the Sith military base had a break in. I know it was you. I know you've got those departure codes I need.
Ordo.nm02aecand30079_.mp3: So what do you say? We join forces and I can get you inside Davik's base - and right to the Ebon Hawk. We can go right now.
Ordo.nm02aecand30081_.mp3: Sooner or later you'll figure this out. Either we work together, or we both stay stuck here on Taris. Come back and speak to me again when you come to your senses.
Ordo.nm02aecand30084_.mp3: But we've got a small problem. I haven't heard about anyone breaking into the miliarty base yet, so I know you don't have those departure codes.
Ordo.nm02aecand30086_.mp3: If you want me to help you, you've got to bring something to the table. So until you get those codes we really don't have much to talk about.
Ordo.nm02aecand30088_.mp3: Glad to hear it. I'll be waiting right here.
Ordo.nm02aecand30091_.mp3: Getting in won't be easy: the Sith base is protected by an encrypted security system. It would take a top of the line astromech droid to slice through it.
Ordo.nm02aecand30093_.mp3: That little T3 unit you got there might be good enough to get the job done. Maybe. I guess you won't know until you give it a shot.
Ordo.nm02aecand30094_.mp3: But a droid like that doesn't come cheap. Still, it might be your only chance.
Ordo.nm02aecand30095_.mp3: Just tell her Canderous sent you and she'll sell you the droid. Then you can use it to get the launch codes from the Sith base.
Ordo.nm02aecand30098_.mp3: Davik paid for the droid, but I'm the guy he put in charge of this mission. He won't care how I come up with those codes.
Ordo.nm02aecand30099_.mp3: Normally I'd do this myself, but everyone knows who I work for. If I broke into the Sith base, they'd send an army down on Davik's estate to get those codes back. That's why I need you.
Ordo.nm03aacand05000_.mp3: You're with the Sith, are you? Hmmm... don't think I have anything to say to you. Do us both a favor and go bother someone else.
Ordo.nm03aacand05002_.mp3: I saw you in the swoop race. Very impressive. You seem like you know how to get results. That's just the kind of person I'm looking for.
Ordo.nm03aacand05004_.mp3: I'm Canderous Ordo. I work for Davik Kang and the Exchange; the hours aren't great, but they promised me a fortune to work for them. Mandalorian mercs like me are in high demand.

Ordo.nm03aacand05034_.mp3: No, I... don't have another plan. I would rather not place my life in your hands, however.
Ordo.nm03aacand05036_.mp3: I can say the same about you. That makes us even. Fortunately we both want to get off this rock, right?

Ordo.nm03aacand05065_.mp3: I figured you'd be back. Neither one of us is getting off this planet unless we work together.
Ordo.nm03aacand05067_.mp3: Now, I know the Sith military base had a break in. I know it was you. I know you've got those departure codes I need.
Ordo.nm03aacand05069_.mp3: So what do you say? We join forces and I can get you inside Davik's base - and right to the Ebon Hawk.
Ordo.nm03aacand05071_.mp3: Sooner or later you'll figure this out. Either we work together, or we both stay stuck here on Taris. Come back and speak to me again when you come to your senses.
Ordo.nm03aacand05074_.mp3: But we've got a small problem. I haven't heard about anyone breaking into the miliarty base yet, so I know you don't have those departure codes.
Ordo.nm03aacand05076_.mp3: If you want me to help you, you've got to bring something to the table. So until you get those codes we really don't have much to talk about.
Ordo.nm03aacand05078_.mp3: Glad to hear it. I'll be waiting right here.
Ordo.nm03aacand06014_.mp3: Too bad. I was looking forward to cracking some heads.
Ordo.nm03aacand07000_.mp3: Those Vulkars are dumber than a Coruscant granite slug! They actually think being in that pathetic little gang of theirs makes them important.
Ordo.nm03aacand07002_.mp3: Gadon keeps his hidden Beks in line, but Brejik's getting dreams of grandeur. If Davik's smart, he'll slap that young punk back down.
Ordo.nm03aacand07004_.mp3: I'm someone you don't want to get on the bad side of, and I'm not one for small talk.
Ordo.nm03aacand07006_.mp3: Besides, you know the arrangement. You Sith don't interfere with Davik's business and you all get a nice cut of his action.
Ordo.nm03aacand07009_.mp3: Sorry, but I don't usually volunteer information to anyone who just asks.
Ordo.nm03aacand07012_.mp3: I don't have time to stick around here, anyway. Davik's got me working on a special assignment.
Ordo.nm03abciti08011_.mp3: Those bounty hunters make me nervous when they come in here. I always feel like they're trying to guess what my head would be worth if they brought it in.
Ordo.nm03adciti06006_.mp3: Those bounty hunters make me nervous when they come in here. I always feel like they're trying to guess what my head would be worth if they brought it in.

Ordo.nm03aecand06088_.mp3: Glad to hear it. I'll be waiting right here.
Ordo.nm03aecand06091_.mp3: Getting in won't be easy: the Sith base is protected by an encrypted security system. It would take a top of the line astromech droid to slice through it.
Ordo.nm03aecand06093_.mp3: But that little T3 unit you got from Janice should be good enough to get the job done.
Ordo.nm03aecand06094_.mp3: Lucky for you I know just the place to get a droid like that. Davik was having one custom built by Janice Nall.
Ordo.nm03aecand07014_.mp3: Too bad. I was looking forward to cracking some heads.
Ordo.nm04aacand02004_.mp3: Settle down, kid. We've already lost enough men to those damn rakghouls! The last thing we need now is more casualties from a needless firefight.
Ordo.nm04aacand02006_.mp3: Hm... by looks of you I'd say you're down here for the same reason we are: to salvage something from those downed Republic space pods.
Ordo.nm04aacand02008_.mp3: Let me give you some advice: forget about it. Do yourself a favor and just head back the way you came.
Ordo.nm04aacand02010_.mp3: Mandalorians don't make threats, we make promises. But I'm just trying to give you a friendly warning.
Ordo.nm04aacand02013_.mp3: This isn't a good place to stand around chatting. The Undercity is crawling with rakghouls. I've already lost half a dozen men to those monsters.
Ordo.nm04aacand02017_.mp3: Looks like we've got company! Get those blasters ready, boys!
Ordo.nm04aacand02023_.mp3: Trying to pick a fight with a Mandalorian - I can see you're not too bright. But I'm on a mission for Davik, so I don't have time for fun and games.
Ordo.nm04aacand02025_.mp3: Damn! I told Davik this salvage mission was a bad idea! His men aren't trained for this kind of thing, and I can't babysit them all!
Ordo.nm04aacand02027_.mp3: Okay, boys... we're getting out of here before I lose anyone else. I can't carry all this salvage back by myself!
Ordo.nm04aacand02029_.mp3: You'd be smart to get out of here as well. Even if you can handle the rakghouls I doubt there's anything worth finding anymore.
Ordo.nm04aacand02031_.mp3: Davik sent me down here with this motley crew to scavenge whatever we could from the Republic escape pods that crashed during the recent battle overhead.
Ordo.nm04aacand02033_.mp3: But the Lower City gangs got here first. Anything worthwhile in those Republic pods is probably in their hands now. Davik won't like that.
Ordo.nm04aacand02035_.mp3: What are you, an off-worlder? Everybody knows Davik. He's a member of the Exchange. You know - the interstellar crime syndicate.
Ordo.nm04aacand02037_.mp3: Smuggling, gambling, extortion - Davik controls it all here on Taris. That's why I'm working for him. But lately the Lower City gangs have been giving my boss some trouble.
Ordo.nm04aacand02039_.mp3: This isn't really the place to have these kind of conversations. But I guess I could spare a couple seconds for you - after all, you did help us out with those rakghouls.
Ordo.nm04aacand02041_.mp3: The Lower City is overrun with gangs, but the two most important ones are the Hidden Beks and the Black Vulkars. Used to be the Beks were the big dog and kept the others in line.
Ordo.nm04aacand02043_.mp3: But lately the Black Vulkars are moving in on Bek turf and challenging them for control. The Vulkars are even starting to defy Davik!
Ordo.nm04aacand02045_.mp3: Take these escape pods, for example. Everyone knew Davik would want first crack at them, but I know for a fact those damn Vulkars have already sent their own salvage party down here.
Ordo.nm04aacand02047_.mp3: I think you're a fool to stay down here, but you did help us out in the battle with those rakghouls. I guess I could give you a little tip to make your life easier.
Ordo.nm04aacand02049_.mp3: Davik had us looking for two escape pods. According to our info, one crashed just to the west of here and the other is somewhere to the northeast.
Ordo.nm04aacand02051_.mp3: You might be able to find something worthwhile inside one of them. As for me, I'm getting back to the surface before I lose my whole company.
Ordo.nm04aacand02054_.mp3: Normally I'd make you regret those words, but I'm not wasting another minute down here. I'm responsible for this whole company, and they won't survive down here much longer.
Ordo.nm04aacand02056_.mp3: Come on boys... let's move out!
Ordo.nm08aacand04000_.mp3: Let's get this ship fired up. We'll pick up the rest of your friends and then we have to get off this planet!
Ordo.nm08aadavi08004_.mp3: Watch yourself, Calo. You may be the newest kath hound in the pack, but you aren't top dog yet!
Ordo.nm08aadavi08008_.mp3: This is a special case, Davik. I ran into someone the Exchange might want to recruit. You may have heard something of their exploits already.
Ordo.nm08aadavi08047_.mp3: Okay, we're inside. Now all we have to do is figure out a way to get past the Ebon Hawk's security system and we can get the rest of your group and get off this planet!
Ordo.nm08aadavi08049_.mp3: No sense waiting around here, though. The sooner we get off Taris the better.
Ordo.nm08aadavs10004_.mp3: Heh. Now this is my kind of place!
Ordo.nm08aahudr11011_.mp3: We've got what we came for. We should get going.
Ordo.nm13aacand03000_.mp3: I don't think we can delay much here. We should fight our way out as quickly as possible.
Ordo.nm13aacand03001_.mp3: This looks like the end of our partnership. The battle we fight here will change the face of the galaxy.
Ordo.nm13aacand03002_.mp3: You, Revan, are the single greatest warrior of this age, and any battle we fight will bring me honor. I'll stay by your side through anything.
Ordo.nm13aacand03003_.mp3: I don't think I'm ready to give up this life of mine, this life of fighting, not quite yet. We have things we need to do here.
Ordo.nm13aacand03004_.mp3: I'm your man until the end, whatever path you take.
Ordo.nm13aacand03005_.mp3: I've been given a challenge I can't ignore. We've got to go to the dune seas of Tatooine so I can find Jagi and kill him for his insult to me!
Ordo.nm13aacand03008_.mp3: This is between me and Jagi. You don't have to get involved. If you're lucky, he might spill something before I spread him in a paste over the dunes.
Ordo.nm13aacand03010_.mp3: The sooner we get to Tatooine the better.
Ordo.nm13aacand03011_.mp3: I... I think this has affected me in ways that I didn't anticipate... I think I'll need time to sort things out.
